story: We are raising money to cover the costs of pressing the vinyl records and printing the jackets. Since the recording is done, We are only seeking manufacturing costs for the new release. We paid for studio time out of our own pockets, and are pretty excited about the results we got in the studio!

story:
Short Summary

We are The Golden Novak Band - a group of musicians based in and around Syracuse, NY and we're on a mission from God (like the Blues Brothers). It's all about the BAND, Elwood. The BAND.

Jess Novak and Brian Golden found each other when they first jammed on a festival stage in July of 2013. Novak was in the middle of making her solo album, Bad Habit, and it was missing something - she decided that something was Brian Golden. Since then, the duo has toured from Vermont to Florida, released that solo album (in Dec. 2013), a full band album (in Sept. 2014) and formally started The Golden Novak Band (in June 2014).

Less than a year later, the duo (now joined by another songwriter/multi-instrumentalist, Mark Nanni), has more than THREE ALBUMS worth of ORIGINAL material (that's more than 30 songs), a new van to pay off and lofty goals. The GNB train is moving - FAST - and it needs YOUR HELP to keep chugging. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the thing - a band is like any other start-up. Initial costs outweigh initial gains. Though we're playing more than 200 shows every year while working other jobs - we've still got to pay for:

 - that van (Pepper Potts)

 - recording time for our new album: RODEO

 - tape (hell YES, we record to tape) 

 - CD production/reproduction and design (holler at Robyn Stockdale!)

 - gas to GET to gigs

 - promotional materials

 - our PR guy (Doug Deutsch in the house!) 

 - equipment and repairs (Nanni's squeeze box is from the 1950's...just sayin'), etc. 

 - All of this adds up to MUCH more than $5,000, but even raising that much will totally change our world. 

Being in a band is a ton of fun, but it's also a ton of work. We give everything inside of ourselves emotionally, creatively and physically at gigs and we work the smart part of our brains all day booking and promoting those gigs - plus those other jobs. (Seriously, I dare you all to find someone more driven than Novak.)

SO - for every cent you give, we will give it back to you in the blood, sweat and tears that goes into the music - PLUS - we've got some amazing give-backs for you listed on the right side of the page. Check 'em out!

The Impact

Music makes the world go 'round. It is a universal language and there is a sincere need for sincere music on this planet. GNB is about ORIGINAL, SOUL music. It's about reaching in and laying it all out in the song - both in words and melodies. Every bit you contribute will help us bring that music to more people. 

Risks & Challenges

Golden quit his job to be a musician. Novak gave up writing full time (though she's got her master's degree in journalism) to play. Nanni has dedicated his entire life to conquering the keys (and pretty much every instrument). We are not giving up. The money you send our way will be put to good use. We believe in the band and we believe in the music. We hope you do, too. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We're all strapped for cash. Whether you can donate $5 or $500 - it's appreciated. And if you really can only afford to spread the word - we thank you for that, too. Tell a friend, come to a show, send us note saying you dig the tunes - it's all valued and we THANK YOU from the bottom of our hearts for any and all that you do. <3

The GNB family includes:

Jess Novak, Brian Golden, Mark Nanni, Jeff Moleski (Moletrax Studios), Paul Puzzullo, Nick Andrews, Randy Heuer, Jordan Davies, Byron Cage, Josh DeKaney, Robyn Stockdale & Bob Kane (Graphik Nature Studios) and many more. 

GNB would also like to thank and welcome The Haydenfilms Institute, an educational film non-profit, into the family. They are GNB's fiscal-sponsor and helped create the amazing video you've seen here. THAT SAID - all donations ARE eligible to be tax deductible. BIG thanks to HFI. (Check them out!)

We're a big, growing family! And we love YOU!

story:
I'm Jeffrey Jones - a community public radio DJ on WOJB, volunteer talent booker for The Park Center in Hayward WI and owner/operator of YRSONG Productions LLC.. A few short weeks ago, a simple inquiry from a favorite musician about a possible local gig quickly mushroomed into a 6-artist Labor Day Weekend music festival extravaganza...

Really, I mean check out this incredible lineup: From Nashville-by-way-of Ashland County WI - Hugh Masterson, and a MN Original Frankie Lee who is working out of Nashville these days, as well. Also featuring Jack Klatt, Feeding Leroy, Chris Koza and SonofMel.

This campaign is about making sure this dream lineup is paid for their talents...of course they all are worth their weight in gold, but have agreed to perform for bargain-basement prices..and covering the production costs of bringing this golden music to the ears of our Musique Du Nord Festival attendees.

It is also about growing and nurturing an annual event to bring top-flight musical talent, friends, family,food and a financial boost to local non-profits.

WITH YOUR GENEROSITY, we can maximize the proceeds that will, this year, benefit our local, no-kill shelter, the Northwoods Humane Society of Sawyer County. This organization introduced my family to two cherished canine family members over the last couple decades - Banjo and Max. This is just one way for us to give back...

Your generous help is very appreciated.

Thanks,

Jeffrey Jones, YRSONG Productions LLC

story:
Hear "Live Your Life" here: https://www.bodegasworld.com/
 
 

My name is Batsheva Levy aka Ms. Bodega, founder of Bodega World Music. I am a musician, dancer, producer, radio host and record label owner and I have partnered with G CUED (a U.N. affiliated Foundation) to help global youth!

 

#LiveYourLife Campaign: What is it?

#LiveYourLife is a world song and campaign that is socially empowering. The song was recorded by international artists who have joined together to call on people from around the world to create their own destinies and truly “LIVE” their lives. Often the impact of a song can be bigger than we think. Music is a tool for breaking down boundaries between people of all nations, cultures, and creeds.

 

Partners

Although raised in NYC, my background is a mix of Israeli Safardi (Spanish), Yemenite, Moroccan, Turkish and Dutch. Coming from so many different cultures makes me feel Rich. Rich, not as in money, but as in the richness of life. When exposed to different cultures, you can choose to celebrate the best parts of each. It creates expansion of the mind and spirit as you learn other people’s views, cultures, holidays, festivities, music, dance, traditions, clothing, fashion, languages, foods, tastes, smells and more! It expands all of our senses and makes us grow and connect to others in a deeper and more beautiful ways. I am reaching out to my international audience because I am ready to break down boundaries as a catalyst for unity and peace, through the #LiveYourLife campaign. Our international campaign has partnered with G-CUED, partner of UNESCO (the United Nations Organization for Education, Science and Culture), a non-profit organization that focuses on global youth. They combat issues in health, hygiene, clean water, education, and sports. They’re concentrated on supporting institutions and programs that serve at risk youth in underdeveloped or distressed communities. G-CUED and their new global project called "Raise Them Up" is partnering with Bodega World Music for the #LiveYourLife world music campaign to raise funds for the building of sustainable schools in Africa, the Caribbean and worldwide.

 

 

 

Which Artists are Involved?

Bodega World Music has decided to use music in a positive way to bridge between people of different cultures, languages, political/religious/socio-economic differences as a uniting force. The song currently features international artists Gyptian (Jamaica), MC Galaxy (Nigeria), Neza Africa (Rwanda/Canada), Ms.Bodega (US/Israel), Young D (Nigeria), and Neil Bajayo “Isrelly” (Israel). The song is in English, two African dialects, Jamaican, French, Spanish and some Hebrew.

 

How You Can Get Involved!

The #LiveYourLife song is already recorded/mixed and mastered, the funds from this campaign will be used to shoot the official music video. The music video will be used to promote the campaign message of #LiveYourLife starting in Africa, US/Canada, Israel, and Jamaica. Eventually, #LiveYourLife will be worldwide via Radio, TV, Blogs, Social Media, and News.

After many years of working to get my mission of International cross-cultural music and message out to the world, I have had some recent success in my collaborations in the new wave of the Afro-Pop music scene which is taking over airwaves. I have the team in place to produce videos and promote the music properly. #LiveYourLife fundraising campaign will support filming the #LiveYourLife music video. We have the product and the tools, we just need your contributions to produce and shoot the #LiveYourLife music video to help us spread the message and bring awareness to the ongoing issues.

 

 

We believe people from around the world will join us as we plan to empower others with our music, positive energy, and message.

 

 

Why Us?

 

You can see our successful track record with our prior release and tours including our latest single and music video release “Watta” by Ms.Bodega ft. Timaya and Young D inspired by the great Fela Kuti.

Our promo in Africa and worldwide has gone far and continues to grow rapidly every day. This can be seen by the consistent, rising number of views and fans on Youtube and Social Media. It can also be seen in the massive rotations we have on MTV, Trace TV, HipTV, Sound City, Silverbird TV, and more as well as the many News articles as seen on MTV, The Vanguard, Nigeria Daily news and on major blog sites such as Linda Ikeji and more.

Check out my feature on MTV about our Watta single: http://www.mtvbase.com/news/ms-bodega-teams-up-with-timaya-and-producer-young-d-on-watta/7y17sv
 

Ms. Bodega has performed “Watta” at two major award shows (Nigerian Entertainment Awards & African Entertainment Awards) and a festival (Tribeca Performing Arts Center). Ms.Bodega was also nominated for and won the Diaspora Award 2016 at African Entertainment Awards alongside legends like Akon, 50 Cent, and Nas. ‘Team Bodega’ has toured to many countries and cities including Senegal, Nigeria, Jamaica, Panama, Puerto Rico, Israel, Dubai and we plan to keep going.

In each of these locations, we have worked with artists, promoted on media, had live shows and connected with the local people of the region. All of this success also shows how boundaries have been broken down and crossed over as people of different countries and cultures connect and unite. We want to expand this even more.

 

 

Budget Outline & Schedule

We plan to shoot the video with the current 6 artists involved. As they are located in different countries we need budgets to either fly them to one location or to travel to shoot them in their respective countries.

We will try to keep the costs to a minimum, here is a basic rundown:

What we need: $30,000

Director/Video Crew $10,000

Travels and Accommodations for artists/crew $8,000

Equipment/Locations costs and fees $5,000

Hair Make-up/wardrobe/Stylists/food/logistics/local transport $3,000

Dancers/Cameos/Extras $2,000

Editing/Post Production $2,000

Perks:

#LiveYourLife Tank/Tshirt

#LiveYourLife Wristband/headband  

#LiveYourLife Hoodie

#LifeYourLife Campaign Salon Discount

 

 

Other Ways You Can Get Involved!

You may not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. You can help by spreading the word, offering perks/sponsorship, offering resources or your time to join our worldwide team. These things can help grow our mission and knock down costs.

You can also help by making noise by sharing/posting our Indiegogo campaign via link and spread the word of the #LiveYourLife campaign!

 

 

The Impact:

It is incredible and magical what a difference you can make through reaching out through music with a social message by inspiring people around the world. You can actually change people’s lives this way. When you inspire a soul it can go very far and even change lives and push people to expand and grow. With the right amount of funding and support, the more of an opportunity we have to make a BIGGER impact.

___________________________________________________

“… her own inventive sound brings hope and a breath of fresh air in its ability to blend worlds…”

- Yediot America

“Her deep soulful voice and culturally rich rhythms and catchy melodies touch many audiences connecting between world music and pop, as few have been able to do.”

- Jewish Exponent

____________________________________________________

 

Thank you so much for your time and contribution!

 

Warm regards,

Ms. Bodega

Bodega World Music

story:
Short Summary

SassafraZ debuted January 2011 with one goal in mind: bring a heavy dose of ambitious yet likably fresh music to the public with a special interest in people who want to rock hard but still like to shake a posterior now and then. We have been entertaining audiences from the stage for the past five years by playing hundreds of shows for thousands of satisfied concert-goers. Our group has played in every major city from Gainesville FL to Toronto, Ontario, even stopping in Manhattan to record a live album at The Bitter End. SassafraZ is nothing short of a song writing powerhouse; a veritable 6-person Brill Building (though we don’t have Carol King, God bless that woman). We have continuously brought new tunes to our shows which range in style from prog to jazz rock fusian, funk, soul, jam, and straight up rock and roll.

 

Fans have been begging us for a new CD to throw in their cars and computers so in response we hit the studio for three days and recorded as much material as we could spending all the money we had. 30 hours of studio time at Columbus’ very own Sonic Lounge (Bless you, Viers, Damron, and Davis) have yielded us 20 tracks of material, but it simply wasn’t enough time to record any vocals or wind instruments, and we still need to lay down synthesizers and a few electric piano tracks. What we have right now are 20 beautiful songs with drums, bass, guitars, and some light electric piano waiting to be finished up and printed. The only thing standing between us and giving the people what they want: Money. The writing process never stops, either. By the time we print the next wave of CD’s we will be looking to record our next batch of 20 songs. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are setting our goal at $10,000. We have already invested $2,000 on initial tracking, and we expect the final budget to exceed $15,000. Here is a basic breakdown of our expenses:

TRACKING

$2,000 - Drums, bass, guitar, keys (already done)

$1,500 - Vocals (3  days)

$1,000 - Horns (2 days)

$1,000 - Guitar/keys overdubs (2 days)

MIXING/MASTERING 

$5,000 (estimated cost at $50 an hour—5 hours per song)

MANUFACTURING/DISTRIBUTION/ADVERTISING

$5,000

ESTIMATED TOTAL 

$15,500 

Rewards

We have compiled a bunch of goofily named rewards. We have a variety of packages with lots of fun stuff, some of which is ONLY available right here.

Rewards FAQ - for more detailed information about a particular reward package, send an email to sassafrazmusic@gmail.com and put REWARDS FAQ in the subject line. 

The Impact

With the release of new CD’s we are afforded the opportunity to make back every dollar spent and then put that money back into the music as we continue to write and hopefully record our material into countless new CD’s. Our goal is to release 20 tracks to the public every year. By contributing to this campaign you will not only help us finish this current project but you will be jumpstarting a process in which we create more fresh, beautiful, original music that will eventually reach the entire globe.

Risks & Challenges

We Have always been susceptible to bear attacks but considering the bear population in Ohio there is no real risk involved here. We also have a full stock of bear mace, just in case. If you are worried about the quality of our product then you must listen to our debut album Time Will Tell. That album is a promise to the world that we will make pristine products with an unparalleled level of technological and musical quality.

Other Ways You Can Help

It is possible that you’ve read everything on this page leading up to here but you already know you cannot contribute money at this time. We thank you for your interest and want you to know that it would mean the world to us if you used the share tools on this website to help spread the word. You can even e-mail the link to this webpage to your friends and family, and then you become a huge contributing factor to the completion of our current project! Spread the word and let people know SassafraZ is not only working on something big, but that they are also asking for help.

We have compiled a bunch of goofily named rewards. We have a variety of packages with lots of fun stuff, some of which is ONLY available right here.
Rewards FAQ - for more detailed information about a particular reward package, send an email to sassafrazmusic@gmail.com and put REWARDS FAQ in the subject line. 

The Impact
With the release of new CD’s we are afforded the opportunity to make back every dollar spent and then put that money back into the music as we continue to write and hopefully record our material into countless new CD’s. Our goal is to release 20 tracks to the public every year. By contributing to this campaign you will not only help us finish this current project but you will be jumpstarting a process in which we create more fresh, beautiful, original music that will eventually reach the entire globe.

Risks & Challenges
We Have always been susceptible to bear attacks but considering the bear population in Ohio there is no real risk involved here. We also have a full stock of bear mace, just in case. If you are worried about the quality of our product then you must listen to our debut album Time Will Tell. That album is a promise to the world that we will make pristine products with an unparalleled level of technological and musical quality.

Other Ways You Can Help
It is possible that you’ve read everything on this page leading up to here but you already know you cannot contribute money at this time. We thank you for your interest and want you to know that it would mean the world to us if you used the share tools on this website to help spread the word. You can even e-mail the link to this webpage to your friends and family, and then you become a huge contributing factor to the completion of our current project! Spread the word and let people know SassafraZ is not only working on something big, but that they are also asking for help.

story:
Version française, cliquez ici

What is Poptastic Radio?


Based in Europe, in the south of France, Poptastic is an independent radio station that has broadcast in English on the Internet since May 31, 2013 to audiences worldwide (the US, Spain, United Kingdom, the Russian Federation, Germany, Australia, Japan, Canada, Ireland, Italy etc.). Its founder is a radio professional with 20 years of experience.
Our programme includes Modern Pop, Alternative Pop & Rock and British Pop & Rock. We play both single hits and album tracks. We have decided to avoid the typical top-40 format and propose a varied programme comprising selected musical genres. This is why we have chosen "Eclectic Pop Music" as our baseline.
Our concept is also based on minimum chatter and hand-crafted playlists, because we believe that no algorithm in the world can match “the human touch” and expertise.

Our team


Our team consists of professionals and amateur radio enthusiasts:
  • Miss G., English presenter and producer, reports what’s on and what’s not on London’s pop musical scene.
  • Paula, a young German programmer, enthusiast and expert in new musical trends
  • Roland, a French programmer who hosts a weekly one-hour show on progressive rock
  • Veronique, the female voice and the person in charge of our budget
  • Mike the "Voice Actor" - the famous and inimitable male voice of Poptastic Radio
  • and, finally, myself, Claude –founder and lead programmer.


A new way to promote emerging artists

Our choice is to showcase more than just modern pop music. Our peculiarity, and something we are very attached to, is to pair new independent artists with world-renowned pop icons. We believe that linking new artists with legendary artists gives these young talents much more credibility.


 Why our station is in danger?

From the very beginning, Poptastic Radio has been broadcast on a free streaming platform providing music catalogue and covering royalty fees, in exchange for advertising spaces. Perfect to embark on such a project but insufficient for further development.
Moreover, following administrative and financial issues, our streaming provider decided to geo-block radio stations (including Poptastic Radio) broadcasting in many countries and remove access to their music library.

Unfortunately, we can no longer work in those conditions and that's why the very existence of the station is now uncertain.
So we need to find a new professional streaming platform and reconstruct a music library very soon (up to now 80% of our music catalogue were provided by this streaming provider).

 What do we need to continue?

Our aim is to raise funds to cover migration costs (streaming and the purchase of a music library), as well as operating costs for a year (hosting, purchase of new titles, cover the royalty fees, advertising). Advertising thus far imposed by the current provider (and from which we do not benefit in any way) will be replaced by the sale of advertising space limited to 2 x 2 min per hour and revenues generated in this manner will gradually replace the collected funds, in order to ensure the radio’s financial autonomy expected in the following year. The remaining income is generated through merchandising and contributions of the radio’s active members.


More specifically, our project rests on three major axes.
Our goal is to raise USD 15,400. Funds will be dedicated to a number of purposes:

  • Internet Radio streaming (including royalty fees)
    Raising funds in order to enter into a streaming structure on a commercial platform that is recognized for the quality of its services, its dynamism and responsiveness. This is the very foundation of our own activities. Like any other radio station, Poptastic Radio strives to be broadcast without interruption and provide its listeners with an excellent sound quality.
    Amount: USD 3,600
  • Music
    To date, 90% of the music we broadcast comes from the music library made available to us by the platform from which we intend to retire. We are, therefore, obliged to replenish our catalogue by purchasing the titles we used to play and regularly add new music to our collection. As we wish to respect copyright, we will abstain from illegal downloads. This represents a great investment, as our playlist currently consists of approximately 3,000 titles.
    Amount: USD 5,800
  • Advertising
    The success and sustainability of an undertaking like ours requires advertising and permanent visibility. Your efforts, combined with ours, will only be rewarded if we manage to attract a loyal and growing audience; this, however, requires a viable and efficient advertising campaign. Overlooking this aspect is a common mistake, as has been evident in other similar projects. We want to avoid this. The visibility of Poptastic Radio, just as in the case of any other business, must be founded on traditional methods: flyers, posters, partnerships and - obviously in priority - online advertising. This is another area that will require funding.
    Amount: USD 6,000



  For more information, fell free to contact us.

______________________________________________
Français


Poptastic Radio en quelques mots

Basée en Europe, dans le sud de la France, Poptastic est une radio indépendante qui diffuse sur Internet en anglais depuis le 31 Mai 2013, dont l'audience est mondiale (Etats-Unis, Espagne, Royaume-Uni, Russie, Allemagne, Australie, Japon, Canada, Italie...).

Son fondateur est un professionnel de la radio ayant 20 années d'expérience dans ce domaine.

Nous proposons un format composé de Modern Pop music, Alternative Pop & Rock, British Pop & Rock. Notre programmation est faite de titres connus (singles) mais aussi de titres d'albums.
Notre différence : éviter un format Top 40 et proposer une programmation variée autour de son format de prédilection. C'est pour cela que nous avons choisi l'expression "Eclectic Pop Music" pour notre baseline.

Notre concept s'appuie aussi sur l'idée de limiter les bavardages et de proposer des playlists "fabriquées à la main", parce que nous sommes persuadés qu'aucun algorithme au monde ne remplacera l'expertise et le feeling d'un humain.

L'équipe

L'équipe est composée de spécialistes professionnels de la radio ou amateurs, tous véritables passionnés de musiques :

  • Miss G., présentatrice et productrice anglaise. Miss G présente une pastille, diffusée plusieurs fois dans la semaine, sur l'actualité de la scène Pop à Londres et au Royaume-Uni.
  • Paula, jeune recrue et programmatrice d'origine allemande, spécialiste des nouveaux courant musicaux.
  • Roland, programmateur français (dont le berceau était probablement trop près des enceintes), propose une heure par semaine de Rock Progressif.
  • Véronique, la douce voix féminine et aussi la "Madame Money" de l'organisation.
  • Mike "Voice Actor" la célèbre et inimitable voix masculine de Poptastic Radio.
  • et moi-même, Claude, fondateur et programmateur principal.


Une nouvelle façon de promouvoir les nouveaux talents

Notre force est également de donner du temps d'antenne aux artistes émergents en évitant de les mettre dans une case à part. Notre particularité, à laquelle nous sommes très attachés et de mixer ces nouveaux artistes avec d'autres artistes Pop mondialement reconnus, voire légendaires. Nous croyons que le fait d'enchainer un nouvel artiste avec une icône de la Pop music donne beaucoup plus de crédibilité aux nouveaux talents.


 Aujourd'hui, nous avons besoin de vous pour continuer

Depuis le début, Poptastic Radio est diffusée sur une plateforme de streaming gratuite fournissant catalogue de musique et couvrant les frais de redevances, en échange d'espaces publicitaires. Parfait pour démarrer un projet, mais insuffisant envisager un développement futur.
En outre, aujourd'hui cette société connaît de sérieux problèmes administratifs, financiers et juridiques. Récemment, suite à ces ennuis, les ressources mises à disposition ont été réduites. A l'heure actuelle, la diffusion est encore assurée mais restreinte dans plusieurs pays.
Voilà pourquoi l'existence même de la radio est maintenant incertain.

 De quoi avons-nous besoin pour continuer ?

Notre démarche vise à collecter des fonds pour couvrir les frais de migration (streaming et acquisition d'une librairie musicale) ainsi que les frais de fonctionnement pour une année (hébergement, achat de nouveaux titres, droits d'auteurs, communication). La publicité, actuellement imposée par le prestataire actuel (sur laquelle nous ne bénéficions d'aucun reversement) sera remplacée par la vente en interne d'espaces publicitaires limités à 2 x 2 mn par heure, dont les revenus vont progressivement se substituer aux fonds collectés sur IndieGogo, jusqu'à garantir l'autofinancement de la radio, dès l'année suivante. Le reste des revenus provenant de merchandising et des cotisations des membres actifs de la radio.


Notre but est de collecter USD 15,400 (environ 13,600 €).
Plus précisément, notre projet à ce jour est basé sur trois axes importants.
Les contributions seront utilisées selon ces différentes façons :

  • Streaming audio et droits d'auteur
    Récolter des fonds pour intégrer une nouvelle structure de diffusion en streaming sur une plateforme payante connue et reconnue pour la qualité de ses services, son dynamisme et sa réactivité. C'est la base même de notre fonctionnement. Comme tout autre radio, Poptastic Radio a besoin d'une diffusion sans interruption et d'une excellente qualité du son.
    Montant : USD 3,600 (environ 3200 €)
  • Musique (discothèque)
    Notre programmation est, à ce jour, constituée à 90% de titres provenant de la librairie musicale mis à notre disposition par la plateforme dont nous souhaitons nous séparer. Nous sommes donc dans l'obligation de reconstituer ce catalogue en achetant l'ensemble des titres qui le composent et de l'enrichir régulièrement de nouveaux titres. Comme nous tenons à respecter le principe du droit d'auteur, il n'est pas question pour nous de procéder à des téléchargements illégaux. Par conséquent, cela représente un investissement important car notre programmation est actuellement composée d'environ 3000 titres.
    Montant : USD 5,800 (environ 5100 €)
  • Communication
    La réussite et la pérennité d'une entreprise comme celle-ci passe par la communication et une visibilité permanente. Vos efforts et nos efforts ne seront récompensés que par une audience fidèle et grandissante, que nous n'obtiendrons pas si nous faisons l'impasse sur la communication. C'est une erreur fréquente que nous constatons dans d'autres projets similaires. Nous voulons l'éviter. La visibilité de Poptastic Radio, comme tout autre entreprise, passe par la communication traditionnelle : flyers, affiches, partenariats et bien évidemment et en priorité la publicité en ligne. C'est aussi pour cela que nous avons besoins de fonds.
    Montant : USD 6,000 (environ 5300 €)

Pour plus d'informations ou si vous souhaitez en savoir plus sur les contreparties, n'hésitez pas à nous contacter.

story:
Sugar Relics: White Flags E.P.

I have a great new E.P that I am ready to record, but nothing in life is free, as well all know. So, I need your help! If you can make a donation, however small, it would mean a lot to me! I want to get you more Laura Serafine for your ears and iPods. :) A little about me for those that do not know:

  • Born in San Antonio TX, this Los Angeles based artist is best known for her powerful vocals that can fill a room. Laura is incredibly versatile vocally, and as a result, her songs are diverse and often unique from one another. With background in jazz, rock, musical theater and opera, Laura is continually reinventing her sounds through creative songwriting. Sugar Relics is the newest incarnation of music that she is excited to work on, and share with you. 

    Described as a mix of musical theater belting-diva and songwriting songbird, Laura blends emotionally powerful vocals with sultry piano and lyrics for a unique experience.  Sugar Relics will invite a new electronic component for hauntingly intoxicating new sounds.  

  • This new E.P will be nothing like anything I have ever recorded before. I am experimenting with my music, and I am incredibly excited to show you a side of me that you have never seen! 
  • With your help, I will be able to release the first E.P "White Flags" for my new project "Sugar Relics" . This will mean the world to me, because I am finally branching out into a new genre, which I have been wanting to do for years now. My music is my life, and I will never stop making it, but with your help, I can make it better!


What I Need & What You Get

Here's the details:

  • I am trying to raise $4000. This is not the total cost of the E.P., but this is the amount that I would need, combined with my own funds, to complete the project. This covers recording, production, studio time, mixing and mastering.
  • From T-shirts to a copy of the E.P., your donation will get you some sweet perks as well as my eternal gratitude. 
  • If I don't reach my entire goal, the fund will still go towards the E.P., I will just have to come up with more on my own which will delay the project. But I won't stop fighting! This is my passion project and I want to see it come alive! 

The Impact

For years now, I have been trying to create this E.P which steps outside of my usual singer/songwriter genre, and into a fusion world of TripHop/Witch House and Electronica. It's long been a passion of mine, and I want to finally see it come to life. Though I will always be inspired by Tori Amos and the girl-with-her-piano world, I want to create music more aligned with what I hear in my head. Help me bring it out of my heart and into the world.  

Risks & Challenges

This is going to be a whole new sound for me. With that comes some challenges:

  • If I can't raise the money, I will record and release the E.P. no matter what. It will just take longer. I may also not be able to do as many songs. 
  • If I run into issues along the way, I know that I can make it work due to my years and years of experience as a musician and performer. I am also working with an incredible production team who I trust entirely to help bring this vision to life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? Thats ok, here is what you can do:

  • Share my campaign link!!! Get it all over the social medias! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Summary

Thank you for viewing this campaign! My name is Ivan Morin and I am trying to fund two of my dreams at once: releasing an ep and raising money for college.
I dropped out of high school when I was 18 and I was a wreck. Over the years, I have always wanted to go back to school but I never felt like I had the time and would always make excuses. Earlier this year, I decided I had to make sacrifices in order to pursue my dreams. I have been writing and playing music since I was 12 and my goal is to become an audio engineer. I have been working a part-time job to make time for GED classes and I'm about a quarter of the way there! I have never been closer to graduating, but I know it doesn't end there. In order to reach my destination, college courses are a must. 

It's been a rough few years since I've been out of school. I have a beautiful wife who has stayed with me through thick and thin and she always stood behind anything I've tried to do. I have an incredible three year old son, who has ultimately been my biggest inspiration in this. I want nothing more than to make my family happy. I'm tired of living check to check. I'm tired of driving myself to a job I'm not happy with at 4 in the morning and working too hard for too little, only to daydream of a better life. I want what's best for me and my family.

If this campaign falls through, I will still work with everything in me to pursue my dreams, but I know I can't do it alone. 

Ultimately, I'm not asking for your money, but your prayers, advice, good vibes, and support. If you choose to give, please give what your heart tells you to. If you choose not to give, please send your love. If you choose not to share your love, that's fine because I am Loved anyway and so are you.

What I Need & What You Get

How much is given will depend on what you get. 
I'm only asking for $800 and as of right now, here are the costs of this campaign:

-$150 for CD printing and duplication 
-$200 for audio mastering
-$50 for stickers

This leaves me with $400 for college. 
The prices I've found are some of the cheapest for the best quality. 
However, if the goal is surpassed, I can add more shirts, music videos, or maybe even a small tour. Just keep in mind that regardless of the amount funded, at least half of it will go towards my college.

The Impact

I want to be as transparent with you as I can be. You can follow me on social media to see how this money is spent. I know that too often these projects are abused and taken for granted. This money is not for a shopping spree and some steak.

This is an opportunity for me to follow my dreams and support my family as an outcome. I also hope to inspire many other people to do the same. It is never too late for you to chase after your calling.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with others! I would appreciate any support, prayers, love, advice, good vibes, or cookies you can offer.

story:
(english see below)

Femme Rebellion ist ein D.I.Y. Musikfestival, das Musiker_innen und Musikinteressierten jeglichen Geschlechts einen open space zur Verfügung stellen möchte, um mit den bisher immer noch geltenden sexistischen Rollenverteilungen in der Musikszene zu brechen.

Anfang der 1990er Jahren starteten eine Menge Frauen- und gemischtgeschlechtliche Bands ausgehend von der Riot Grrrl Bewegung in den USA eine Art Rebellion, um die herrschenden sexistischen Selbstverständlichkeiten in Musikzusammenhängen zu überwinden. Leider konnten heute über 20 Jahre später immer noch keine Bahn brechenden Veränderungen in dieser Hinsicht erreicht werden. Mit dem Femme Rebellion Festival wollen wir daher versuchen, an diesem Zustand etwas zu ändern indem wir das vielversprechende Feuer, das damals entzündet wurde wieder entfachen.

Der Name des Festivals ist inspiriert durch das Neska Rock („Mädels Rock“), einem kleinen baskischen Festival, 100% D.I.Y., dessen Ziel es ist aufzuzeigen, dass Musiker_innen kein bestimmtes Geschlecht haben müssen, und durch die Femme Rebellion Tour, bei der die beiden gemischtgeschlechtlichen spanischen Bands Milenrama und Penadas por la Ley, durch Spanien ziehen, um andere gemischte Bands mit ihrer Idee anzustecken und so einen sexismusfreien Raum im Musikkontext entstehen zu lassen. Mit dem Femme Rebellion Festival am 21. Oktober in Berlin (Tommyhaus) und am 22. Oktober in Hamburg (Centro Sociale) wollen wir diesen Spirit aufgreifen und auch in Deutschland verbreiten. Dafür haben wir die beiden spanischen Bands, die in ihren Land bereits für Unruhe sorgen, und ein paar Bands aus der BRD eingeladen.

Gerade in der Punkszene, wo schon seit langem über Sexismus diskutiert wird, ist es in der Praxis immer noch nicht selbstverständlich, dass Gleichberechtigung wirklich praktiziert wird. Daher wollen wir zusammen mit allen, die sich von unserem Anliegen angesprochen fühlen, beginnen einen Raum in Musikzusammenhängen zu erkämpfen, in dem es eines Tages keine Hierarchien und keinen Sexismus mehr gibt.

100% D.I.Y. , frei von Sexismus, Rassismus und Geldgier.

Fühlt euch eingeladen und macht mit! Unterstützt unser Vorhaben, kommt zu den Konzerten, und helft uns dabei eine schönere Welt zu erschaffen!

Mit Eurer Hilfe werden wir die Anreise für die Bands bezahlen können sowie die Technik, Verpflegung, Werbung etc.

Es gibt viele Wege, wie Ihr uns unterstützen könnt. Ihr könnt eines unserer wunderschönen T-Shirts kaufen, eine Eintrittskarte für ein unvergessliches Konzert oder einfach so Geld spenden. Ihr könnt auch allen Euren Freund_innen, Tanten, Cousins und Großeltern von unserem Festival erzählen und dafür begeistern. So oder so: we will love you forever!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Femme Rebellion is a D.I.Y. Festival that wants to establish a non hierarchical space for musicians and music lovers of all gender.

At the beginning of the 90s many bands within the Riot Grrrl movement started a rebellion in order to fight for equal rights for women on the stage. After so many years we still have a long way to go.

Inspired by the Neska Rock, a small festival in the Basque Country, and the Femme Rebellion tour of the two Spanish bands Milenrama and Penadas por la Ley, we want to bring this spirit to Germany and be a part of this new attempt.

Four Bands, two locations, a lot of good music, 100% D.I.Y., free from sexism, racism and money-madness.

Feel free to join us, help us to make this real and spread the word!

With your money we will be able to pay the trip for the bands, technics, food, promotion and so on.

There are several ways that you can support us by either buying our beautiful shirts, a ticket for an unforgettable concert or simply by donating some money. You can also tell all your friends, aunts, cousins and grandparents about our festival and share the spirit. Anyway we will love you forever!

story:
CYN

For those of you who do not know me, my name is Cynthia Gillet whose musical alter ego is CYN. I am a French EMD/art rock artist, guitarist, bassist, vocalist, performer and composer. 

Having first made a name for myself in Europe with musicians Guy Pratt (of Pink Floyd & Killing Joke), Rodrique Janois (of the hugely successful musical productions Mozart L'Opera Rock and Les Amants), and world-renowned guitarist and producer Chris Spedding, it is fair to say that I first gained notoriety as an original artist with my bands Sheena and Keny. 

In 2012, I was invited to come to the U.S. to join American recording artist Rocky Hensel. Since being in America, I have played as both a guitarist and bassist with several world and regional touring acts including triple-platinum mega star Billy Ray Cyrus, metal band Venrez, hard rock band Domenica, and world music artists Adaawe.

Striking out once again on my own as CYN, I am now asking for your support to help me gain momentum as  solo electronica artist through my next release, which is entitled AWAKE.

What CYN Needs & What YOU Get

I'm turning to you -- my community of musical saints -- to assist in launching this effort and help me move my solo career to the next level. As I'm sure many of you already know, making and successfully promoting original music in today's musical landscape is still not an easy or inexpensive endeavor. 

The base goal of this campaign is designed to cover the following costs:

Pre-production, Production, Recording, Mixing: $6800

Mastering: $1400

Artwork - Album Design: $500

CD Manufacturing: $1034

Credit Card and IndieGogo fees (combined 8%): $950

Indiegogo Perks: $1425

 

While self-production is more feasible today for artists, the vast amount of music being produced makes it more difficult for even established artists to garner the kinds of audiences needed to sustain visibility. This is why I have also set extended "blue sky" goals to help cover the cost of video production and initial touring in 3 of America''s largest and most recognizable cities. 

So, if my base goal of $12,000 is met and more funds are raised, the "blue sky" goal of $17,500 -- or an additional funding request of $5,500 -- will be used to cover the following expenses:

Professional Video for the radio track: $3500

Tour support for travel to 2 shows (NYC) and 1 show San Francisco $2000

********************************************************************

Ways You Can Help My Indiegogo Campaign and Support Me As An Independent Artist

If you believe in me and my music, there are many ways you can help me launch the Awake CD and Tour

  • Become my heart, muse, angel, archangel  or twin flame and make a financial contribution to  this campaign today
  • Help me make some noise about my "Awake" campaign by sharing about it on Facebook and all other social media outlets using Indiegogo's share tools.
  • Let people know how they can link to me and previous releases through my website www.musicbycyn.com.

story:
Sol Drop is Kathryn Meyers, Brian Dorsey, and Sean Buechel-a trio of college students/musicians. We're bringing our first studio album "It's Alright" to fruition! 

It all started back at Northern Arizona University in February 2015. Within two weeks of meeting and forming, we were actively playing and booking shows in Flagstaff, AZ and the Phoenix metro area. Six months later, we were headed to Southern California on our first tour! The following school year brought almost more than one show per week, and enough local support for us to consider creating our first professional studio album. The money we had saved from all of our shows helped cover costs of recording and production with John Hererra at Clamsville Productions in Chandler, Arizona. While creating a physical album with hand-painted custom artwork by local Flagstaff artist Anartsy, we will also be distributing our music online. The album "It's Alright" will feature original 5 songs, including the single "Fake" available online August 3rd! Each purchase of the album also includes 2 free downloads "Better Than Chocolate" and "Change Your Mind"! Our hope is to draw people into our music and leave them with a product that makes them want to dance, share it with their friends, listen to it in the car. Every little bit of support helps us reach our goal of sharing our music and merchandise with as many people as possible!

For those interested in pre-ordering the album for $5, you will also receive the 2 free songs before the album is even released! Other packages are available for purchase, and even those who aren't available to contribute can keep the campaign running by sharing with friends who love music! We are thankful for each person who supports our band in even the smallest of ways.

story:
About Us-The Sleepless Elite:
My husband Baylor Carter (Drums), and I, Carolina Kehoe (Electric Ukulele, Guitar, Lead Vocals) moved from Livingston, Montana, so I could attend the Berklee School of Music. While enrolled there, I was faced with the stark reality of meeting the foreseeable tuition requirements, or writing and performing the type of music I always longed to play. During this time I met Ben Deily of The Lemonheads, who urged me to begin composing my own music. Having never played guitar before, I plugged my ukulele into a Fender amp with the distortion on high and found something I liked. From that session The Sleepless Elite was born.

“BEING COOL IS FREE” (but the recording of it isn’t)

Being Cool Is Free” is the 10 song LP follow-up to “Carolina’s War,” our debut EP produced earlier this year and currently in rotation. Since our first album was entirely self-funded and produced, we learned a thing or two about how to make the next album better. As a result of our debut album, a friend in California handed our two singles, “Friends” and “Games,” to his friend and co-worker, Matt Pavolaitis, a two-time Emmy® Awarded composer and mixer. Before I knew it we were invited to Los Angeles to record a song with Matt and his producing partner, Brett Cookingham. And now, with the help of their technical prowess, we can’t wait to record “Being Cool Is Free.”

Here are the singles from our first album:

Friends- https://soundcloud.com/thesleeplesselite/friends

I Don't Remember- https://soundcloud.com/thesleeplesselite/i-dont...

Games- https://soundcloud.com/thesleeplesselite/games

What We Need & What You Get

Where your Indiegogo funds are going.

(46%) Recording 10 songs: $7,000 (includes production, studio time, vocal tracking, mixing and mastering, and recording artist(s). This fee also includes the re-mixing/re- mastering of “Friends” and“Games” for radio-ready standards; and a final playback for all songs in a “big room” where feature film and television mixes are engineered.

(16%) Travel, food and accommodations from Livingston, Montana, to Los Angeles, and back again. $2,500

(29-34%) Manufacturing and marketing. $4,150-4,900

(4-9%) transaction fees. $600-1,350

 

Risks & Challenges

Please know we have already secured a reduced weekly rate for the studio; this is only guaranteed by our stringent work ethic and a promise to be “ready-to- go” when we walk in to record the album. We are acutely aware of studio and production charges, and how easily they can multiply. We are planning for a tight, five-day recording session with a one day buffer for surprises, if any. These fees are the bare minimum, any overages from the Indiegogo campaign will go toward enhanced manufacturing and marketing of the album, and perhaps a self-produced video of the singles. Of course, any amount we receive from people like you is greatly appreciated. This being our first campaign, we want to impress and earn the trust of those who extend their graciousness to us. We want to make every donor feel their hard-earned money is going to a cause from which they can be proud. In the end, if we can make new friends along the way, well, we’d like that too…

Other Ways You Can Help

It is alright if you don't have the funds to help us. We still love you. But you can help by spreading the word on social media and with your friends. Anything is appreciated. Thank you!

story:
http://baltimorejazz.weebly.com

Short Summary

Greetings and Bright Moments! Jazz History lovers,

You are invited to join us in this a great opportunity to participate in the preservation of Baltimore's awesome Jazz legacy and heritage. I am Tamm E Hunt, singer, songwriter, journalist, producer, curator, editor, researcher and author of BALTIMORE JAZZ Movers, Shakers and Music Makers A NEW HISTORY. 

http://baltimorejazz.weebly.com

My fascination with the lush history and legacy of Baltimore Jazz has been an ongoing love affair for the past 10 +years, and as I continue to discover and learn how influential Baltimore is to the foundation of Jazz in America, I am compelled to share a new story about Baltimore the "Unsung Mecca of Jazz & Blues." 

Through my findings, we discover Baltimore movers, shakers and music makers both African American and Caucasian who have made and make the home of the Star Spangled Banner a major center, contributor, incubator and host for the proliferation of America's indigenous music, called Jazz.  

Now, we invite you to join us in broadening the awareness of Baltimore's lush legacy and musical heritage celebrating the icons who played a major role in the little-known story about Baltimore's contributions to America's indigenous music. Become a supporter and assist our team in reaching our goal of $50,000 to publish this dynamic encyclopedia of Baltimore Jazz and the significant role Baltimore plays in American music yesterday and today.

http://baltimorejazz.weebly.com

Through, chronicles and historical accounts, biographies and vintage images  BALTIMORE JAZZ curated by Tamm E Hunt pays tribute to the homegrown talents of Andy and Ethel Ennis, Blanche and Cab Calloway, Billie Holiday, James Hubert "Eubie" Blake, Gary Bartz, Ann Wiggins Brown, Elmer Snowden, Ellery Eskelin, Ellis Larkin, Chick Webb, John Kirby, among many others who  more commonly represent the historical jazz of Baltimore as international stars on the world stage.  Not forgetting the lesser celebrated greatness of O'Donel Levy, Carlos Johnson, Sallie Blair, Mickey & Shirley Fields, Edward "Chico" Johnson, Nevetta, "Tiny"Tim Harris, Jimmy Wilson, Lady Rebecca, Adrienne Brooks, BiBi Fatima, Ruby Glover, Earl Wilson, Donald "Baby" Laurence Jackson, Delores Lynn, Whit Williams, Dr. John Lamkin, Jr., Marlene Ross, Bob Butta, Albert Daley and many others whom you may know without forgetting those who got their breaks on infamous Pennsylvania Avenue, where Ethel "Sweet Mama Stringbean" Waters made her professional debut with "The Father of The Blues" W.C. Handy at the Colored Lincoln Theatre, Pearl Bailey was a "Hoochie" dancer picking up quarters off the tables between her legs down in "The Bottom" and moved up to higher ranks on the chorus line at the "Chitlin' Circuit's first stop; The Royal Theatre. Comedienne  Red Foxx, Sammy Davis, Jr, Miles Davis, Charlie Parker, Sonny Rollins, Julian "CannonBall" Adderly and Thelonius Monk played the "Lost Jazz Shrines"  at Ike Dixon's Comedy Club, the Casino and Gamby's, and other theaters on the "Street of Dreams."


See our website @ http://baltimorejazz.weebly.com

story:
Who am I?

My name is David Wall. I am the founder of GoodRoadNetwork, and music is my life.

As a young musician, I struggled with booking shows, breaking into new markets, and setting up tours.

Eventually, I came up with a process for booking and touring that worked extremely well. Soon other musicians, bands, indie labels, and booking agents were inquiring about my process to learn how to book the venues I was getting.

Life on the road - a.k.a. learning the hard way!

I’ve learned a lot while touring and found many things can go wrong.

Example …

On my first tour we borrowed a van and before we hit our first venue, some kid threw a rock through our window. This meant we couldn't leave anything in the van and had to unload everything every time we stopped.  I broke a tooth that same day and was in pain the entire trip.

The first venue on this tour was over 1300 miles away. They overbooked us and mismanaged the amount of time each band got to play. We didn't hit the stage that night till the venue had closed.

On our way home we hit a deer coming through the pass, nearly totalling the van we had borrowed. To make things almost comical, all of this happened during one of the worst forest fires in California history.  Our tour had us passing through some of the worst fire zones.  

I never want anyone to go through that kind of experience when they tour.  From tour contracts, to mapping alternative routes. From reviewing venues to triple AAA insurance. These are the things GoodRoadNetwork aims to solve in order to alleviate the stress of life on the road.

What IS GoodRoadNetwork?

GoodRoadNetwork (GRN) is a responsive, web-based, set of tools designed to help artists manage their careers.

GRN tools allow our members to build EPKs (Electronic Press Kit), book gigs, create tours, manage road schedules, promote events through multiple social networks, and much more!

GoodRoadNetwork eases planning, booking and playing gigs and tours by …

  • Connecting people, artists, and venues

  • Updating (through email, SMS, and/or notifications) schedule changes, task completion, and booking updates

  • Tracking expenses, gigs and tours, and fans

  • Creating tours, itineraries, and rider agreements

  • Sharing music, images, videos, and road stories


GoodRoadNetwork is a FREEMIUM service

We believe GRN’s core services should be made available to all musicians at any skill level. We will offer services that have subscription fees required, but it is important to us that all musicians be allowed access to our core set of tools. 


Take GoodRoadNetwork to the next level!

We have an amazing set of tools already available to our members. We just need a little help from you to take us to the next level.  

Money raised through this campaign will contribute to next level features that will elevate GRN's tools above what exists in the market today.


$1 = WORKING FOR TIPS

Every dollar really helps us out, and, like tips, it adds up! If you don't have much to offer but would still like to contribute, We would be very grateful. And we’re happy to add you to our newsletter.

$10 = SOCIAL NETWORKING

We will publicly thank you on Facebook & Twitter for contributing. We will also happily follow your Facebook account. We are, after all, fans!

$25 = POSTMAN

We provide the aforementioned and send you a personal "thank you" from the staff of GoodRoadNetwork . (There will probably be a sticker or two included, as well. Who doesn't want a sticker?)

$50 = BAND SHIRT

At this level you get a great looking, well made, GoodRoadNetwork (GRN) T-shirt!!! (We promise it won’t be one from the CEO’s laundry hamper!).

* Men's (American Apparel), Black “Live music” on Heather Grey, Black ¾ length sleeves with crew neck. Sizes S, M, L, and XL

* Women's (District Made), Black “Live music” on Heather Grey with ¾ length sleeves with scoop neck.  Sizes S, M, L, and XL

* NOTE: You will be contacted, via email provided upon contribution, by the GoodRoadNetwork team to request your desired shirt style and size.

$100 = GOLD-ish Record

Receive a wall mountable plaque! Modeled after a Gold Record, its dimensions are 7” x 9".  On it we engrave your name and our super huge thanks to you for your donation. We also add your name to GoodRoadNetwork ’s website as a Gold Record level contributor, publicly thanking you for your enormous contribution.

 
 

$250 = PLATINUM-ish  Record

At this level you receive a t-shirt (see NOTE about sizing and styles listed above under Band Shirt perk) and award plaque! It is wall mountable and its dimensions are 7” x 9".  On it we engrave your name and our enormous thanks to you for your donation. We also add your name to GoodRoadNetwork ’s website as a PLATINUM Record level contributor, publicly thanking you for your enormous contribution.

$5,000 = INVESTOR (Only one of these!)

I have a Gibson SG Gothic that has been with me on tour. I bought it years ago and I love it to death!!  However, I know this company has real potential and I am willing to part with the guitar and case for a 5G donation to GoodRoadNetwork.  My development team and I will sign the guitar, as well and send it ‘as is’.  My hope is that when GoodRoadNetwork takes off you will have quite the collector item!  This level contribution will also include the INVESTOR level contributor spot on our website, PLEASE be good to my guitar and play the hell out of it once in awhile.


CHECK US OUT!

Check us out on Facebook and Twitter.
Sign up for free and let us know what you think.
GoodRoadNetwork.com 
(or on Mobile)   
grn.im

Keep creating music and sharing it with the world.

Don't forget to spread the news and help us out with Indiegogo.com share tools.

story:
Depuis 5 ans nous travaillons sur ce projet. En 2012 nous avons eu la chance de parcourir tout le chemin vers Santiago depuis notre maison de six fours les plages, 66 jours de marche et 1700 kilomètres parcourus n'ont fait que renforcer un peu plus ce rêve de créer l’albergue parfaite pour nos amis pèlerins du monde entier. Chaque année nous repartons sur le chemin pendant nos congés, ce qui nous a permis d’être nous-même hébergés dans plus de 90 auberges en France comme en Espagne, et d’être hospitaliers à St Jean pied de port en 2015.        Nous retrouver sur le chemin est pour nous à chaque fois un moment magique que tout le monde devrait connaitre. Nous sommes à même aujourd'hui de connaitre réellement tous les besoins d'un pèlerin.

  Our story: Since 5 years, we're woking on this project: In 2012, we get the chance to walk through all the road to santiago from our house in Six-fours les plages (French Riviera): 66 days walking 1700 kilometers will strengthen a little more this dream of creating the perfect albergue for our friends pilgrims around the world. Every year, we go back on the road during our holidays, which allowed us to be ourselves hosted in over 90 hostels in France and Spain. Be on the road for us is a magical moment that everyone should know. We can really know all the needs of a pilgrim. 

 Desde hace 5 años que hemos estado trabajando en este proyecto, en 2012 tuvimos la oportunidad de viajar por todo el camino a Santiago de nuestros casa seis fours playas 66 días y caminar 1.700 kilometros viajó solo han fortalecido un poco de sueño crear el perfecto albergue para nuestros amigos peregrinos de todo el mundo. Cada año nos remontamos en la carretera durante nuestras vacaciones que nos permitió ser nosotros mismos organizamos más de 90 albergues de Francia y España. Encuéntrenos en el camino para nosotros cada vez que un momento mágico que todo el mundo debe saber. Estamos incluso ahora que sabemos realmente todas las necesidades de un peregrino.

              

         

Notre projet est de créer sur le camino Francès (Espagne) l'albergue idéale pour les marcheurs en route vers Compostelle, un havre de paix avec animaux et culture artisanale. Afin de mieux faire connaitre pour les contributeurs qui ne connaissent pas ce pèlerinage; la journée d'un marcheur consiste a marcher d'étape en étape, s'alimenter et se laver, se soigner et se reposer; nous allons proposer dans notre auberge aux gens de passage un lit et un repas chaud plus un petit déjeuner, dans un cadre de repos total. Comme chaque pèlerin en a bien conscience nous fonctionnons sur le partage, et créer pour nous cette albergue, ce n'est que rendre ce que l'on nous a donné pendant nos différends périples.Il est tout a fait important de vous expliquer que c'est pour nous un revirement complet dans notre vie, étant tout les deux salariés en France, nous allons prendre le risque bien calculé de partir pour cette nouvelle vie, l'albergue sera située en Espagne.

Our project is to create the "camino Francès" (Spain), the ideal albergue for walkers going to Santiago, a haven of peace with animals and artisan culture. In order to clarify the contributors who do not know this pilgrimage, the day of a walker is: walk step by step, feeding, bathing, care and rest. We propose in our hostel: a bed and a hot meal + a small lunch in a part of the most complete rest. Each pilgrim knows that we operate on sharing. For us, create this albergue its giving back what we received during our various travels. This change of life, a complete turnaround is very important to us. As any two employees in France, we will take the risk (well calculated) to go to this new life, the albergue will be located in Spain.

   Nuestro proyecto es crear en el Camino Frances (España) albergue ideal para los excursionistas en el camino a Compostela, un remanso de paz con los animales y la cultura artesanal. Para conocer mejor a los contribuyentes que no conocen esta peregrinación el día de un andador es caminar de etapa en etapa, la alimentación y el lavado, el cuidado y el descanso; vamos a ofrecer en nuestro albergue para pasar a la gente una cama y una comida caliente, más un pequeño almuerzo en un marco de total del resto. Como cada peregrino es consciente trabajamos en el intercambio y la creación para nosotros este this're albergue sólo de hacer lo que nos dieron durante nuestra varios périples.IL es muy importante que usted explicó que se trata de para nosotros un giro completo en nuestra vida, siendo tan solo los dos empleados en Francia, vamos a tener buen riesgo calculado a partir hacia una nueva vida, el albergue se encuentra en España.

                                                                                                    

    Ce revirement dans notre vie est très important, afin de nous retrouver en contact avec la nature, le chemin et pouvoir rendre service aux gens de passage dans l albergue est fondamental pour notre équilibre, chaque pèlerins recevra le meilleur accueil qu'il se doit, pour les personnes souffrantes, Nous prévoyons quelques chambres isolées pour être tranquille et se remettre de l'étape qui aura été sûrement trop dure pour eux. Il faut bien savoir qu'une albergue reçoit des pèlerins du monde entier, réellement du monde entier, nous avons eu l'occasion de vivre des expériences inoubliables, comme cette fois a "Bercianos del réal camino"ou nous étions 43 personnes à table pour le diner dont 18 nationalités différentes, seul le chemin vous font partager de tel moment.

    This change in our lives is very important to find us in touch with nature, the way and be of service to travelers in the albergue is fundamental to our balance, each pilgrim will receive the best welcome he must for suffering, we expect some isolated room to be quiet and to recover from the stage that has been probably too hard for them. We must know that albergue receives pilgrims from around the world , actually the world , we had the opportunity to live unforgettable experiences, like this time a " Bercianos del camino real " or we were 43 people at the table to dinner with 18 different nationalities , only the way you make such a moment shared .

       Este cambio en nuestras vidas es muy importante para nosotros encontrar en contacto con la naturaleza, ruta y estar al servicio de visitar a las personas en el albergue es fundamental para nuestro equilibrio, cada peregrino recibirá la mejor bienvenida que debe por el sufrimiento, esperamos algo de espacio aislado para estar tranquilo y recuperarse de la etapa que ha sido probablemente demasiado difícil para ellos. Debemos saber que albergue recibe a peregrinos de todo el mundo, de hecho el mundo, hemos tenido la oportunidad de vivir experiencias inolvidables, esta vez como un "camino Real del Bercianos" o éramos 43 personas en la mesa de cena incluyendo 18 nacionalidades diferentes, sólo la manera de hacer un momento tan compartida.

                     

    Chaque année entre 200.000 à 250.000 pèlerins arrivent à Santiago sur leurs pieds ou à vélo, et tout ces braves gens ont besoin tout au long de leur parcours de s'abriter chaque soir dans un lieu différend, c'est là que nous intervenons. Il existe beaucoup de refuges sur le chemin mais il est pas rare que tout soit complet. Pour rester dans les chiffres; l’hébergement pour un soir coûte entre 5 à 10€, le repas du pèlerin avoisine souvent les 8€ et les petits déjeuners 2.50€, pour notre auberge nous allons faire un dortoir de 40 lits plus trois chambres séparées pour les gens souffrants... Il est également bon de savoir en terme de chiffre qu'une albergue fonctionne environ neuf mois par an et qu'elle est ouverte chaque jour, ( et chaque jour c'est complet)  il n' est pas possible de penser fermer un jour, les pèlerins seraient à la porte et pas vraiment comprendre ce qui se passe...  Nous n'allons pas avoir cette activité pour nous enrichir, mais pour vivre, donner de notre temps aux autres et vivre en communion avec la nature et le chemin.  

     Each year between 200,000 to 250,000 marchers arrive in Santiago on their feet or bicycle, and everything is good people need throughout their travels to shelter each night in a different place , that's where we come in there are many of refuge on the way but it is not uncommon that everything is complete . To stay in the figures ; accommodation for one night costs between 5-10 € meal pilgrim often close to € 8 and € 2.50 a good breakfast to our hostel we do a 40 dorm beds plus three separate rooms for the suffering people ... it is also good to know in terms of a number albergue runs about nine months a year and is open every day ( and every day is full) it is not possible to think closed one day pilgrims would be at the door, not really understand what 's going on ... We will not have this activity to make us rich , but to live , give our time to others and to live in harmony with nature and path.        

        Cada año, entre 200.000 y 250.000 peregrinos llegan a Santiago de pie o en bicicleta, y todo es bueno que la gente necesita a lo largo de sus viajes al refugio cada noche en un lugar diferente, que es donde entramos nosotros Hay un montón de refugio en el camino, pero no es raro que todo está completo. Para permanecer en las cifras; alojamiento para una noche cuesta entre 5-10 € peregrino comida a menudo alrededor de 8 € y un buen desayuno € 2.50 a nuestro albergue hacemos unas 40 habitaciones de residencia durante tres camas separadas para las personas que sufren ... También es bueno saber que en términos de número albergue corre alrededor de nueve meses al año y está abierto todos los días (y cada día está lleno), no es posible que un día cerrado, los peregrinos estaría en la puerta, no realmente entender lo que está pasando ... No queremos que esta actividad para hacernos ricos, sino para vivir, dar nuestro tiempo a los demás y vivir en comunión con la naturaleza y la ruta.      

       

                     

    votreintervention dans ce grand projet est essentiel; sans votre aide il sera difficile de mettre en place ce grand chantier pour l'ouverture de l'albergue, nous allons devoir laisser notre emploi tous les deux pour nous investir complètement dans cette création, par conséquent aucune banque ne nous suivra pour financer les travaux et l’aménagement, c'est pourquoi nous faisons appel a votre générosité.  

    • Votre participation dans l’évolution de ce projet est essentiel, si nous voulons mener à bien cette création d albergue, nous sommes en mesure grâce à la vente de notre maison d'acheter le bien sur place avec le terrain; comme beaucoup de gens le savent, avec la crise économique qui a frappé l'Espagne  en 2008, les grandes maisons à la vente sont nombreuses ( il nous faut pour pouvoir accueillir tout le monde un minimum de 300m²) là ou intervient cette campagne et vos généreux dons sont pour les travaux de réhabilitation des lieux et l'aménagement.

                                

      les fonds se découpent en trois grosses parties:

      1. l'achat du bien       120.000 €
      2. les travaux              110.000€
      3. l'aménagement      40.000€

       1. En 2013 nous sommes partis 1 mois sur le chemin en reconnaissance afin de visiter beaucoup de maison à la vente, certaines avec beaucoup de travaux, très peu chères, environ 50.000€ et d'autres beaucoup plus correct, plus onéreuses bien évidemment, il ne sera pas difficile de trouver le lieu pour notre grand projet, nous sommes en contact avec des agences sur place qui attendent notre feu vert pour nous proposer des endroits adaptés à notre futur activité.

        2. le montant des travaux n'est pas très élevé à ce jour grâce à deux choses, la première est que nous avons restaurer entièrement notre maison actuelle, en ne conservant que les murs et le toit, j’étais dans le passé dans le BTP ce qui nous a bien aidé, la deuxième et pas des moindres nous avons aujourd'hui trois personnes de confiances qui ont eux mêmes restaurée leur maison qui se proposent gracieusement  leurs aide pour la réhabilitation de la futur albergue (maçonnerie cloisonnage, carrelage toiture...)  c'est pour nous une énorme chance d'avoir nos amis qui nous suivent dans cette démarche, les 110.000€ que nous allons investir ne sont attribué qu'aux fournitures.

        3. les 40.000€ restant seront consacrés à l'aménagement, car il faut savoir que pour recevoir chaque jour 40 pèlerins, il faut un peu de matériel, salle de repas, dortoir,  aménager toutes les commodités: WC,  douches,  lieux pour le lavage des vêtements et séchages (avec lave linge et sèche linge) toujours pour  40 personnes et quotidiennement, les parties cuisines et toutes les vaisselles nécessaires.

      IL est bien entendu que l'albergue ne se suffira pas ces 150.000 euros pour tout faire mais pour démarrer cette activité, c'est complètement faisable, si la somme dépasse nos espérances nous pourrons alors sans attente prévoir un grand jardin pour le repos des pèlerins avec des équipements pour se prélasser, nous pourrons acheter les animaux et prévoir le jardin bio qui alimentera la cuisine.                                                                                                                Si toutefois, nous ne parvenions pas à réunir la somme nécessaire à la création de cette auberge dans un premier temps, nous serions contraints de louer un lieux pour faire vivre ce projet ou de reprendre une albergue en tant qu'hospitalier dans l'attente de créer notre rêve, avec suffisamment de place pour les animaux, le jardin, les espaces extérieurs de repos.

    Nous  -  hospitalier bénévole à St-jean-pied-de-port 

     Notre projet, l'auberge une fois mise en place va rendre service a un grand nombre de personnes chaque jour, chaque mois, chaque année, des personnes du monde entier (elle sera en perpétuelle évolution pour donner le meilleur à chaque personne qui viendra y séjourner) , pour vous donner quelques statistiques une albergue de 40 places, comme nous prévoyons de le faire, accueil en moyenne 8500 personnes par année, les pèlerins apportent avec leur passage leur histoire, laissent une trace de leur visite et en contre-partie les hospitaliers essaient de donner le meilleur d'eux même à chaque visiteur pour que le repos soit bénéfique et que chacun reparte dans les meilleures conditions.

                       

    Our project, the inn once implemented, will make service a large number of people every day, every month, every year, people from around the world (it will be constantly evolving to give the best for each person who will stayed there), to give you a few statistics albergue 40 seats, as we plan to do home on average 8,500 people per year, pilgrims bring their pass their history, leaves a trace of their visit and part-cons hospital trying to give the best of themselves to each visitor to that rest is beneficial and that each reparte in the best condition.

     Nuestro proyecto, la posada, una vez implementado, hará que el servicio a un gran número de personas que cada día, cada mes, cada año, la gente de todo el mundo (se continua evolución para dar lo mejor a cada persona que vendrá quedó allí), para darle algunas estadísticas Albergue con 40 asientos, ya que planeamos hacer en casa un promedio de 8.500 personas al año, los peregrinos traen su paso su historia, deja un rastro de su visita y parciales de los contras el hospital tratando de dar lo mejor de sí mismos para cada visitante para que el resto sea beneficioso y retomar el camino que todo el mundo en las mejores condiciones.
