story_txt:
Depuis 5 ans nous travaillons sur ce projet. En 2012 nous avons eu la chance de parcourir tout le chemin vers Santiago depuis notre maison de six fours les plages, 66 jours de marche et 1700 kilomètres parcourus n'ont fait que renforcer un peu plus ce rêve de créer l’albergue parfaite pour nos amis pèlerins du monde entier. Chaque année nous repartons sur le chemin pendant nos congés, ce qui nous a permis d’être nous-même hébergés dans plus de 90 auberges en France comme en Espagne, et d’être hospitaliers à St Jean pied de port en 2015.        Nous retrouver sur le chemin est pour nous à chaque fois un moment magique que tout le monde devrait connaitre. Nous sommes à même aujourd'hui de connaitre réellement tous les besoins d'un pèlerin.



  Our story: Since 5 years, we're woking on this project: In 2012, we get the chance to walk through all the road to santiago from our house in Six-fours les plages (French Riviera): 66 days walking 1700 kilometers will strengthen a little more this dream of creating the perfect albergue for our friends pilgrims around the world. Every year, we go back on the road during our holidays, which allowed us to be ourselves hosted in over 90 hostels in France and Spain. Be on the road for us is a magical moment that everyone should know. We can really know all the needs of a pilgrim. 
 Desde hace 5 años que hemos estado trabajando en este proyecto, en 2012 tuvimos la oportunidad de viajar por todo el camino a Santiago de nuestros casa seis fours playas 66 días y caminar 1.700 kilometros viajó solo han fortalecido un poco de sueño crear el perfecto albergue para nuestros amigos peregrinos de todo el mundo. Cada año nos remontamos en la carretera durante nuestras vacaciones que nos permitió ser nosotros mismos organizamos más de 90 albergues de Francia y España. Encuéntrenos en el camino para nosotros cada vez que un momento mágico que todo el mundo debe saber. Estamos incluso ahora que sabemos realmente todas las necesidades de un peregrino.

              





         


Notre projet est de créer sur le camino Francès (Espagne) l'albergue idéale pour les marcheurs en route vers Compostelle, un havre de paix avec animaux et culture artisanale. Afin de mieux faire connaitre pour les contributeurs qui ne connaissent pas ce pèlerinage; la journée d'un marcheur consiste a marcher d'étape en étape, s'alimenter et se laver, se soigner et se reposer; nous allons proposer dans notre auberge aux gens de passage un lit et un repas chaud plus un petit déjeuner, dans un cadre de repos total. Comme chaque pèlerin en a bien conscience nous fonctionnons sur le partage, et créer pour nous cette albergue, ce n'est que rendre ce que l'on nous a donné pendant nos différends périples.Il est tout a fait important de vous expliquer que c'est pour nous un revirement complet dans notre vie, étant tout les deux salariés en France, nous allons prendre le risque bien calculé de partir pour cette nouvelle vie, l'albergue sera située en Espagne.
Our project is to create the "camino Francès" (Spain), the ideal albergue for walkers going to Santiago, a haven of peace with animals and artisan culture. In order to clarify the contributors who do not know this pilgrimage, the day of a walker is: walk step by step, feeding, bathing, care and rest. We propose in our hostel: a bed and a hot meal + a small lunch in a part of the most complete rest. Each pilgrim knows that we operate on sharing. For us, create this albergue its giving back what we received during our various travels. This change of life, a complete turnaround is very important to us. As any two employees in France, we will take the risk (well calculated) to go to this new life, the albergue will be located in Spain.
   Nuestro proyecto es crear en el Camino Frances (España) albergue ideal para los excursionistas en el camino a Compostela, un remanso de paz con los animales y la cultura artesanal. Para conocer mejor a los contribuyentes que no conocen esta peregrinación el día de un andador es caminar de etapa en etapa, la alimentación y el lavado, el cuidado y el descanso; vamos a ofrecer en nuestro albergue para pasar a la gente una cama y una comida caliente, más un pequeño almuerzo en un marco de total del resto. Como cada peregrino es consciente trabajamos en el intercambio y la creación para nosotros este this're albergue sólo de hacer lo que nos dieron durante nuestra varios périples.IL es muy importante que usted explicó que se trata de para nosotros un giro completo en nuestra vida, siendo tan solo los dos empleados en Francia, vamos a tener buen riesgo calculado a partir hacia una nueva vida, el albergue se encuentra en España.
                                                                                                    





Ce revirement dans notre vie est très important, afin de nous retrouver en contact avec la nature, le chemin et pouvoir rendre service aux gens de passage dans l albergue est fondamental pour notre équilibre, chaque pèlerins recevra le meilleur accueil qu'il se doit, pour les personnes souffrantes, Nous prévoyons quelques chambres isolées pour être tranquille et se remettre de l'étape qui aura été sûrement trop dure pour eux. Il faut bien savoir qu'une albergue reçoit des pèlerins du monde entier, réellement du monde entier, nous avons eu l'occasion de vivre des expériences inoubliables, comme cette fois a "Bercianos del réal camino"ou nous étions 43 personnes à table pour le diner dont 18 nationalités différentes, seul le chemin vous font partager de tel moment.
This change in our lives is very important to find us in touch with nature, the way and be of service to travelers in the albergue is fundamental to our balance, each pilgrim will receive the best welcome he must for suffering, we expect some isolated room to be quiet and to recover from the stage that has been probably too hard for them. We must know that albergue receives pilgrims from around the world , actually the world , we had the opportunity to live unforgettable experiences, like this time a " Bercianos del camino real " or we were 43 people at the table to dinner with 18 different nationalities , only the way you make such a moment shared .
   Este cambio en nuestras vidas es muy importante para nosotros encontrar en contacto con la naturaleza, ruta y estar al servicio de visitar a las personas en el albergue es fundamental para nuestro equilibrio, cada peregrino recibirá la mejor bienvenida que debe por el sufrimiento, esperamos algo de espacio aislado para estar tranquilo y recuperarse de la etapa que ha sido probablemente demasiado difícil para ellos. Debemos saber que albergue recibe a peregrinos de todo el mundo, de hecho el mundo, hemos tenido la oportunidad de vivir experiencias inolvidables, esta vez como un "camino Real del Bercianos" o éramos 43 personas en la mesa de cena incluyendo 18 nacionalidades diferentes, sólo la manera de hacer un momento tan compartida.






                 







Chaque année entre 200.000 à 250.000 pèlerins arrivent à Santiago sur leurs pieds ou à vélo, et tout ces braves gens ont besoin tout au long de leur parcours de s'abriter chaque soir dans un lieu différend, c'est là que nous intervenons. Il existe beaucoup de refuges sur le chemin mais il est pas rare que tout soit complet. Pour rester dans les chiffres; l’hébergement pour un soir coûte entre 5 à 10€, le repas du pèlerin avoisine souvent les 8€ et les petits déjeuners 2.50€, pour notre auberge nous allons faire un dortoir de 40 lits plus trois chambres séparées pour les gens souffrants... Il est également bon de savoir en terme de chiffre qu'une albergue fonctionne environ neuf mois par an et qu'elle est ouverte chaque jour, ( et chaque jour c'est complet)  il n' est pas possible de penser fermer un jour, les pèlerins seraient à la porte et pas vraiment comprendre ce qui se passe...  Nous n'allons pas avoir cette activité pour nous enrichir, mais pour vivre, donner de notre temps aux autres et vivre en communion avec la nature et le chemin.  

 Each year between 200,000 to 250,000 marchers arrive in Santiago on their feet or bicycle, and everything is good people need throughout their travels to shelter each night in a different place , that's where we come in there are many of refuge on the way but it is not uncommon that everything is complete . To stay in the figures ; accommodation for one night costs between 5-10 € meal pilgrim often close to € 8 and € 2.50 a good breakfast to our hostel we do a 40 dorm beds plus three separate rooms for the suffering people ... it is also good to know in terms of a number albergue runs about nine months a year and is open every day ( and every day is full) it is not possible to think closed one day pilgrims would be at the door, not really understand what 's going on ... We will not have this activity to make us rich , but to live , give our time to others and to live in harmony with nature and path.        
    Cada año, entre 200.000 y 250.000 peregrinos llegan a Santiago de pie o en bicicleta, y todo es bueno que la gente necesita a lo largo de sus viajes al refugio cada noche en un lugar diferente, que es donde entramos nosotros Hay un montón de refugio en el camino, pero no es raro que todo está completo. Para permanecer en las cifras; alojamiento para una noche cuesta entre 5-10 € peregrino comida a menudo alrededor de 8 € y un buen desayuno € 2.50 a nuestro albergue hacemos unas 40 habitaciones de residencia durante tres camas separadas para las personas que sufren ... También es bueno saber que en términos de número albergue corre alrededor de nueve meses al año y está abierto todos los días (y cada día está lleno), no es posible que un día cerrado, los peregrinos estaría en la puerta, no realmente entender lo que está pasando ... No queremos que esta actividad para hacernos ricos, sino para vivir, dar nuestro tiempo a los demás y vivir en comunión con la naturaleza y la ruta.      

   


                 





 votreintervention dans ce grand projet est essentiel; sans votre aide il sera difficile de mettre en place ce grand chantier pour l'ouverture de l'albergue, nous allons devoir laisser notre emploi tous les deux pour nous investir complètement dans cette création, par conséquent aucune banque ne nous suivra pour financer les travaux et l’aménagement, c'est pourquoi nous faisons appel a votre générosité.  


Votre participation dans l’évolution de ce projet est essentiel, si nous voulons mener à bien cette création d albergue, nous sommes en mesure grâce à la vente de notre maison d'acheter le bien sur place avec le terrain; comme beaucoup de gens le savent, avec la crise économique qui a frappé l'Espagne  en 2008, les grandes maisons à la vente sont nombreuses ( il nous faut pour pouvoir accueillir tout le monde un minimum de 300m²) là ou intervient cette campagne et vos généreux dons sont pour les travaux de réhabilitation des lieux et l'aménagement.
                          
les fonds se découpent en trois grosses parties:

les travaux              110.000€
l'aménagement      40.000€

Pour 300€    un sweet shirt a capuche zippé de très bonne qualité toujours a l’effigie de l albergue,et l'accueil offert lors de votre passage dans notre auberge.                        Sweat shirt zippé  100% coton Flocage blanc                                     couleur noir ou carbone Taille au choix  S-M-L-XL-XXL                            


Pour 500€  - Une très belle montre de fabrication française gravée Ultreia ,et l'accueil offert lors de votre passage dans notre auberge.                 



Pour 1000€    Ensemble de 3 valises trolley de voyage à coque rigide et l'accueil offert lors de votre passage dans notre auberge.                 



Pour 1500€   1 Magnifique Statuette de  pèlerin  de  30 cm, et l'accueil offert lors de votre passage dans notre auberge.                                          
                                     



Pour 2000€ Une salle Portera votre nom   ( salle de repas ou de repos, chambre individuelle ou dortoir, fontaine...)                                                                Nous vous réservons une place toute particulière dans ce mur, crée pour les donateurs ( dans la pièce principal de l albergue)  une pierre gravée à votre nom prénom et ville avec l'empreinte de votre coquille St Jacques celle ci  vous sera envoyée par la poste et une salle (dortoir, salle de repas, salle de repos, fontaine,...)  Portera votre nom


 Nos remerciements sur la page facebook dédiée à notre projet et l'accueil offert lors de votre passage dans notre auberge. 



                    Cet exemple est reprit de la pierre gravée devant le parvis de la                                        cathédrale de Santiago,  votre pierre sera réalisée dans cette esprit.                       





Pour 5000€  Un arbre fruitier pour vous Sur le terrain, Dans un espace réservé aux pèlerins pour le repos, nous allons planter des arbres fruitiers, un arbre sera planté pour vous dans cet espace, cet arbre portera  votre nom. l'accueil offert lors de votre passage dans notre auberge.                 







 . For donations of each donor to From 200 euros
We reserve a special place in the main room wall creates for donors, a stone engraved with your name and town will be there SEALED with the imprint of Coquille St Jacques YOUR this one will be sent by mail.
              




   Para donaciones de cada donante a partir de 200 euros
Nos reservamos un lugar especial en la pared principal sala crea para los donantes, una piedra grabada con su nombre y la ciudad se había sellado con el sello de Coquille St Jacques SU éste será enviado por correo.






                 




Nous  -  hospitalier bénévole à St-jean-pied-de-port 





 Notre projet, l'auberge une fois mise en place va rendre service a un grand nombre de personnes chaque jour, chaque mois, chaque année, des personnes du monde entier (elle sera en perpétuelle évolution pour donner le meilleur à chaque personne qui viendra y séjourner) , pour vous donner quelques statistiques une albergue de 40 places, comme nous prévoyons de le faire, accueil en moyenne 8500 personnes par année, les pèlerins apportent avec leur passage leur histoire, laissent une trace de leur visite et en contre-partie les hospitaliers essaient de donner le meilleur d'eux même à chaque visiteur pour que le repos soit bénéfique et que chacun reparte dans les meilleures conditions.
                   



Our project, the inn once implemented, will make service a large number of people every day, every month, every year, people from around the world (it will be constantly evolving to give the best for each person who will stayed there), to give you a few statistics albergue 40 seats, as we plan to do home on average 8,500 people per year, pilgrims bring their pass their history, leaves a trace of their visit and part-cons hospital trying to give the best of themselves to each visitor to that rest is beneficial and that each reparte in the best condition.
 Nuestro proyecto, la posada, una vez implementado, hará que el servicio a un gran número de personas que cada día, cada mes, cada año, la gente de todo el mundo (se continua evolución para dar lo mejor a cada persona que vendrá quedó allí), para darle algunas estadísticas Albergue con 40 asientos, ya que planeamos hacer en casa un promedio de 8.500 personas al año, los peregrinos traen su paso su historia, deja un rastro de su visita y parciales de los contras el hospital tratando de dar lo mejor de sí mismos para cada visitante para que el resto sea beneficioso y retomar el camino que todo el mundo en las mejores condiciones.



                


 Lien : REPORTAGE France 3  
                                  très beau reportage sur le chemin de Compostelle                                                                                                                  .......et St jean pied de port
        

                 Diaporama résumant notre voyage vers Santiago en 2012
     
              


              





              Merci à toutes et à tous pour votre
soutien...


                                       Qui nous aiment nous suivent






                                                                   Sur le chemin...

   Gracias a todos ustedes por su apoyo
...


 Quien como
nosotros nos seguimos….  En el camino ...


 Thank you to you all for your support
...
 Who
like us follow us… On the road ...

story:
Sensamotion tour with Fortunate Youth

We are joining Fortunate Youth & Hirie on the 2015 Don't Think Twice spring tour. It is our first national tour and we are asking for your help to make it happen!

We have been together for seven years and are based out of Atlantic City, NJ.

We have shared the stage with a countless amount of great reggae bands and are about to be exposed to a whole new crowd.


What We Need 

Major needs include:

This tour is roughly 11,000Mi. and travel expenses alone will cost us around $4,000

We'll need 4 oils changes.

We also need money of course, in case of emergencies.

Also, food expenses and the occasional hotel room for a hot shower.

The Impact

This opportunity will expose us to a large number of new fans and will help us gain recognition and spread our music.

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about this funding page, the tour, our social media (facebook, instagram etc) possible housing while on the road!


Thank you for your time and support! hope to see you this spring!

Blessings

story:
About This Campaign 

Hello everyone!  I am so grateful to announce my first ever full length album “1st Density” , will be coming to you all soon! In this album I’ll be exploring the five elements: earth, water, fire, air, and spirit.

I have waited to share these songs with all of you, until I felt 100% confident in the music and the message.   My released music up until now, especially my latest EP “Selathia”, mainly serves the purpose of you all getting to know me, to see where my perspective is coming from. This full length album will finally go into exactly what my perspective is. And I truly can’t wait to share it with you all. 

 

What is Needed and What You’ll Get

 

Having lost the opportunity to gig this pass year, creating this album would be nearly impossible without you all. The goal for this campaign is $3500. For the sake of transparency, I have listed a break down of the budget for you all. As I produce my own music, I will only need funds for the following: 

 

Recording: $675

Mixing: $1,125

Mastering: $1,650

(Platform fees: $50)

 

As mentioned in my video, I do have gifts for all who are able to contribute! 

 

$5: Hand painted Origami Thank You heart (with sticker inside!)

$10: Charli Haruhi Hand Mirror (With Thank You Heart)

$25: Charli Haruhi T-shirt (xs-2xl)

$50: Charli Haruhi Merchant Bundle (Thank you heart, hand mirror, t-shirt, and exclusive video updates)

$100: Charli Haruhi Merch Bundle + Q&A about the album

$500: Charli Haruhi Merch Bundle + Personal Live performance of the album 

 

Risks and Challenges 

 

This album is already completely written and produced. With that being said, the only real challenge I could potentially face is staying on schedule with recording and mixing to stay within budget. As I have already released two EPs, I am confident in my ability to do this. 

If for any reason this campaign doesn’t reach its goal, please be assured that all the money donated will still go towards this album. It would just be up to me to figure out the rest the budget and I would probably have to delay the release of the album. 

If we happen to raise more than the campaign goal, all additional funds will go towards visual art and music videos for this album. 

 

The Impact 

 

Beyond helping me live out what I believe is my spiritual calling, this album would allow me to really expand my career. Having a full length album in my catalog opens the door to better gigs and opportunities to support myself in these trying times. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a place to donate that’s ok! If you still would like to help there are definitely ways you can. Particularly, through sharing this campaign with friends and family. Please share this campaign across email, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.

You can also,

follow me on Instagram: https://instagram.com/charli_haruhi

like me on Facebook: https://facebook.com/charliharuhi

subscribe to my YouTube channels: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwZWrgFpcdgu3S...

https://youtube.com/channel/UC5jGcGTvX4wGjeyHO-...

and listen to my previous releases accross all streaming platforms!

 

Thank you so much for your generosity!

story:
Short Summary

Started in 2001, Tears Run Black was a metal band from the panhandle of Florida.  Active for three years, life caused a split up of the band geographically.  June 6th of 2011, we lost our drummer and our close friend Robby McDonald.  We decided to record this album as a tribute to Robby.  We love him dearly and miss him every day.  This is for him. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for around $3,000 to cover the cost of physical production of the CDs, t-shirts, stickers, and recording and production of the album itself.  We've already written the music, we are fine tuning now, and will be entering the studio at the end of October with Joseph Milligan (Anberlin) in Austin, TX.

We've got many different options for you to choose from to support this project.  Feel free to choose what works best for you.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you could spread the word about our campaign to the people you know and help us meet our funding goal that would mean the world to us.  There are several share buttons available on this page. 

Thank you and we love you. <3

story:
Hello family and friends! This is the official IndieGoGo campaign to help raise funds for my first music video. 

Working diligently for the past 5 years, I am very excited to announce that I will be releasing my debut mini album SKELETONS this Fall. I’ve made it this far, but now I need your help. The music video is for the title track Skeletons. Skeletons is about facing those skeletons in your closet...the secrets, the pain and the pressure. It’s about reflecting on a negative relationship of the past, and finding the strength within yourself to carry on to your future. This music video is to show the world just how powerful females are and that we hold the power to create a happier life for ourselves. Every donation counts and comes with some perks, so I hope you guys are as excited as I am to get Skeletons out into the world!

Thank you.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm hoping to raise $5,000 to make a really awesome, female empowering music video for the title track song, Skeletons. The money will go to the videographer/director for pre-production (planning, storyboarding), the actual filming time, and post-production (editing, color-grading, etc.) 

Every donation gets a free advanced download of the entire EP!

Some other perks include: signed hard copy of EP, advanced viewing of the music video, handwritten lyric booklet, exclusive pin, exclusive t-shirt, recording of your choice, and a private acoustic show (you pick the songs!)

story:
A legendás Kontroll Csoportnak egyik alapítója, Bárdos Deák Ágnes keres legújabb szerzeményei megjelentetéséhez, a „Villámrandi” c. CD kiadásához, valamint a projekt fenntarthatóságát szolgáló, „Villámrandi” logóval ellátott jelvények és pólók gyártásához támogatókat.
A megvalósítandó zenei projekttel a szerző aktuális, XXI. századi élményeinek interpretálása mellett a "vasfüggöny" mögötti ellenállás korszakának emlékezetét is őrizni kívánja a repertoárba emelt, 1985-ben írt két dala, a „Pavlov kutya” és a „Ma reggel” remake-jével.


The former Eastern Bloc legendary Hungarian underground band Kontroll csoport's founder & front person, Ági Bárdos Deák is looking for sponsors for her new LP "Villámrandi" ("Speed Date")  + for the badges and T-shirts with logo. The new project reflects the 21st centrury Zeitgeist, but there will be remakes of 2 songs from 1985  ("Pavlov's Dog" & "This Morning") which ones try to keep the memory of the on time Iron Curtain.

The new project reflects the 21st centrury Zeitgeist, but there will be remakes of 2 songs from 1985  ("Pavlov's Dog" & "This Morning") which ones try to keep the memory of the on time Iron Curtain.

story:
Voodoo Radio

Voodoo Radio is the title of the forthcoming and first full-length album of Longshot Voodoo:

Who Are We?

In 2011, formed Adrienne West, Carl Eddy, and Matt West (performing as the West-Eddy Trio) joined with percussionist Don “DC" Culp, Motif Magazine’s “2010 Percussionist of the Year” and 2013 Rhode Island Music Hall of Fame inductee to form Longshot Voodoo. To compliment the Trio’s unique style, Culp designed the Dun Dun Percussion set, the first known of its kind, which is a drum kit made entirely out of African Hand drums. Melding the essence of ‘60s and‘70s classic rock, blues, and New Orleans R&B, Longshot Voodoo has carved a reputation of entertaining audiences with their infectious rhythms and jams.

In 2013, Longshot Voodoo released their first EP, "Zen Cave Mojo" and played a spotlight set at the Unity Concerts garnering rave reviews and front page coverage on the Providence Journal Bulletin. In 2014, the band headlined for a standing room only crowd at the Courthouse Center for the Arts in the "Halloween Recovery Concert". Longshot Voodoo was nominated for the Motif Music Awards 2015 Best Americana Act. In 2016, Longshot Voodoo was the opening act at the 19th Annual Rhythm & Roots Festival, with Adrienne was nominated for Best Female Vocalist in the 2017 Motif Music Awards. 

Voodoo Radio: The Album

Over the majority of the past two years, Longshot Voodoo has been creating in their magical headquarters and recording studio "The Zen Cave" writing, producing and recording their first full-length album, entitled Voodoo Radio. The ten-track release is schedule to drop July 2018. A pseudo-concept album, Voodoo Radio will tell stories and proudly represent the influences that have helped Longshot Voodoo's ongoing evolution.

Why We Need Your Help

As a part of the release of Voodoo Radio, we still have some financial hurdles that we will need to clear to give the best possible listening experience to our fans, While we are fortunate enough to be able to complete most of the recording process in our Zen Cave, the engineering, mixing, and mastering will be completed with the assistance and guidance of a world-class engineer, whose identity we've been asked to keep under wraps until the completion of the process. We also have commissioned the legendary Providence, RI musician & artist Mark Taber to create the artwork that will be featured on the album cover. Two of the tracks on Voodoo Radio will require some additional rights clearance as Longshot Voodoo will be releasing our cover of a hit single by The Cars and a classic Led Zeppelin tune, both in our Voodoo-ized style.  Your help allows us to make all of these aspects of the album occur in a timeline that meets our anticipated July 2018 release.

What We Need & What You Get

We've set ourselves a bit of a lofty goal of raising $2500 over the next 60 days. This money will help pay for the mixing & mastering process, digital release/streaming rights, artwork, and physical release of the album. Additional funds raised will be directly applied to the planning and production of the Voodoo Radio CD Release Concert, which supporters will be able to receive tickets for as a perk.

The perks we are offering include:

  • An autographed copy of Voodoo Radio to be sent before any other copies are made available to the public, accompanied by a personalized letter of thanks from the members of Longshot Voodoo.
  • A limited edition 8x10 print of the Voodoo Radio art work suitable for framing, numbered and signed by the regarded Providence Found Object Artist  (and RI Music Hall of Fame inductee) Mark Taber.
  • VIP Tickets to the Voodoo Radio CD Release Concert.
  • A framed and personalized CD  plaque celebrating the supporter's help in the release of Voodoo Radio.
  • A special credit in the liner notes of Voodoo Radio, forever linking the supporter with the release of Longshot Voodoo's first full-length album.

The Impact

The album release not only marks the completion of a recording process over the past two years that has been peppered with personal and technical challenges through the process, but also represents the next evolution of Longshot Voodoo in sound and song-writing.

  • This will be the first album completely recorded in DC Culp's Zen Cave Studios using an 8 track digital recorder and some studio magic.
  • Longshot Voodoo previously recorded and produced their 2013 EP Zen Cave Mojo featuring Michael "Tunes" Antunes of John Cafferty & Beaver Brown fame on saxophone in the early days of Zen Cave Studios.
  • The studio has since upgraded the recording hardware, including new industry-standard microphones and a more versatile multi-track digital recorder.

Risks & Challenges

We're very much getting to the end of the actual recording process of Voodoo Radio. To get the ten tracks into finalized mixes and the mastered for release, we'll need to raise the appropriate funds to complete those tasks with the oversight of the aforementioned expert.

We also will need to secure the streaming and digital release rights for the sings written by Ric Ocasek and Jimmy Page/Robert Plant before we can release the tracks.

Finally, we'll submit the music and artwork for physical and digital release through a number of commercial platforms.

The main challenge we face is raising the capital to complete these tasks. We're committed to our July 2018 release and believe in the music that we're releasing. Longshot Voodoo as a band, is so excited for people to hear the music we've been creating and will be driven to make this release a reality.

Through our friends' and fans' support,  our campaign success can be possible. Please be a part of the magic behind Voodoo Radio!

 Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit counts. While you might be unable to contribute in a way that earns a "perk", please do not think that help of ANY LEVEL isn't completely appreciated and helpful in this campaign.

Also remember that there are additional non-monetary ways that you can support our campaign.

  • Use the Indiegogo Campaign Share tools
  • Spread the word to your friends and family through social media

 

 

Thank you.

Peace. Love. Music,

Matt, Adrienne, Carl,& DC of Longshot Voodoo

As a part of the release of Voodoo Radio, we still have some financial hurdles that we will need to clear to give the best possible listening experience to our fans, While we are fortunate enough to be able to complete most of the recording process in our Zen Cave, the engineering, mixing, and mastering will be completed with the assistance and guidance of a world-class engineer, whose identity we've been asked to keep under wraps until the completion of the process. We also have commissioned the legendary Providence, RI musician & artist Mark Taber to create the artwork that will be featured on the album cover. Two of the tracks on Voodoo Radio will require some additional rights clearance as Longshot Voodoo will be releasing our cover of a hit single by The Cars and a classic Led Zeppelin tune, both in our Voodoo-ized style.  Your help allows us to make all of these aspects of the album occur in a timeline that meets our anticipated July 2018 release.

What We Need & What You Get
We've set ourselves a bit of a lofty goal of raising $2500 over the next 60 days. This money will help pay for the mixing & mastering process, digital release/streaming rights, artwork, and physical release of the album. Additional funds raised will be directly applied to the planning and production of the Voodoo Radio CD Release Concert, which supporters will be able to receive tickets for as a perk.
The perks we are offering include:

An autographed copy of Voodoo Radio to be sent before any other copies are made available to the public, accompanied by a personalized letter of thanks from the members of Longshot Voodoo.
A limited edition 8x10 print of the Voodoo Radio art work suitable for framing, numbered and signed by the regarded Providence Found Object Artist  (and RI Music Hall of Fame inductee) Mark Taber.
VIP Tickets to the Voodoo Radio CD Release Concert.
A framed and personalized CD  plaque celebrating the supporter's help in the release of Voodoo Radio.
A special credit in the liner notes of Voodoo Radio, forever linking the supporter with the release of Longshot Voodoo's first full-length album.


The Impact
The album release not only marks the completion of a recording process over the past two years that has been peppered with personal and technical challenges through the process, but also represents the next evolution of Longshot Voodoo in sound and song-writing.

This will be the first album completely recorded in DC Culp's Zen Cave Studios using an 8 track digital recorder and some studio magic.
Longshot Voodoo previously recorded and produced their 2013 EP Zen Cave Mojo featuring Michael "Tunes" Antunes of John Cafferty & Beaver Brown fame on saxophone in the early days of Zen Cave Studios.
The studio has since upgraded the recording hardware, including new industry-standard microphones and a more versatile multi-track digital recorder.


Risks & Challenges
We're very much getting to the end of the actual recording process of Voodoo Radio. To get the ten tracks into finalized mixes and the mastered for release, we'll need to raise the appropriate funds to complete those tasks with the oversight of the aforementioned expert.
We also will need to secure the streaming and digital release rights for the sings written by Ric Ocasek and Jimmy Page/Robert Plant before we can release the tracks.
Finally, we'll submit the music and artwork for physical and digital release through a number of commercial platforms.
The main challenge we face is raising the capital to complete these tasks. We're committed to our July 2018 release and believe in the music that we're releasing. Longshot Voodoo as a band, is so excited for people to hear the music we've been creating and will be driven to make this release a reality.
Through our friends' and fans' support,  our campaign success can be possible. Please be a part of the magic behind Voodoo Radio!
 Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit counts. While you might be unable to contribute in a way that earns a "perk", please do not think that help of ANY LEVEL isn't completely appreciated and helpful in this campaign.
Also remember that there are additional non-monetary ways that you can support our campaign.

Use the Indiegogo Campaign Share tools
Spread the word to your friends and family through social media

  Thank you.Peace. Love. Music,Matt, Adrienne, Carl,& DC of Longshot Voodoo

story:
Short Summary

 

I am Cuban-Canadian composer, performer and teacher, and I find that all three define me as an artist.  In 2015 I created the Art Song Collaborative Project as a means to combine the three main aspects of my artistic vision while also giving composers an opportunity to present their music in Canada. Through the project I have successfully organized, funded, and performed two concerts in Toronto in the past two years.

Currently, 15 composers are collaborating on Coming Home, a new modern opera through art song, premiering in Toronto on July 14, 2018.

With your help, our project can continue to evolve and include collaborations by not only musicians but artists of all disciplines.

We are striving to create a new work each year that reflects the issues assailing our world, and through our art offer a glimpse at possible solutions.                                              

*London friends we will be having a performance on July 15th in Von Kuster Hall at UWO. 

For more details visit our website: www.artsongcp.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need your help to support all the artists involved in our International Opera. Iranian composer Homa Samiei, German composer Peter Michael von der Nahmer and our two American performers will be joining us for a week of rehearsals and the two performances. 

Part of the cost includes helping our artists come for the rehearsals and performance, as well as to honour their time and hard work over these past few months. 

We have amazing perks for you, from video and audio links of last year's performance to advanced ticket sales for Coming Home this year. 

Every little bit will help us support our artists and allow us to expand into our dream and vision of a multidisciplinary arts collaboration. 

 

 

The Impact

 

This year, Coming Home - an International Opera Through Art Song is exploring the meaning of Home while addressing the issues of the immigrant/ migrant and refugee crisis. The Opera will follow the story of a widow and her young daughter as they tread unknown paths in a search for new beginnings. 

Each composer has contributed one art song in their own unique style exploring the doubts, difficulties, hopes, dreams and fears of the mother and daughter as they search for a new home. The variety of the pieces offers a glimpse at the possibilities of 21st century music. 

You can see examples of our first year's project: Music Drama "Glimpses" on our website: artsongcp.com, or purchase a link to the audio and/or video of last year's "In Wonderland."

 

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Now in its third year, the Art Song Collaborative Project has grown to include 15 composers and 6 performers from Canada and around the world. We want to support each of our artists for their time as well as to continue expanding our vision.

So far we have not been successful securing government grants and sponsorships, mainly due to the lack of support material from previous years. Nonetheless each year I have been able to fund the project myself.

This year we want to guarantee an amazing performance and be able to obtain excellent quality documentation to add to our portfolio. We also want to expand our followers and push our project further both locally and internationally. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We value all kinds of support and we understand the difficulty of monetary donations, so here are alternate ways you can help us: 

* Share our Funding Campaign and Page and help us promote Coming Home

* Help us distribute posters and flyers around Toronto

* Volunteer to assist with ushering  and ticket sales on the day of the performance

* We are always looking for artists to collaborate with if you want to join us on this venture: recording artists, videographers, makeup and hair artists, plastic artists. Email us at artsongcp@gmail.com

story:
Hey there! I'm Karine!   ---- FRANÇAIS PLUS BAS SVP ------- xx

   I was born in the suburbs of Montreal and have always had a passion for singing and writing songs. I've been singing professionally for over 15 years and have had my ups and downs in the music industry. In 2015, after participating in the Canadian version of "The Voice", hit TV show, I decided to leave for 3 years to sing on cruise ships. The plan was to make money, see the world, write some songs and get out of my comfort zone! Mission accomplished!

I am now back with what is my most intimate and honest songwriting work ever. The "shiplife" has it's highs and lows, and it's given me a lot to tell!! I've already invested 30k in my project. The first part of the record was released in 2017, and the final part is planned for October-November 2018. The first radio single "Charlottetown" was quite a success on satellite radios, making it's way to #1 with it's french version on ICI Musique Franco Country (Sirius XM). This helped me believe that people are interested in my stories and hearing the songs! :D

What do I need??

If you can give money, awesome, I'm looking at about 20k in promotion for an updated website, music videos, radio tracking, photoshoot, etc.). If you can't give money, please share my music, my videos, my story!

What do you get??

Asides from my eternal gratitude, I shall be offering digital and-or physical albums, cover videos of your choice, writing songs for your loved ones, personalized videos, bonus tracks and thank yous! If there is a record launch, everyone contributing 50$ or more shall receive an invitation. I don't want to promise a launch as it is a huge expense and I'll have to see how the campaign goes! :)

Thank you so much for your support! Be sure to follow my Facebook page, I'll be sharing updates and lyrics and stories as well as home-made studio clips!! God bless!! xx

________________________________________________

 

Bonjour!!!

 

   Je me présente, Karine, aussi connue comme étant "la fille qui a chanté le plus beau duel de l'histoire de La Voix avec Mathieu Holubowski en 2015"! Je suis née en banlieue de Montréal, il y a déjà 33 ans et je chante depuis! J'ai commencé une carrière professionnelle il y a plus de 15 ans. Suite à mon passage à La Voix en 2015, j'ai décidé de partir chanter dans des troupes sur bateaux de croisière pendant 3 ans. Le plan étant : Faire de l'argent, voyager à travers le monde, écrire des chansons et sortir de ma zone de confort! Me revoilà au Québec en 2018, mission accomplie!!

J'ai lancé la première partie de "The Grand Voyage" en 2017 lorsque j'étais sur un autre navire. L'extrait "Charlottetown" a connu un beau succès via les radios satellites, se retrouvant même au #1 du palmarès Franco Country de Ici Musique (Sirius XM). Ceci m'a porté à croire que ce projet, quoi que thérapeutique et intime, intéressait un public autre que moi-même... Je suis donc retournée en studio pour terminer l'album complet et y ajouter des bonus francophones :)

Ce dont j'ai besoin??

J'ai investi 30 000$ dans la dernière année sur ce merveilleux projet et j'en aurais facilement encore pour 20 000$. Je n'ai pas pu avoir accès à des subventions, donc, me voilà! Votre contribution servira au tournage d'un vidéoclip, mise à jour du site web, séance photo, pistage radio, séances vidéo acoustiques, etc... Beaucoup de travail à faire et j'en suis tout à fait excitée!! Si vous ne pouvez pas donner, svp, partagez, partagez, partagez!!!

Ce que vous recevrez??

En plus de mon éternelle gratitude, j'offrirai l'album en version digitale et-ou physique, je vous chanterez des demandes spéciales personnalisées, je donnerai des pistes inédites en bonus et je pourrai même vous écrire une chanson pour un être cher! Je ne veux pas promettre un lancement comme c'est un autre 2-4000$, mais s'il y a un lancement, tous ceux ayant contribué 50$ et plus à ma campagne recevront une invitation!

Merci énormément de votre soutien! Ceux qui me connaissent déjà savent que je travaille fort depuis longtemps et que je n'ai pas toujours eu de la "chance" dans ce métier. La chance viendra bientôt, ce projet est trop bon pour en faire autrement et avec la persévérance, le travail acharné et le coeur au ventre, on arrive toujours à nos fine! Merci les amis! J'vous embrasse! xx

story:
Project Summary

My name is Rajna Swaminathan, and I'm a mrudangam (South Indian percussion) artist and composer. I grew up playing traditional Karnatik (South Indian classical) music, and this has been the bedrock of my musical thinking. Since 2011, I shifted my professional and creative focus to working in collaborative, cross-cultural settings, particularly in the New York City jazz and improvised music scene. Though I'm currently based in Cambridge, MA, where I'm pursuing a PhD in cross-disciplinary music studies at Harvard University, I still consider much of my work based in New York, which is where I founded the ensemble RAJAS in 2013.

I started RAJAS with the intention of curating a community of musicians who were interested in expanding the possibilities of certain ideas and frameworks found in Indian music and creatively integrating them with concepts and sensibilities in other traditions. The ensemble has taken many shapes since its inception, involving a diverse group of musicians and forging new visions of community: various Indian musical traditions, jazz/creative music, Arabic maqam, Western classical music, and other contemporary improvisational genres. Each performance has sparked new and profound discoveries for each of us, and the time has now come for me to document some of the transformative musical relationships that RAJAS has set in motion.

The recording will feature a core group of musicians who have now become close friends and chosen family: Miles Okazaki (guitar), Stephan Crump (bass), Anjna Swaminathan (violin), Maria Grand (tenor saxophone), and myself on mrudangam. In addition, it will feature two incredible guest artists: Ganavya Doraiswamy (vocal), and Amir ElSaffar (trumpet).

With your generosity, we will finally be able to share this music with a wider audience, and even have the startup resources to be able to tour this project. Specifically, funds collected through this campaign will go toward the recording, production, and distribution costs, the artist fees, and recording-related travel expenses.

Give and Take

(Our music involves a good dose of give and take, and so does this campaign!)

First, here are a few budgeting details, so that you can see where your contributions will go:

Recording/engineering cost (for 2.5 days in studio) -- $2800

Travel for rehearsals/recording (estimated) -- $500

Ensemble artist fees -- $10000

Mixing/mastering/distribution (estimated) -- $1000

Total estimated cost: $14,300

Since I've received a grant of $2500 from my university to support this project, my goal is to raise at least $12,000 through this campaign.

If we raise a little less, funds will primarily go toward paying the artists involved, and I will seek other sources of funding to help get the album mastered and distributed. If we raise more than the requested amount, the additional funds will go into reserve to help RAJAS with future touring expenses.

We would like to offer a few perks to thank you for your generosity!

$1 -- Even a little can go a long way. Everyone who donates at least one dollar will get a public thank you on my artist Facebook page!

$10 -- For those of you who just want to pre-order the album, this early payment will get you access to a digital download of the album when it’s ready!

//*From here onward, you automatically get a download card and physical copy of the CD!*//

$25 -- For your contribution, you will receive a physical copy of the CD, and handwritten thank you note signed by Rajna.

The Conversationalist

$50 -- For your commitment to making this album a reality, you can schedule a 15-20 minute phone/Skype conversation with Rajna on a topic of your choice: the music in the album, rhythm, current events, or just life! You will also receive a handwritten thank you note, as well as a physical copy of the CD signed by Rajna.

The Academic

$100 -- This is a fun perk for academics and bibliophiles -- Rajna will pen an extended, academic version of the liner notes for the album! For your donation, you will receive a copy of the prose as well as an accompanying powerpoint presentation. Warning: it might be jargony, circuitous, and include a bibliography…

The Enthusiast

$200 -- You will be able to schedule a one-hour Skype/in-person lesson with Rajna, Ganavya, or Anjna, on a topic of your choice!

The Collector

$200 -- We will be printing and signing a few posters of the album art and a professionally done band photo, and you will receive one of your choice to put up on a wall or a desk!

The Engineer

$300 -- Rajna will remotely record -- mrudangam, kanjira, or even vocals -- on a song/track of yours!

//*Now, for the deluxe perks...*//

$1000: The Curator I

Commission a solo concert by Rajna!

$1500: The Curator II

Commission a duo concert by Rajna and one other musician!

$3000: The Curator II

Commission a concert by Rajna and three other musicians!

$5000: The Producer

For your incredible generosity and belief in the project, you will be credited as a "producer" on the album.

story:
So, where are we now?

The music for the album is recorded and the documentary is filmed.  Actually, some of the songs on the album were included in independent films over the past few years and toured the world.  The documentary itself enjoyed a couple of festival appearances and even won an award for Best Short Documentary at the Bare Bones International Film & Music Festival!  Making a professional album isn't cheap.  Making an award-winning documentary isn't cheap.  We've taken it all as far as we can.  What we need now is to actually produce the album, along with the documentary, in a rare single-package release. 
 

How can you help and what can you get?

Here's a break down in more detail:

  • We have tons of perks at varying levels.  You can find them all on this IndieGoGo campaign page.  For each perk purchased, we will donate 10% of the perk's price, to a local school band.  Perks include social media shout-outs, access to downloadable content, stickers, posters, shirts, the CD/DVD release itself, inclusions in the liner notes for "Thank You's" and "Special Thanks", autographed content, bonus gifts, live performances and, finally, a single Producer credit that includes a live performance as well as a custom CD/DVD of that live performance!
  • Funds donated to reach our goal will only be used to cover the costs of production and perks.  Absolutely none of those funds will go toward anything else.  If costs come in below our goal we will donate 100% of that difference to at least one local school band.  If we achieve, and pass, our goal, we will donate 50% of the overage directly to at least one local school band.  If we run into any additional costs, that exceed our goal, we will find some way to cover that ourselves.  
  • At the close of the campaign we will start the purchasing process to cover all of the perks.  We expect it to take no more than 60 days to complete all procurement from vendors and all shipping to donors. 

Other ways you can help.

We absolutely understand that times can be tough and that's one of the reasons we are running this campaign.  We all have families and day jobs after all.  If you can't contribute financially, we simply ask that you help us advertise this campaign.  If we are able to fully fund the campaign, we may be able to find a way to repay you with a perk as well.  Keep a lookout for opportunities of ways you can help.  Please share our posts from social media and use the sharing tools provided by Indie GoGo to share the campaign.  Thank You!
story_txt:
So, where are we now?
The music for the album is recorded and the documentary is filmed.  Actually, some of the songs on the album were included in independent films over the past few years and toured the world.  The documentary itself enjoyed a couple of festival appearances and even won an award for Best Short Documentary at the Bare Bones International Film & Music Festival!  Making a professional album isn't cheap.  Making an award-winning documentary isn't cheap.  We've taken it all as far as we can.  What we need now is to actually produce the album, along with the documentary, in a rare single-package release.  
How can you help and what can you get?

Here's a break down in more detail:

We have tons of perks at varying levels.  You can find them all on this IndieGoGo campaign page.  For each perk purchased, we will donate 10% of the perk's price, to a local school band.  Perks include social media shout-outs, access to downloadable content, stickers, posters, shirts, the CD/DVD release itself, inclusions in the liner notes for "Thank You's" and "Special Thanks", autographed content, bonus gifts, live performances and, finally, a single Producer credit that includes a live performance as well as a custom CD/DVD of that live performance!
Funds donated to reach our goal will only be used to cover the costs of production and perks.  Absolutely none of those funds will go toward anything else.  If costs come in below our goal we will donate 100% of that difference to at least one local school band.  If we achieve, and pass, our goal, we will donate 50% of the overage directly to at least one local school band.  If we run into any additional costs, that exceed our goal, we will find some way to cover that ourselves.  
At the close of the campaign we will start the purchasing process to cover all of the perks.  We expect it to take no more than 60 days to complete all procurement from vendors and all shipping to donors. 

Other ways you can help.We absolutely understand that times can be tough and that's one of the reasons we are running this campaign.  We all have families and day jobs after all.  If you can't contribute financially, we simply ask that you help us advertise this campaign.  If we are able to fully fund the campaign, we may be able to find a way to repay you with a perk as well.  Keep a lookout for opportunities of ways you can help.  Please share our posts from social media and use the sharing tools provided by Indie GoGo to share the campaign.  Thank You!

story:
A brief history of Mermaids... 

"Mermaids on the Verandah," is the second full length album from Los Angeles based Psychedelic/Rock band Send Medicine. Clocking in a little under 45 minutes, the album contains 9 original songs, 8 of which are unreleased, and also includes the single "She Believes in the Devil," which was released as a single in 2017. 

The band has been sitting on this album for a little over a year and after bouncing around different releasing strategies, and various label support, we've decided to finally put it out on July 27 via the mom and pop label; "Honey House" based in San Francisco. 

The album was recorded back in December of 2016 at Stationhouse in Echo Park Los Angeles, under the wizardry of Mark Rains and was mixed in the following months by then bassist; Aaron Stern and lead singer/guitarist Julian Hacquebard. 

The album's personnel includes: Julian Hacquebard; Guitar/VOX, Ryan Patrick Glennan; Theremin, Keys, Percussion, Harmonica, VOX, Lauren Grimaldi; Percussion, Aaron Stern; Bass, Keys, Piano, Curran McDowell; Drums, Percussion, Davey Donaldson; Guitar, Piano, Pyper Wyn Davies; VOX. 

We're extremely proud of this collection of songs. As a whole, we see them as an exciting new step forward into the band's sonic pilgrimage. There's something for everyone on this record and we are very excited to share it with YOU! 

If you want to check out some of our previous music and videos head over here! 

sendmedicineband.com/epk

 

Why we need your help...

As you're probably aware, being a musician in 2018 poses a lot of challenges. The triangulation of "music purchasing" being supplanted under a sea of streaming services, while also trying to get your music heard and discovered in the labyrinth of available media, are both extremely trying on bands.

As a result of this, we've decided to attempt to raise some funds to kick into several marketing strategies for the album, as well as a radio campaign, in the hopes of letting the album cast a wider net on the ears of new listeners, hopefully spawning new opportunities that allow the band to keep creating more music. 

In September of 2018 we'll also be hitting the road for a national tour to further promote the album, and are trying to reel in some very minimal touring expenses!

 

Perks for Donating!!

We have collected a bunch of incentives for those of you willing to support our vision and help uplift this record! These include the album itself; in both Digital, CD and Vinyl formats! T Shirts, original artwork, a book of handwritten lyrics and more intimate perks as well!

*ALSO: if you can think of some other great PERKS we should add, please email us at: sendmedicineband@gmail.com // subject: "PERK IDEA" 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute in a financial way, no worries!

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Help share our campaign on social media!
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone, I am Vanessa Rath the director who will be working alongside the artist Phillip McNair. For Phil's EP we decided to shoot a music video for his song My Moment. It is about finding yourself and inspiring people to fight for their dreams. It is Phil's first music video and we are looking to find others who share the same enthusiasm as us and follow us on this journey. 

What We Need To Finance:

  • Location
  • Catering
  • Permits
  • Rentals
  • Production Design

With your help, you can also receive great perks.

The Impact

This is Phil McNair's debut. With your support, you can elevate this production and be part of his start as an aspiring artist.

Challenges

Our main challenges will be shooting in the desert and the special effects. But with our great team, we will be able to plan everything out and create an amazing music video.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, you can support us by sharing this campaign and spreading the word about the music video!

Thank you!

story:
A Little Background Info:

 

Kuhl is Cas Greenfield and Mikey Cooling.

 

‘The Circus of Outrageous’ was recorded at Kuhl’s work-in-progress Grammofonica studios in the Severn Plains, close to the fine City of Gloucester. 

 

The final selection of twelve tracks were then skilfully mastered by Pete Maher.

And now ‘Circus’ is ready to take on the world! 

 

Kuhl Ways You Can Help.

 

Our goal is to raise £9250 to complete the projects we have started with Kuhl. 

 

We have created ‘Circus’ on a budget of nothing. The studio and production costs have been pared back as far as we could, but now, we need to consolidate the work we have invested in our projects and the extra outlay and costs are unavoidable. 

 

Kuhl’s Projects.

 

We are currently rehearsing a touring band so that we can take ‘Circus’ on the road and around the festivals in 2018. This is one area we need key funding badly - covering rehearsal rooms, promotional material, running the office while attempting to draw in the kind of promoters who can put us in front of our public. 

 

Plus, since beginning work on ‘Circus’ we have been compiling footage to create an hour long documentary movie about the evolution of Kuhl, culminating in a definitive live gig filmed before an invited audience. We will be adding more details about this exciting development shortly and your pledge toward this project will guarantee you a producer’s credit!

 

We are grateful for your input at any level, whether you’d simply like a Kuhl MP3 Download, a signed Limited Edition Digipak CD or an exclusive framed print of the album artwork. 

 

YOU are the fuel that will keep the Kuhl engine turning!

 

 

Are We Real?

 

Oh yes! We live, we breathe, we create…

We’re bringing deep and intense composition coupled with a dose of mad humour often missing in electronic music today. There are real people behind the creation that is Kuhl’s multicoloured Circus. 

 

The artwork and the lyrics flow from Cas Greenfield’s imagination and meld with staggering synchronicity with Mikey’s quirky way with a tune. ‘Kashablankha!’ had us both rolling on the floor of the studio in hysterics! ‘Uber’ is just crazy! But ‘Head Rush’ and ‘Don’t Look Down’ brought us to tears…

 

How Did We Get From There To Here?

 

‘Circus was born out of frustration - Mikey and I are both creatives and when introduced to a studio and recording company that seemed excited about the writing and production team we are, we thought we would blossom, but lack of business acumen, bad decision making and general shortsightedness on the part of the company owners simply stifled any creativity that should have flourished… So, Kuhl grew out of that. We felt like errant school kids at the end of a long hard day - we threw ourselves unfettered into the joy of music making.’

 

The Master Plan. 

 

There was no ‘Master Plan’ at first, until…

 

Cas: ‘One night we suddenly had ‘Uber’ in the can. A spontaneous and joyous outpouring that led the way forward. Another night and ’Zsa Zsa’ took centre stage.  One long small hours session and there was ‘Don’t Look Down’ and somewhere along the way ‘Civilisation’ became a reality.

 

And we ended up with twelve tracks that we are constantly surprised by, thrilled, with and still wondering when and how they came into being.

 

The artwork too became part of this serendipitous experiment. Leaving paintings out in the rain just to see what the elements and the beasts of the field would do to the pastels. Glorious decomposition!’

 

Mikey: ‘We had not planned to build this stripy Big Top of an album - but here it is now, we just can’t stop the carnival! Ringmaster, acrobats, freaks, beasts, jugglers and clowns waiting in the wings and ready to roll!’

 

 

 

Music Maestro, Please!

 

With tracks that draw in everything from human rights to female impersonators, from the first kiss to the last breath, from film noir to Shakespeare, from the state of the heart to the state of the world, Kuhl’s ‘Circus’ is an intelligent combination of hard and soft beats with thought provoking lyrics. 


Pink Floyd and Depeche Mode meet the Pet Shop Boys and Prince? You may not be far off!

 

But judge for yourself. 

 

 

Love, Peace and a Global mindset!

 

‘Circus’ has a truly international feel, with tracks in English, Dutch, German, Italian and Kuhlspeak.

 

‘Space Cake’ features a gentle and nostalgic rap in Dutch, while ‘You, Me, The Stars & Love’ speaks its words of love in Italian.

 

Kuhl finds their inspiration in the disco of the 1970s and 80s, with the beats of today’s stadium noise permeating the groove. Euro bands such as Army of Lovers, Gravitonas, PSB creep through the undergrowth of sound, with Skrillex, Knife Party and the like informing the cutting edge production. 

 

The Circus Is Coming To Town!

 

 

Pick a Perk

 

We’ve tried to keep this part simple. We’re not after donations. We’d very much like to raise money on a quid pro quo basis, through worthwhile rewards and perks, but we’re always open to your ideas and suggestions. If you have any thoughts about what you would like to see offered, drop us a line at kuhl@ubertanz.com. 

 

But if you do just want to send money and skip the perks, simply click on the big pink "BACK IT" button.  And if you’ve managed to read this far, then well done and many thanks! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Follow Kuhl on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, Hearnow or join our mailing list

Check out our sales pages on iTunes, CD Baby, Amazon & Spotify

Share this campaign!

 

If you've enjoyed the recordings we’ve presented on ‘Circus Of Outrageous’, we would appreciate  a fair rating on iTunes, and writing an honest review would be wonderful. 

 

Buy our music on iTunes, Amazon or listen and follow on Apple Music and Spotify


Above all, we sincerely hope that you enjoy our music, our visuals and can share in the passion we have for our art. Thank you for being a part of this magical celebration of the senses.

 

Keep Kuhl!

story:
INTRODUCTION

Photo by: Justin Fvller

--

Hello folks! Thank you so much for joining me. I am a drummer, singer-songwriter, guitarist, and pianist from Asbury Park, NJ. I am extremely excited to share this MASSIVE feat and labor of love of an album with you. The album is called "When It Happens To You."  The title comes from a poem written almost two years ago.

 

It was recorded at Cedar Sounds in Oceanport, NJ. Engineered by Tim Pannella and Joey Henderson.  Produced, written and arranged by Rachel Ana Dobken. 

I am beyond lucky to have such a phenomenal cast of musicians on this: 

  • Rachel Ana Dobken (drums, guitar, voice, piano)
  • Dan Haase (bass)
  • Ryan MacLean (guitar)
  • Joey Henderson (guitar, voice)
  • Chris Dubrow (bass)
  • Andrew Jackle (drums)
  • Mark Masefield (B3 hammond)
  • Danny Clinch (harmonica)
  • Ian Gray (trombone)
  • Bruce Krywinsky (trumpet)
  • Dennis Daly (sax)
  • Gabe Sanderson (keys)

Currently being mixed by: Kyle Joseph

It is a HUGE task to create an album. From concept to completion, it can take months, even years.  From arrangements, to rehearsals, shows, to sleep (lack-thereof), and all the crazy decisions in between (Guitar tones! Why does my voice not work like it's supposed to today! Who am I and why am I here anymore!), it takes a lot of time, energy, and MONEY... yes all of that. 

 

--

WHAT WE NEED

--

While I have funded as much as I can out of my own pocket, I am still in need of your gracious support! Everything you donate will go toward to the following expenses (and then some):

  • Tracking
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Paying musicians
  • Physical CD distribution
  • Online digital distribution (Spotify, Itunes/Apple Music, etc... )
  • CONTENT: Video + Photography costs
  • Marketing/PR/Exposure
    • ​In 2018, putting out a great record means NOTHING unless you have the proper exposure behind it.  This campaign is not only serving the album financially, but by having you share our Indiegogo (whether you donate or not), it allows us to gain a whole new level of exposure and expand our fanbase that we wouldn't otherwise get.

 

* So, even if you can't donate, PLEASE share our Campaign in hopes of getting Rachel Ana Dobken & Band the exposure they deserve!

 

 

Photos by: Michael Kravetsky, Matt Raspanti, Conni Freestone

--

WHAT YOU GET!

--

First, if you'd like to just donate you are more than welcome to! If you'd like to donate more than an item listed, but still wish to receive said item, please message us and we will gladly accommodate!

  1. $5- Personalized Thank You Note (PTY)
  2. $12- Digital Download + PTY
  3. $25- Signed Album + Digital Download + PTY
  4. $60- RAD T-shirt + Album (choice of Signed, Digital or both) + PTY​
    • Rachel is also a Graphic Designer and would love for you to enjoy these special T's that she designed! Choice of black or white. 
  5. $85- Ultimate RAD Merch Package: RAD T-shirt, Sticker, Pin, Album (Signed, Digital or both) + PTY
  6. $115- Graphic Design Work + Album (Signed, Digital or both) + PTY​
    • This perk gets you 3 HOURS MAX of design work for whatever project it may be. Need more time, no worries! Message us and we'll come up with a special discounted hourly rate to make your visual dreams come true! SAMPLES
  7. ​$125- Album Release Show Package:  2 Tickets to Asbury Release Show (**SEPT. 8, 2018 AT ASBURY LANES w/ The Mercury Brothers + much more!**) + RAD Merch Package!
  8. $130- *LIMITED OFFER* Danny Clinch Collab- Signed copy of "Still Moving" + Album (Signed, Digital or both)  + PTY​ 
    • Rachel works closely with world renowned rock photographer Danny Clinch at his Transparent Gallery in Asbury Park, NJ.  Aside from playing together on Saturdays and Special Shows at the gallery, and on the album, Danny has generously donated 4 books of some of his greatest work in Still Moving. We are offering a One-Time-Only Combo Pack of Signed Book + RAD goodies!
  9. $130- *LIMITED OFFER* The Band Photographs, 1968-1969, by Elliott Landy signed by Rachel & Elliott Landy + Album (Signed, Digital or both) + PTY​
    • Rachel designed and edited famous rock photographer, Elliott Landy's fine art photo book, The Band Photographs, 1968-1969. He generously donated 5 books, and we are offering a One-Time-Only Combo Pack of Signed Book + RAD goodies!
  10. $200- Exclusive Personal Cover Video + Song + Album (Signed, Digital or both)  + PTY​
    • Have a song you'd love Rachel to cover? She'll learn it, personally dedicate it to you, film and send it to you! 
  11. $800- Rachel Ana Dobken Solo Show + Album (Signed Physical, Digital or both)  + RAD T-Shirt + PTY ​ 
    • Solo show at a location of your choosing (nothing sketchy please)! If it's 75 mile radius outside of Asbury Park, NJ, let's talk details. To be delivered 11/2018

 

RAD T-SHIRT:

                                                                 

CLOSE UP:

 

STICKERS:

 

 

THE BAND PHOTOGRAPHS, 1968-1969          

 

Still Moving

 

 

SPECIAL THANKS TO:

Matt Raspanti, SUPRO guitars, Telegraph Hill Records, Justin Fuller, Glenn Harris, Derek Brad, Michael Kravetsky, Conni Freestone, my parents Denise & Jeff Dobken, Mike LaMarca, Brenna Keeley, Danny + Maria Clinch, Tina Kerekes, Elliott + Linda Landy, SoundEvolution Music/Rob Janicke, my family and friends and all of the amazing folks (INCLUDING YOU!) who are working with me to make this dream a reality.

--

Photos by: Justin Fuller, Matt Raspanti, Michael Kravetsky, Conni Freestone, Danny Clinch

    LINKS:

    WEBSITE

    FACEBOOK

    INSTAGRAM

    BANDCAMP / SOUNDCLOUD

    TWITTER

    --

    photo by: Danny Clinch

It is a HUGE task to create an album. From concept to completion, it can take months, even years.  From arrangements, to rehearsals, shows, to sleep (lack-thereof), and all the crazy decisions in between (Guitar tones! Why does my voice not work like it's supposed to today! Who am I and why am I here anymore!), it takes a lot of time, energy, and MONEY... yes all of that. 
 

--
WHAT WE NEED
--
While I have funded as much as I can out of my own pocket, I am still in need of your gracious support! Everything you donate will go toward to the following expenses (and then some):

Tracking
Mixing
Mastering
Paying musicians
Physical CD distribution
Online digital distribution (Spotify, Itunes/Apple Music, etc... )
CONTENT: Video + Photography costs
Marketing/PR/Exposure​In 2018, putting out a great record means NOTHING unless you have the proper exposure behind it.  This campaign is not only serving the album financially, but by having you share our Indiegogo (whether you donate or not), it allows us to gain a whole new level of exposure and expand our fanbase that we wouldn't otherwise get.


 
* So, even if you can't donate, PLEASE share our Campaign in hopes of getting Rachel Ana Dobken & Band the exposure they deserve!
 
 






Photos by: Michael Kravetsky, Matt Raspanti, Conni Freestone
--
WHAT YOU GET!
--
First, if you'd like to just donate you are more than welcome to! If you'd like to donate more than an item listed, but still wish to receive said item, please message us and we will gladly accommodate!

$5- Personalized Thank You Note (PTY)

$12- Digital Download + PTY

$25- Signed Album + Digital Download + PTY

$60- RAD T-shirt + Album (choice of Signed, Digital or both) + PTY​Rachel is also a Graphic Designer and would love for you to enjoy these special T's that she designed! Choice of black or white. 


$85- Ultimate RAD Merch Package: RAD T-shirt, Sticker, Pin, Album (Signed, Digital or both) + PTY

$115- Graphic Design Work + Album (Signed, Digital or both) + PTY​This perk gets you 3 HOURS MAX of design work for whatever project it may be. Need more time, no worries! Message us and we'll come up with a special discounted hourly rate to make your visual dreams come true! SAMPLES


​$125- Album Release Show Package:  2 Tickets to Asbury Release Show (**SEPT. 8, 2018 AT ASBURY LANES w/ The Mercury Brothers + much more!**) + RAD Merch Package!

$130- *LIMITED OFFER* Danny Clinch Collab- Signed copy of "Still Moving" + Album (Signed, Digital or both)  + PTY​ Rachel works closely with world renowned rock photographer Danny Clinch at his Transparent Gallery in Asbury Park, NJ.  Aside from playing together on Saturdays and Special Shows at the gallery, and on the album, Danny has generously donated 4 books of some of his greatest work in Still Moving. We are offering a One-Time-Only Combo Pack of Signed Book + RAD goodies!


$130- *LIMITED OFFER* The Band Photographs, 1968-1969, by Elliott Landy signed by Rachel & Elliott Landy + Album (Signed, Digital or both) + PTY​Rachel designed and edited famous rock photographer, Elliott Landy's fine art photo book, The Band Photographs, 1968-1969. He generously donated 5 books, and we are offering a One-Time-Only Combo Pack of Signed Book + RAD goodies!


$200- Exclusive Personal Cover Video + Song + Album (Signed, Digital or both)  + PTY​Have a song you'd love Rachel to cover? She'll learn it, personally dedicate it to you, film and send it to you! 


$800- Rachel Ana Dobken Solo Show + Album (Signed Physical, Digital or both)  + RAD T-Shirt + PTY ​ Solo show at a location of your choosing (nothing sketchy please)! If it's 75 mile radius outside of Asbury Park, NJ, let's talk details. To be delivered 11/2018


 
RAD T-SHIRT:

                                                                  
CLOSE UP:
 
STICKERS:

 
 
THE BAND PHOTOGRAPHS, 1968-1969          

 
Still Moving

 
 
SPECIAL THANKS TO:
Matt Raspanti, SUPRO guitars, Telegraph Hill Records, Justin Fuller, Glenn Harris, Derek Brad, Michael Kravetsky, Conni Freestone, my parents Denise & Jeff Dobken, Mike LaMarca, Brenna Keeley, Danny + Maria Clinch, Tina Kerekes, Elliott + Linda Landy, SoundEvolution Music/Rob Janicke, my family and friends and all of the amazing folks (INCLUDING YOU!) who are working with me to make this dream a reality.
--
Photos by: Justin Fuller, Matt Raspanti, Michael Kravetsky, Conni Freestone, Danny Clinch


LINKS:
WEBSITE
FACEBOOK
INSTAGRAM
BANDCAMP / SOUNDCLOUD
TWITTER

photo by: Danny Clinch

story:
Hey, My Name is Weston

           As you can no doubt surmise, I am reaching out to the world to get some help funding my second album release, titled "When You Least Expect It".  I have been working on this record, at home, in my studio, for over a year, selecting the best players and friends Nashville has to offer to help me along the way.  I record on a Tascam 388 (a very interesting tape machine/mixing board from the 80s that Dr. Dog and The Black Keys used on their first couple of records) in my bedroom, with very basic microphones and a whole lot of time and effort.   I recorded and released my first album in the same manner, and sunk a whole lot of my own money into getting it made into vinyl records and CDs, and promoting it on my own.   I also went ahead and self financed a video for the first single off of this record, which you can find attached to the page.

          This time around, I have a bigger scope.  I need the funds to put the record out on CD and Vinyl, which this campaign will cover, along with other products like T-shirts and Hats that I can sell at my shows to further fund my endeavors.  Having that off my plate will allow me to invest in a PR campaign so that I can get someone to listen to it in the industry and hopefully get me reviews in publications and blogs, and get me interviewed on podcasts and radio shows.  

         I have simple expectations for a musician in Nashville.  I don't need to get rich or famous.  I don't need to go rent out extravagant studios, and hire engineers and producers, when I enjoy doing it mostly on my own (mixing and mastering I did outsource*).   What I need is just to get my music out to the people who enjoy it, and hopefully make some friends along the way.  

 

How you can help:

         If you can donate some of your hard earned cash, I would be forever grateful.   However, know that there are other ways to help me.   If you cannot do so financially, please help spread the word to folks you think might like the record, and can.   I find that the music I make is generally pretty palatable for anyone that likes rock and roll, roots music, country, or anything that is made with guitars.   Tell your aunts, tell your cousins, tell your boss.   I would love to make some new fans in the process of launching this campaign.   

        Thank you for your time, and thank you for all of your help, in advance.
