story:
October 18th, 2018!    121 Cassidy Point Dr. Portland, ME 04102  (parking on site)

6:30pm - Community Dinner    7:30pm - Concert and Recording

****PLEASE NOTE: Options for the dinner perk has now closed*****

I've been ambitious.  At age 22 I started crisscrossing the country, writing behind the wheel (figuratively), and performing any chance I could.  I played hundreds of shows (solo and with the band), gained a following, self-published four albums, and made a lot of friends along the way...and I burned out.  I left a good deal of professional momentum behind in 2009 to travel around the globe studying intentional communities and to find a more meaningful way of engaging with music, the medium that calls me.  Music was the language we all spoke and I met people making a positive impact in their communities through the arts.

In 2011, I returned to co-launch (with Deb Bicknell) a project, in partnership with Seeds Of Peace, that brought together musicians and artists from countries in conflict to make music together in Portland.  I believe music is a force for good in this world.  Throughout my career, I've been able to support many organizations, communities, and causes that are doing important and impactful work.  I also believe that music is essential to our being and connects us to our deepest humanity

                                      When music is made, a community is made. 

I invite you to be part of a special community this for one night.

I’ve spent much of the past six years as a teaching artist in Portland Public Schools (like the Telling Room, Maine Academy of Modern Music, and 317 Community Music Center) and, primarily, holding onto the threads of my creative identity as I became a mother. I'm ready to stake my claim as a songwriter again, affirm my role as an artist, and release these songs that have been born of the last decade.  I can't do this without a new body of work and video to work with. And I'm really ready to have some fun doing it!


I'm most excited to be performing with long-time bandmates: Adam Frederick (bass), Seth Kearns (drums), Max Cantlin (guitar) with the incredible addition of friends (and forces to be reckoned with): Kate Bever (vibes/percussion) and Sorcha Cribben-Merrill (guitar/voice).  There will be some special guests too!
 
                                                       

                                                                    "The Wee Hours" Live at OLS

The Songs:

Fear, Love & Hope rise to the surface with these songs as themes.  As in much of my work, the natural world provides the foil, origin, and mirror to these emotions and provides a deep source of inspiration.

Prepare yourself for a rich tapestry of sound that grooves and will likely make your head nod and hips move.

 

Your Generous Contributions Will Support:

  • The Band - I believe hard-working, skillful musicians should be compensated fairly
  • The Audio Recording - Engineering by impeccable Ryan Wallace, formally of the State Theater
  • The Video Recording - Captured by the skillful Pete Nenortas at Satronon Sound
  • Lights, PA, Staging, Chairs.... basically, the venue
  • Art materials for local artists to create a custom installation that will boost the creative and acoustic integrity of the space
  • Mastering
  • "Limited Edition" Duplication
                                                         

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute you can still be a part of the project by sharing this campaign!  I will be setting tickets aside for anyone who might have a hard time with the ticket price.  Just email me.

We also need real helping hands before, during, and after the show.  If you're interested, give me a shout.

Got 150+ chairs we can use??

Got folding tables?

Thank you for supporting this project!

"Limited Edition" Duplication

We also need real helping hands before, during, and after the show.  If you're interested, give me a shout.

story:
Who is Bric-a-Brac?

Many moons ago, John Connors and Mike Armstrong met and quickly discovered their mutual love of obscure records and songs, many of which they discovered on records purchased at thrift stores. Active in the local music scene at the time, John and Mike thought it would be fun to form a band and play these songs live, so that others might also enjoy what they found so compelling. Bric-a-Brac was formed and had their first gig at the legendary Chicago club Lounge Ax. 20 years on, the band is still going strong and ready to release a brand new record filled with 11 weird and wonderful tunes. Songs with sounds and styles ranging from jumpy numbers about odd romantic attractions to tragic sea ballads.

How you can help & what you will get

The album is "in the can" - recorded, mixed & mastered. To get it released, we we need money for the following items:

  • Because these songs are not our own (culled from thrift store records) we need to secure licensing to release them to the public. Half of the money raised will go to initial licensing costs.
  • We will press as many CDs as we can, the aim is to do 200 initially, and add more as needed.
  • The rest of the money will go to distribution, shipping & promotional costs.
  • All backers will get a copy of the record as a Digital Download, CD, or both - depending on what level they choose.
  • Higher-level backers will get a super de-luxe package in the mail with CD, Digital Download Card, and one piece of high-quality "bric-a-brac" to add to their collection.
  • Bric-a-Brac t-shirts will also be available at certain levels.
  • If we do not reach our goal, the funds we raise will go toward licensing. If and when we are able to raise the rest, we will release the record.

How your help makes an impact

There is a vast quantity of great songs out there that nobody will ever hear. Some of these songs will be forever trapped in obscurity, bound to the third track on the second side of an oddball record, or on the b-side of a 78 rpm single:

  • We believe these songs deserve to be heard, shared, enjoyed and preserved for future generations. This is no small task!
  • We have rescued many songs from obscurity, some of which made it onto our two previous albums 16 Luxury Units, and Three Weeks from Yesterday (our tribute to Rod McKuen). We play the rest at our live shows and with your help, we can add these 11 gems to the catalog!
  • Besides our regular internet streams, some of these songs have even made it onto TV and radio - ("What's My Name" played on This American Life). With your help, just imagine where else we can get these songs played and heard by others!
  • We empathize with the songwriters who put their sweat and soul into these songs. We try to do right by them and play homage to them the best way we can.

This project is incredibly important to us, and we love these songs as if they were our very own. If we don't get this record out, these songs run the risk of remaining in obscurity forever.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute at this time, please forward this campaign on to those that may be able to. We appreciate any and all help we can get.

THANK YOU!
Your friends, Bric-a-Brac

story:
"Rahu The Fool" is a musical band, performing songs inspired by grandfathers' stories of love and war, of the vast seas and countryside meadows, as well as other things long forgotten — life in the old times and the bright moments of the present affairs.

In terms of music, the ensemble tries not to stick upon a certain cliché. Yet for the customs and to label things fair, their music can be classified as traditional jazz, with sparkles of jug-band, folk, bluegrass and world music.

 

Why double the trouble? 

The first CD by the name of "RAHU" will include various Latvian ditties, folk and sailor songs, as well as compositions from Rolands Kalniņ'š movie classic "Four White Shirts" (Četri Balti Krekli, 1967). The second CD named "THE FOOL" will feature traditional jazz, Mississippi Blues, and Western Folk music. Each CD will contain 14 tracks, including original compositions, covers and different folk music arrangements.

Along with dope tracks from the present and past, the album will include an original inside book with authentic photos from our grandfathers and grandmothers, along with our own photographs shot on vintage 1890' Burke & James photo camera!

The aim of the album is to revive the cultural and historical heritage of Latvia from the early 20th century — closely resembling the so-called popular (ditty, schlager) and work songs. Album's repertoire covers various themes of Latvian life, from love affairs and pubs to philosophical theses and political issues. These songs are often carried out in a satirical, theatrical format.

This album also aims to highlight folk music traditions from other nations and countries, created around the 20th century and even older times. Among these pieces are Estonian, Ukrainian and Belorussian dances, the blues of the Mississippi region, as well as one of the oldest songs included in the album — the original melody of a 15th-century sailor song. This album was inspired by Brāļi Laivinieki, Edgars Liepiņš, Imants Kalniņš, Blind Boy Fuller and Memphis Jug band. 

Guest artists in this album are the lead singer from blues-rock band The Coco'nuts - Marija Broča, and professional skateboarder Madars Apse, performing compositions from Mississippi John Hurt.

 

Why we need your support?

We've been paying from our own pockets for most of the necessities for the album presentation concert and two songs mixed and mastered already. Unfortunately, the creation of an album doesn't end there and we still are in need of:

  • mixing and mastering the rest of the songs - 1100.00,
  • CD - design & physical production - 900.00
  • Album distribution on music streaming sites - 60.00,
  • Album promotion activities - 200.00, 
  • Sound equipment rental for the album presentation concert - 450.00.

In return, we will probably love you for ever. Also, without or undying gratitude, we offer some perks that you can spot on that column on the right. 

 

Other ways you can help

Don't be sad, amigo. Just because you cannot contribute right now, doesn't mean you can't help us. Share this and help us get the word out!

story:
This funding campaign is to help shoot the visual album for the, already completed "Betrayal Of The Machine"

 

My name is Michael Moog — Record producer, artist, musician, remixer, songwriter and last, but not least, music fanatic.

In my lifetime, I have had the good fortune to work with extremely talented musicians, artist and producers. I have been blessed with the opportunity to witness (first-hand) numerous acts go from incredibly humble beginnings to stadium sellout global superstars!

Nearly every single successful act or project with which I have ever been involved or have witnessed, has had a golden thread that connects them all — a team comprised of a stellar record label, management, publicist, booking agency, support team, and in most cases, all the above.

A team highly focused on a singular vision and mission is the only way to create motion. I have only just begun this motion and am now seeking the support required to establish a team that will make this project blossom into fruition.

My project is titled, “BETRAYAL OF THE MACHINE.” The story is about a man who has a dream - a nightmare so vivid and jarring - that when he wakes up, he begins a journey to discover whether the dream was real or if it was a premonition of events to come.
Midway through his trek, he realizes that there are no answers to be found, so he decides to send an S.O.S. 200 years into the future, in search for answers about his chaotic nightmare.

It has been quite the journey creating the music, finding the words, connecting melodies, and acquiring the right combination of artists, including myself, to tell this story about us - humans struggling to maintain humanity in this ever-changing world that is simultaneously expanding, shrinking, imploding and exploding.

I am beyond fortunate to have the support of myriad colleagues and friends who may have participated directly in the project or indirectly pushed me through emotionally charged conviction to release this project.

This is where your support kicks in.

What we need, and what you get.

To create the visual album for Betrayal Of The Machine (b.o.t.m.), we will be assembling a small creative arsenal of directors, producers, cinematographers, wardrobe directors/stylists, makeup artists, location scouts, and crew.

The funds raised through this campaign will finance this and so much more.

What you will get for your support is the album and visual component of Betrayal Of The Machine (plus various awesome perks), which I hope will serve as the impetus for conversations through music of righting the wrongs that divide us, and hopefully will help move humanity forward.

The Impact

The impact of your participation is immeasurable beyond words, and will truly help me bring this vision to life, which will ultimately serve to help spread the vision of acquiring and sustaining consciousness that this world so desperately needs.
story_txt: This funding campaign is to help shoot the visual album for the, already completed "Betrayal Of The Machine"  My name is Michael Moog — Record producer, artist, musician, remixer, songwriter and last, but not least, music fanatic.In my lifetime, I have had the good fortune to work with extremely talented musicians, artist and producers. I have been blessed with the opportunity to witness (first-hand) numerous acts go from incredibly humble beginnings to stadium sellout global superstars!Nearly every single successful act or project with which I have ever been involved or have witnessed, has had a golden thread that connects them all — a team comprised of a stellar record label, management, publicist, booking agency, support team, and in most cases, all the above.A team highly focused on a singular vision and mission is the only way to create motion. I have only just begun this motion and am now seeking the support required to establish a team that will make this project blossom into fruition.My project is titled, “BETRAYAL OF THE MACHINE.” The story is about a man who has a dream - a nightmare so vivid and jarring - that when he wakes up, he begins a journey to discover whether the dream was real or if it was a premonition of events to come.Midway through his trek, he realizes that there are no answers to be found, so he decides to send an S.O.S. 200 years into the future, in search for answers about his chaotic nightmare.It has been quite the journey creating the music, finding the words, connecting melodies, and acquiring the right combination of artists, including myself, to tell this story about us - humans struggling to maintain humanity in this ever-changing world that is simultaneously expanding, shrinking, imploding and exploding.I am beyond fortunate to have the support of myriad colleagues and friends who may have participated directly in the project or indirectly pushed me through emotionally charged conviction to release this project.This is where your support kicks in.What we need, and what you get.To create the visual album for Betrayal Of The Machine (b.o.t.m.), we will be assembling a small creative arsenal of directors, producers, cinematographers, wardrobe directors/stylists, makeup artists, location scouts, and crew.The funds raised through this campaign will finance this and so much more.What you will get for your support is the album and visual component of Betrayal Of The Machine (plus various awesome perks), which I hope will serve as the impetus for conversations through music of righting the wrongs that divide us, and hopefully will help move humanity forward.The ImpactThe impact of your participation is immeasurable beyond words, and will truly help me bring this vision to life, which will ultimately serve to help spread the vision of acquiring and sustaining consciousness that this world so desperately needs.

story:
Hello! We are the Peeces. We were sent here to help with the new, coming age of enlightenment, and ONE.

I am Jerry Douglas, and it is now, 2018, in Los Angeles, CA. This is my story…. A story of leading a band called The Peeces.

I started with music from a very young age, leading my Grandma’s gospel church choir into song, at 3 years old.  I suppose my first memory of rocking out may have been performing in the mirror with a Prince album,  that my Aunt put on. I also remember my mom going crazy watching Michael Jackson perform, you could say she was a fan!

From then, I started to fall more in love with music as I performed solos with the honor choir, in Elementary, and with the show choir, in high school.  The Beach Boys’ “Barbara Ann” was a tricky falsetto to nail, considering the voice changes that took place around my sophomore year. Our choir director helped me through, though, as he did with everything from madrigals to Cole Porter jazz.

Once I could afford a band rehearsal space, I started putting together bands and I haven’t stopped since.

Taught myself to play and sing by playing along with Nirvana’s “Nevermind” album, and the radio, in my hometown of Sacramento, CA.  The love of that album lead to me starting a band called The Heylos. The first song I ever sang with my own rock band was Radiohead’s “Creep.”

When it came time to move the band down to Los Angeles, and into the industry, I was the only one who took the plunge. Once I got here, I formed a band called The Persuns, and we got a band rehearsal space located between the Echoplex and Satellite, on the Echo Park/Silverlake border. 

The Persuns was a Beatles and Nirvana cover band and we played everywhere in Los Angeles from burlesque and strip clubs, to arts festivals and New Year’s Eve house parties.

After that, I experimented with being a vocalist for a 60s/70s rock cover band called Suns Of Jimi. Here I sharpened my vocal abilities through impersonating Jimi, Jim Morrison, Bob Marley, James Brown, and Robert Plant.  Also had my first experience of singing three hours of music all by myself. The stamina requirement was real!

And now, The Peeces. The Peeces were formed in the future and sent here to help roll out the  great enlightenment of humanity, about to take place. The mission is to arm the people with the special key to the universe known as One. Through a unity of all people, we will progress to Utopia. The Peeces were sent on a mission to help make that happen.

Be a part of the great enlightenment, and helping humanity unite as One. Follow us on our journey through the stars, and through our gigs, on Instagram, YouTube, Facebook, or by being a part of our email list. You are helping humanity evolve by doing this. Thank you. You are making this mission easier, by being a part of it.

Be One.

A Producer from Universal Records wants to record our song "Baby," at CBS Studios!  Just like the pros have to pay for an engineer and editing, so do we. $$$

Me and the guys have been playing music all of our lives, for an opportunity to record with a proper LA producer.

These guys have gotten new artist deals before, so anything you can do will be amazing, and totally help save the world.

story:
The Album:

 

The “GERGO BORLAI - THE MISSING SONG” album will introduce the most definitive time periods from those 9 great drummers which influenced my musical development.  These periods had the greatest effect on my heart, soul and music.

I want to do this project to give tribute to those great drummers. The “GERGO BORLAI - THE MISSING SONG” album will feature my amazing, legendary musician friends such as Grammy Award winner Jimmy Haslip, Stu Hamm, Tony MacAlpine, Dean Brown, Scott Kinsey, Nguyen Le, Alex Machacek, Hadrien Feraud, Jimmy Earl, Gary Willis, Anthony Crawford, Anton Davidyants, Steve Tavaiglone just to name a few.

 

What I would like to get:


My goal is to raise $ 19,200 for the following preliminary budget:

  • musicians - $10400
  • mixing/mastering - $3600
  • producing - $2400
  • art design - $1500
  • CD manufactoring - $1300

This project means a lot to me and I deeply believe in you as music lovers to help me bring this project to life. 

The music industry poses many challenges for Artists like me and my amazing musician friends and listeners, alike. This is why we need all your support to help realize this unstoppable project. Your generous help will not only be appreciated on an emotional level, but I will also create something that hopefully will be music to your ears.

story:
WHO ?

'Renton Jules' was formed by singer songwriter Geert Laenens in 2012, as the succesor of his previous band Newtown. Newtown had released a titleless EP in 2010 that was well received; it got good reviews and airplay on the national radio (Radio 1, MNM). With this EP Newtown performed as the support act of several international artists (The Stranglers, Throwing Muses, The Walkmen, Glasvegas) in renowned venues like Ancienne Belgique, De Roma, Trix, De Handelsbeurs and Mezz. In 2011 Newtown recorded and put out two new singles, which were produced by Serge Feys (Arno). One of these songs was selected for the soundtrack of the TV-show Solar Race on TMF.  A while later the members of the band changed, and so did the name: with Renton Jules they were ready for a fresh start. By the end of 2013 the band produced the EP 'How to catch a deer' on their own; Guy Fixen (producer/sound engineer of The Pixies and Throwing Muses) did the mixing. 'Are you ready', one of the tracks on this EP, was used for the TV-documentary Soundtrack on the Flemish channel Canvas.

In 2017 Renton Jules went on as a trio, playing concerts in more intimate settings. However, they are a full four-member band again since May 2018, when drummer Martijn Van den Broek joined. They are, right now, recording their debut album with songs about love and life, averse to trends and hypes.

  • Geert Laenens - vocal / guitar / piano
  • Tijl De Ridder – bass, vocal (ex-Mercelis, Spacca)
  • Jussi De Nys - guitar / vocal / producer & sound engineer (i.a. King Dick, Jan Fabre, North, Ruben Focketyn, Paper James, Daalman)
  • Martijn Van den Broek - drums/ piano/ vocal (Bougie Belgique, Evil Empire Orchestra, Collieman)

Listen HERE exclusively to 2 tracks from the future album !

In May 2018 ‘Renton Jules’ started the recordings of the new songs at the Nice Recording Studio in Antwerp and at the home studio of Jussi De Nys.

But then Renton Jules was broke .. 

The band needs you, music lovers, to bring their music out! The album requires beautiful artwork, a good promotion and .. We still need 5000 euros and we hope to raise 4000 euros with this campaign.

What do you get in exchange for your contribution?

A signed album on vinyl or CD, a living room concert (in duo or with full band), .. and eternal gratitude. You can also opt for a free gift via the 'Back it' button at the top of this page.

Payments on this site are made with a credit card (Visa, Mastercard, ...).

Do you wish to pay by bank transfer? Yes it can! Simply send us an email at rentonjules@yahoo.com stating your name and which item ('perk') you wish to order or how much your free gift amounts to. We will then send you all necessary payment information!

If the desired amount is not fetched via the campaign, we simply save lustily and you will receive your physical copy of the album at a later date. So you can be sure of your order!

Support and share

If you cannot support us financially, you can also help us tremendously by sharing this campaign: via e-mail, on social media, .. Thank you!

story:
Estabena is a recent music project that started in March 2017. The "Mediterranean Music Project" collected Moroccan, French, Italian and Egyptian musicians: the idea of the very first members and founders was to offer to Egyptian music scene something new, that could merge their different origins and backgrounds in languages, cultures and music of course.


Estabena tries to revitalize music pieces sometimes forgotten, sometimes totally unknown to Egyptian culture and audience, giving them a totally original shape, this is made possible by the cultural exchange and dialogue of the different members. 

In this time of division in the Mediterranean region, it has become particularly important to learn more about the shared heritage and the similiraties of the different Countries of the basin, nonetheless in music and arts. In this framework our project is a perfect example of successful mediation and enriching exchange while our album will represent one of the positive outcomes of this fruitful collaboration.  

Even if of recent formation the band has already performed on different stages of the Cairo music scene as Dawar, Bab 18, Dhamma Theatre, Gramophone, Elles, Room Art Space & Cafe, Room Grand Experience, Makan, Goethe Institute and has performed even in Taba (Sakrata Camp), Dahab (Everyday Cafe) and Port Said (Nas wa Turath Port Said 2017 Festival).

We want to keep searching for new songs and to make our project sustainable, we are convinced that recording our first cover album it's the first step to take in the path towards professionality. This will allow us to have an effective ''business card'' that will help us reaching international festivals and a bigger audience. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Our set goal it's of 2500 $, with this amount we want to cover the following production expenses:

1. Studio fees for rehearsals and recordings

2. Technical sound editing of the recordings

3. Design of the cover

4. Cost of the CDs and printing of the covers on it

5. Royalties

Any additional funds raised will be used to contribute to the sustainability of our project in the future and if the funds are enough we would use them  for the shooting of a videoclip. 

We want to thank you even if you participate in a small amount, we will make sure to let you have a personalized thank for every donation smaller than 8$

If you donate 8 $ we will hand-deliver you the CD at one of our concerts

If you donate 10 $ we will grant you access to a link with the preview of our album 

If you live in Egypt and donate 15 $ we will deliver you a copy of our CD

If you donate 50 $ you will receive access to the album recordings in preview and we will schedule a private concert at your place or via skype

If you donate 100 $ in addition to the preview, the CD (hand-delivered) and the private concert you can come meet us in the making and have the chance to tell us what you think about our project and share your ideas with us (unfortunately we cannot cover the transportation costs for reaching us).

 

The Impact: your donation a tool for discovery

 

Did you know that Egyptian music style ''Zar'' is really similar in the concept to the Italian ''Pizzica''? Both are based on a kind of healing and catharsis through music and dance.

Did you know that the arabic classic Andalusian Muwasshaha shares a lot in the melodies and style with the Sephardic (mainly judeo-spanish) music? 

Did you know that the song "Misirlou", used also by Tarantino in Pulp fiction, it's originally a Greek song about an Egyptian Girl ("Misir" meaning Egypt and "lou" girl)?

Did you know that the Moroccan song Lamarikane, about the arrivals of Americans in Morocco during the Second World War it's really similar in the topic to some italian songs of the same period?

Did you know that all the Countries of the Mediterranean as a looot of songs about the Mediterranean sea and his waves? Doesn't that mean that it is extremely precious and loved?

NEITHER US BEFORE ESTABENA WAS BORN!

We are not just making covers, our project it's an endless discovery which makes it never boring, always new! If you too want to discover all of this, the best way you can do it it's listening to our music and following us!

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Given the present strong inflation in the Egyptian economy, we need to take into account that there might be a future increase of production and shipping costs which may exceed the expenses we estimated. This may causes some shipping delays but we guarantee that we'll find creative solutions to deliver our CD in Egypt.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you like our project but unfortunately you cannot donate there are plenty of ways you can help us! 

1. If you live in Egypt and you have space to host us for rehearsals, we would save a relevant sum that would be used to pay studios and we could use this amount for a better quality of recording or to cope with the possibility of increased production or shipping costs. 

2. If you are a designer you can volunteer for creating the design of our album cover

3. If you are a sound engineer you could help us with the editing of the recorded material.

4. If you are a video maker you can help us creating marketing materials for our campaign while it is still on!

5. And of course you can spread our campaign on your social medias and among all your network.

DON'T FORGET TO FOLLOW US ON FACEBOOK, INSTAGRAM AND SUBSCRIBE TO OUR YOUTUBE CHANNEL. EVEN AFTER THE CAMPAIGN YOU CAN KEEP SUPPORTING US THROUGH PATREON.

story:
Our Story

Jake and Sarah met one fateful summer during a workshop of a new musical! They immediately hit it off and began dreaming of stories to tell together. Thus was born one of the (soon to be) greatest musical comedy collaborations of all time, that of Sarah Naughton and Jake Weinstein.

Jake and Sarah's first creation together was a cabaret all about the wonderful world of audiobook narration entitled "Trapped In The Closet." Described by critics as a "gem" and a "wildly theatrical piece," they played two sold out shows at Feinstein's/54 Below in 2017. Consequently, "Trapped in the Closet" was featured in 2018 as the pilot episode of the new musical theatre podcast, "The Micro-Musical Theatre Show."

Currently Jake and Sarah are taking their creative pursuits to the next level! They have made their partnership social media official (cute!) by becoming Jake & Sarah Present. Now they're working on two musical shorts: one in post-production, "Mythical Creatures," and one in pre-production, "Get Out (Of My Head)." They're also writing an ALL NEW satirical cabaret about the first daughter, Ivanka Trump, and her husband, Jared Kushner, entitled, "Javanka: Back In New York," which will premiere at Feinstein's/54 Below on February 15th, 2019.

 

FUNdraising

With so many different projects in the works, we're finding we need help covering the costs! Below we'll outline how a contribution to our cause will help us continue to create new and exciting projects! 

What your money goes toward:

  • Rehearsal space
  • Paying musicians and performers
  • Filming costs
    • Equipment
    • Crew
    • Craft services
    • Location rental
    • Music recording
    • Editing and mastering
    • Transportation
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • Marketing

 

Why Donate?

Your contribution goes directly toward making art possible and supporting young artists. This project would not be possible without you and we are incredibly grateful for any support you can give!

 

The Team

Sarah Naughton is a singer, actress, and Audie-nominated audiobook narrator living in New York. Some favorite credits include: New York Theater: [REAL] (The Tank),  Death Comes for the War Poets (The Sheen Center) Romeo and Juliet (Lincoln Center - Clark Studio Theater), Diamond Alice (Roundabout Underground), and Summer and Smoke (Access Theatre). Regional Theater: Mame (Human Race Theater Co), AcousticaElectronica (A.R.T. Oberon), and Meet Me In St. Louis (Mt. Gretna Playhouse). Sarah has narrated over 100 audiobooks which are all available on audible.com. Additionally, Sarah is a comedy veteran and has performed stand-up on ABC’s The View as well as at major NYC venues such as New York Comedy Club, Stand Up NY, and The PIT. Sarah is also a member an immersive dance theater company called toUch performance art and she works as an assistant teaching artist for CO/LAB theater group, a non-profit organization that has been providing individuals with developmental disabilities a creative and social outlet through theater arts since 2011. Sarah holds a BFA from NYU Tisch and is a proud member of Actors' Equity. Check out her website www.sarah-naughton.com and instagram @illuminaughton.

Jake Weinstein is performer, composer, and creator in New York City. Favorite performing credits include Peter in Peter and the Wolf (BAM), George Gershwin in Gershwin: Got Rhythm (Kaye Playhouse), Mark in A Chorus Line (National Tour), Beats in Chasing the Song (La Jolla Playhouse), Conductor in AcousticaElectronica (House of Yes). Jake served as Co-Director/Choreographer, Composer and Performer in the short film "Ode to the Singing Butler," for which his score won 1st Place at the Golden Key Composition Competition in Vienna, Austria. The film has appeared in festivals around the country and can now be viewed online. As a songwriter, Jake has performed at Rockwood Music Hall, Bowery Poetry Club and other venues around the city. Jake trained at the New England Conservatory of Music and received his B.A. from NYU Gallatin School of Individualized Study concentrating in collaborative musical theatre performance, music composition, and producing. Jake is a proud member of Actors’ Equity. Check out his website www.jakeweinstein.com and instagram @jakeweinstein1.
story_txt:
Our StoryJake and Sarah met one fateful summer during a workshop of a new musical! They immediately hit it off and began dreaming of stories to tell together. Thus was born one of the (soon to be) greatest musical comedy collaborations of all time, that of Sarah Naughton and Jake Weinstein.Jake and Sarah's first creation together was a cabaret all about the wonderful world of audiobook narration entitled "Trapped In The Closet." Described by critics as a "gem" and a "wildly theatrical piece," they played two sold out shows at Feinstein's/54 Below in 2017. Consequently, "Trapped in the Closet" was featured in 2018 as the pilot episode of the new musical theatre podcast, "The Micro-Musical Theatre Show."Currently Jake and Sarah are taking their creative pursuits to the next level! They have made their partnership social media official (cute!) by becoming Jake & Sarah Present. Now they're working on two musical shorts: one in post-production, "Mythical Creatures," and one in pre-production, "Get Out (Of My Head)." They're also writing an ALL NEW satirical cabaret about the first daughter, Ivanka Trump, and her husband, Jared Kushner, entitled, "Javanka: Back In New York," which will premiere at Feinstein's/54 Below on February 15th, 2019. FUNdraisingWith so many different projects in the works, we're finding we need help covering the costs! Below we'll outline how a contribution to our cause will help us continue to create new and exciting projects! What your money goes toward:
Rehearsal space
Paying musicians and performers
Filming costs
Equipment
Crew
Craft services
Location rental
Music recording
Editing and mastering
Transportation


Costumes
Props
Marketing
 Why Donate?Your contribution goes directly toward making art possible and supporting young artists. This project would not be possible without you and we are incredibly grateful for any support you can give! The TeamSarah Naughton is a singer, actress, and Audie-nominated audiobook narrator living in New York. Some favorite credits include: New York Theater: [REAL] (The Tank),  Death Comes for the War Poets (The Sheen Center) Romeo and Juliet (Lincoln Center - Clark Studio Theater), Diamond Alice (Roundabout Underground), and Summer and Smoke (Access Theatre). Regional Theater: Mame (Human Race Theater Co), AcousticaElectronica (A.R.T. Oberon), and Meet Me In St. Louis (Mt. Gretna Playhouse). Check out her website www.sarah-naughton.com and instagram @illuminaughton.Jake Weinstein is performer, composer, and creator in New York City. Favorite performing credits include Peter in Peter and the Wolf (BAM), George Gershwin in Gershwin: Got Rhythm (Kaye Playhouse), Mark in A Chorus Line (National Tour), Beats in Chasing the Song (La Jolla Playhouse), Conductor in AcousticaElectronica (House of Yes). The film has appeared in festivals around the country and can now be viewed online. As a songwriter, Jake has performed at Rockwood Music Hall, Bowery Poetry Club and other venues around the city. story:
My name is Jan Seides, and I’ve been a singer/songwriter as far back as I can remember. I’ve been playing piano since I was 3 years old, guitar since I was a teenager, and I can’t ever recall not singing. I have a degree in music, an extensive catalog of songs, five completed and published recordings. And I’m working on the sixth. That’s the one I want to tell you about, because I feel like all the previous albums were leading me to this one. And no previous album has meant this much to me. Here's why....

Bible stories are a part of our Western culture in a way that almost nothing else is, except perhaps the plays of Shakespeare. Their origins and meaning are the target of much speculation, but even 3-year-olds can tell you at least one or two, usually Noah's Ark or Adam and Eve. But the stories we have come to know, and the characters who populate them started as an oral tradition, and when they were written down, the writers decided who was important and who was incidental. And I found the ones left out very intriguing.

Here’s how it started: I wrote a song called “Sarah Laughed” about how when Sarah was told by the angel that she would have a baby at 100+ years old, she laughed at the absurdity. One night, after I performed it, a woman approached me on stage and recommended a book called Women in the Bible. So I read it. For the first time, I noticed how many seemingly important people (to the story, if nothing else) we never learn anything about. My somewhat inflated sense of responsibility kicked in and I decided my job was to tell those stories in song, because, after all, each of us is important – at least, to ourselves and those who care about us. Some of the songs are of women and some of men, some Old Testament and some New, some angry, some sad, some sexy, some joyful, some were even funny. (Yes. I found humor in the Bible. Who knew?)

I got to play these songs all over Israel in 2016, one of the highlights of my life. Bringing the stories back to their birthplace was immensely gratifying.

The songs are recorded (by Bradley Kopp) and mastered (by Airshow Mastering), and I was about to get into the manufacturing phase, when someone suggested that I turn the project into a book, I enlisted my friend, Vanessa Lively, a talented graphic artist and watercolorist to help me illustrate the songs, and there are line drawings by … ahem … me. It all looks spectacular. I can’t wait for you to see!

But I need angels to facilitate this birth, and so I’m turning to you. Your contribution will make this book happen, and you can take credit for seeing it safely into the world.

By the way, the clues to the answers for the contest in the video? They're in the perks, as far as which people are candidates. But the pictures in the perks may or may not be attached to the correct names. I did want you to see how lovely the illustrations are though.

Here's what making the book will cost:

$1,140 Original art, graphic art, layout

$2,684 Printing

$1,000   Manufacture of CD

$1,500   Mailling and publicity

$6,324 Total

If I don’t reach the whole goal, I will use what I do receive for the printing and the manufacture of the CD. The project will still happen, it will just take a bit longer.


In the right-hand column is what I’m offering to contributors. I hope you'll find a gift that appeals to you and make a contribution. Even if you can’t offer a donation right now, please feel free to share this campaign as far and wide as you are able. Indiegogo makes it easy with share buttons.

May your blessings be many and glorious.

story:
What is BLYN

BLYN is an Alternative-Rock band based out of Seattle, WA. BLYN started out as five friends jamming in a garage. It didn't take long for their musical chemistry to become apparent, a few years later,  

After recording and releasing their debut single, BLYN is back in the studio working on their next project. Be a part of this journey with the band by backing them on Indiegogo.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Being in the studio is great, but it does require resources to get going! All support will be going towards the recording/mixing/mastering of our upcoming project. We've come up with some campaign rewards we think you're really going to love.

$1 - A TIP

Thank you! Your contribution directly benefits the quality of this project, and we'll keep you in the loop with backer-only updates.

$5 - BAND POSTER

Get a signed poster of the band (which includes an instant digital download of our brand new single "Worlds Apart").

$10 - DIGITAL DOWNLOAD

Get an early download of the album that was created with your support (with PDF book of artwork and liner notes).

$30 - ENAMEL PIN + B-SIDES

Rep your new favorite band with an exclusive backer-only BLYN enamel pin. (Limited to 50)

In addition to this, you'll get access to some never before heard BLYN b-sides. Hear some of the early demos & other ideas that inspired the songs we are currently writing and recording. These sounds won't ever be released so now is your only chance to hear them!

$60 - HOODIE

Get an exclusive backer-only BLYN pullover hoodie. It makes a great Christmas gift and/or will keep you warm on those chilly summer nights. 

$75 - SHOW ADMISSION

Get free admission to one of our future shows.

$100 - VINYL

Get a limited 7" Vinyl of "Worlds Apart" + a bonus song (1 of 10 pressed) delivered to your door.

$500 - RECORD WITH US

Join us for a day in the studio. Be the first to hear the songs and get to witness them come to life in the studio. We will also need some finger snaps, handclaps, or maybe even your voice on some group vocals. Be permanently a part of the music of BLYN and have memories of the studio for the rest of your life.

$1,000 - PRIVATE SHOW

BLYN will come and play an unplugged set for you in your living room/coffee shop/venue! 
Please email blynsound@gmail.com to sort out schedule and logistics before selecting this reward.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Beyond financial support, we appreciate you taking the time to follow along with us, listen to our music, and share with your friends, we can't wait for you to hear what we've got brewing!

 

_______

 

BLYN | Connor, Jon, Alex, Ulises

story:
"We thought of life by analogy with a journey, a pilgrimage, which had a serious purpose at the end, and the thing was to get to that end, success or whatever it is, maybe Heaven after you're dead.  But we missed the point the whole way along.  It was a musical thing and you were supposed to sing or dance while the music was being played."  Alan Watts

My music story

Hi,

I’m Julie Kay Jensen.  I’m a singer/songwriter originally from Iowa (United States) but I have been living in Europe for the past 20 years.  I settled in the French countryside near Geneva, Switzerland where I enjoy a beautiful view of clear lakes and Alpine mountains. 

Music has been rooted in my soul from a very young age.  I entertained myself for hours dressing up and pretending I was Blondie in front of our sliding glass windows.  I dabbled in music throughout my youth but was a more passive participant in my adult years.  However, I have always enthusiastically attended concerts and shared a deep love and appreciation for the way music could bring large groups of people together in a beautiful, rhythmic union.

One year ago, in February 2019,  after over 20 years of keeping the music inside myself, I decided to take a leap of faith and reached out to find other musicians.  A local band invited me into their family and my musical spirit was unleashed.  Singing publicly after 20 years of silence was raw and vulnerable, messy and transforming. It has been amazing to share music from my heart and soul with a wider audience.  In the late spring, I was introduced to a wonderful musician, producer, and human being, Greg Arnold.  He challenged me to write my own music and I discovered a hidden songwriter who had been laying dormant for far too long. It tore open a vault of music that was ready to rush out in high volumes.  Suddenly, melodies and lyrics were flowing out of me faster than I could get them down on paper.  We began shaping them into full songs and worked with Toby May at Unagi Sound Studio in Geneva, Switzerland to start recording.  It has been beautiful and wild and I can’t wait to share the music with all of you.

To those of you who don’t know me, I hope you get an insight through the video and updates that we will be adding from time to time as we progress through this process. 

I am eager to release a full length studio album.  The music industry has changed and musicians are using crowd funding initiatives to financially back their albums.  The fun part is involving the biggest supporters which are the fans and the audience.  You will get to step backstage to watch the album come to life and I will do my part to update the process regularly. 

I am hugely excited to share this experience with all of you and I hope you will enjoy walking alongside me as the project transforms into a fully formed album made for you and me.  Greg Arnold is producing the album and I feel very privileged to work with such talented people. 

Co-writer

"I am super excited to be working on Julie's album as a producer and co-writer.  She is a very natural talent - she sings with an ease that I envy and also, she is a very clear and strong melody writer.  I also love the spirit behind her work - it's very positive, but still nuanced.  The story of her return to music is really charming and I am really glad if I can help out.  I am really looking forward to writing and recording more songs with Julie."

Greg Arnold

Greg Arnold is a singer, songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, producer and academic from Melbourne, Australia.

Funding

It is time to make it happen and I need your help.

All funds received will be used to pay for musician time/skill, studio rental and production, album mastering, CD artwork, CDs, video production and a PR campaign to support the album release and its success.

You can choose a perk or if you would just like to contribute, hit the "back it button" and enter any amount you would like.  We have 60 days to make it happen.  During this time, I will be sharing exclusive news with you as the album progresses and I look forward to seeing you at release concerts starting this spring.  Website and concert dates to be announced.  Please also feel free to follow on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/JulieKayJensen.Music/.

Thank you so much for taking the time to listen to my music and for following this project.  Your support is greatly appreciated.  I look forward to sharing my love of music and I am eager to produce moments of happiness that bring people together.

Keep checking back to see what is going on.

Off we go,

XOXO Julie

What We Need & What You Get

The total album production budget is $15,000.

Any amount raised over the target will go toward tour expenses and production of the next album.

Making a high quality album will be a dream come true.  Having a proper PR campaign will help launch my professional music career which I can share with all of you.

There are a number of perks on offer in exchange for your kind and generous donations.  Please see what is on offer under the "Perks" section.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help but are not able to do so financially, please consider sharing this page to help me reach out to wider audiences.

story:
Welcome!

Hi! Thanks for exploring my campaign. For those of you who don't know me, my name is Erinn Alissa Selkis, and I am a singer/songwriter based in Los Angeles, originally from Upstate NY. I have written more than 100 songs in the last couple years, performed many of them with my band all over Los Angeles, and have chosen my favorites to record professionally and create my first EP and official music video.  Having broadcast quality songs and videos will allow me to share my songs with the world on all platforms, and have music to pitch for use in film, tv, and commercials, officially launching my career as an indie artist! Oh, and I'm also 37 years old. Here I am, with you as my witness, reclaiming my dream of having a singing career, well into my mid 30's. 

Truth

It feels very vulnerable to announce my age like this, because it's something I try to hide. I don't look my age (finally there's a pay off to having a baby face), so people assume I'm younger than I am and I let them.  Not because I don't want to be 37; I love my 30's actually, and as my dad says, it sure beats the alternative! But in an industry where 16 year old you tube stars are born, and someone's young age is a badge of honor, 37 is kinda old. Your mid to late 30's are when you are supposed to be at the height of your career, not just realizing and starting your dream... so I have a lot of insecurity around it. And it's cool to be a twenty something waitress paying the bills while funding your music career, but not so much in your thirties. There are more expectations, risks, and much more at stake. But there's a bigger risk in living an unfulfilling and purposeless life if I don't take this chance, and I know in my heart of hearts that this is my path. So the risk is worth it. I'll admit that sometimes I wish I could go back in time 15 years and realize this path of mine then...but obviously I can't. And I'm learning to be ok with that. My journey was my journey for a reason, and I wouldn't be who I am without it. Also, I like to remind myself of people who were well into their 40's or even 60's before they found success, like Samuel Jackson, Julia Child, and Alan Rickman. 

The Struggle

So what was my journey? What do I mean by reclaiming? To try and keep it short and to the point, I was a musical theatre girl on the path to Broadway. I studied and performed voice, dance, and acting intensively from a young age and continued in college, receiving my BFA in musical theatre. 

Here's a video of baby Erinn from my college days playing my favorite role ever, Maggie in A Chorus Line. I later played her professionally many times.

 
After college, I performed at Equity regional theatres, did a couple national tours, and had lead roles in Summer stock shows. I was technically doing exactly what I had always envisioned, but I had a secret. I was battling an eating disorder, and I was miserable. I didn't like myself, and my self esteem was non existent, except when I was cast in a show- I made my worth entirely dependent upon whether or not casting directors liked me. The musical theatre and dance world was harsh, and while I was considered "normal" by most standards, I was never as thin as anyone wanted me to be- I was told daily that if I wanted to be cast, I needed to lose weight. The death of my mom when I was in college also wrecked me... I had lost my anchor, and without it, I was floating around, trying to be who these casting directors wanted me to be, because I felt like performing was all I had left. After years of eating iceburg lettuce with mustard and tunafish (the meal I concocted to trick my stomach into feeling full and get a little protein in but the least amount of carbs), and running on the treadmill for hours on end, on top of training and performing, my body started to fall apart. And my mental and emotional state was already in shambles. Simply put, I was an absolute disaster. 
 

Coming Back Home

So I quit it all. I left the only dreams I had known behind and decided I would do something else with my life, and get myself help. It took me many years of exploration, grieving the death of my mom, therapy (highly recommend it!!), spiritual growth, etc, to heal myself and discover this new path of writing and singing my own songs. A discovery that I am incredibly grateful for today. Along the way, I learned that I wasn't any happier without music, but I was definitely happier without the pressure of trying to be something I wasn't. I now have the freedom to be exactly who I am, express myself through my songs, share my heart and soul, and connect to my listeners in a way that wasn't possible with musical theatre. I hope my music moves people, helps them put words to feelings, gets them through a breakup or hard time, inspires and motivates them, and just simply makes them smile or feel less alone. 

The beautiful thing is that before I found musical theatre, I was a 7 year old with a microphone, a Yamaha keyboard, and journals of lyrics, inspired by my idol Debbie Gibson (go ahead and laugh but she was awesome) :) So, my journey brought me back home. It just took a few decades lol. But this time, I am holding onto it and running with it. 

Speaking of "Home," this is a clip of the 2nd, just released single off of the EP. Enjoy this cheesy video I made :)

Where I am Now

I've been working hard to establish myself in the music world: Out of all the songs I've written, I've chosen the ones that will make up the EP, and I've already recorded 3 of them with my amazingly talented producer, Max Allyn. The first single, "Just Another," was released last summer, and has over 13,000 listens on Spotify and has been played on three online radio stations.

 

My band formed and we've played at many venues in LA, I've been hired to sing the National Anthem for festivals, as well as performing sets at lots of restaurants, wineries, and parties. I've been a finalist in The American Songwriting competition, and have had songs placed in independent films. I even got a song in the hands of Katy Perry's team, and though she didn't end up recording it, the feedback was that they loved it! My main goals with this EP are to have professional recordings of my songs to share with my fans (and gain traction as an indie artist), and to get my songs licensed for TV, film, and commercials. There isn't a lot I can do without having broadcast quality songs. 

Why I'm asking for your help!

It's hard to express how much your contribution would mean to me. 

Forging this new path takes a lot of courage, and I can't do it alone. Claiming this career at this point in my life is vulnerable, my music is vulnerable, being on stage and having people listen to the words I write from my heart is vulnerable, and asking for your support is vulnerable! But I'm doing it because it is also the most fulfilling thing I have ever done. Over the last year, I've had the support of my incredible band, my professional music friends, and my close friends, which has made all the difference to me. Now I'm taking the next step with recording this EP and promoting it. But making an EP isn't cheap! It’s quite expensive to record, produce, mix, and master songs. Not to mention the promotions, music video, pitching, photos, and PR needed after release to get my songs heard and in the hands of people who love my music and people who do music sync. I'm reaching out to you for help because the process is going sooooo slooooowly due to financials, and since I've already told you how long it took me to get here, I don't want to waste another second :)

You and I will be a team in creating my EP, and ultimately my music career. I'll be keeping you posted every step of the way. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $7,000 to complete my EP and promote my music!

- Each track (3 more to complete EP) is $1500 for studio time, recording, production, mixing, and mastering. I have 3 tracks already completed, so it will be a 6 track EP. 

-$1500 to finish paying for a very low budget (but very legit) music video to promote and draw in listeners. I've already filmed (it's looking amazing!!!) and spent over $2000, but I still need to finish it and promote it.

-$1000 for photos, distribution costs, guest musician pay, and other promotional materials.

These are very conservative estimates, so I'm hoping we will even surpass our goal!

If I don't reach my goal, all of your contributions will still count and will go towards as many songs as I am able to finish, so it will still be very effective. 

Now what you get!!

First, you get to support a fellow human on her journey to living her dream. I will be so incredibly grateful for any amount of support you give me. Second, there are many very cool perks I am offering! A free download of my already finished songs Just Another and Home (every backer, no matter how much they donate, gets this), a download of the rest of  the songs before they are officially released, a completed copy of the EP (in your preferred form of listening), playing music for your party, event, etc, custom written songs for you, requested covers, and more. If you have an idea of a perk you'd like, but I don't have listed, please feel free to ask me about it!

Know that with your support, you will be contributing not only to my growth, but also to creating a beautiful collection of songs that I hope will touch the listener and make him/her feel connected. As Billy Joel once said, "I think music in itself is healing. It's an explosive expression of humanity. It's something we are all touched by. No matter what culture we're from, everyone loves music."

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help.

You can post on social media to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Or perhaps you know someone who would appreciate helping out a musician and you can share this with them. 

Thank you so much for your support! Sending you much love and gratitude. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!
story_txt:
Welcome!
Hi! Thanks for exploring my campaign. For those of you who don't know me, my name is Erinn Alissa Selkis, and I am a singer/songwriter based in Los Angeles, originally from Upstate NY. I have written more than 100 songs in the last couple years, performed many of them with my band all over Los Angeles, and have chosen my favorites to record professionally and create my first EP and official music video.  Having broadcast quality songs and videos will allow me to share my songs with the world on all platforms, and have music to pitch for use in film, tv, and commercials, officially launching my career as an indie artist! Oh, and I'm also 37 years old. Here I am, with you as my witness, reclaiming my dream of having a singing career, well into my mid 30's. 
Truth
It feels very vulnerable to announce my age like this, because it's something I try to hide. I don't look my age (finally there's a pay off to having a baby face), so people assume I'm younger than I am and I let them.  Not because I don't want to be 37; I love my 30's actually, and as my dad says, it sure beats the alternative! But in an industry where 16 year old you tube stars are born, and someone's young age is a badge of honor, 37 is kinda old. Your mid to late 30's are when you are supposed to be at the height of your career, not just realizing and starting your dream... so I have a lot of insecurity around it. And it's cool to be a twenty something waitress paying the bills while funding your music career, but not so much in your thirties. There are more expectations, risks, and much more at stake. But there's a bigger risk in living an unfulfilling and purposeless life if I don't take this chance, and I know in my heart of hearts that this is my path. So the risk is worth it. I'll admit that sometimes I wish I could go back in time 15 years and realize this path of mine then...but obviously I can't. And I'm learning to be ok with that. My journey was my journey for a reason, and I wouldn't be who I am without it. Also, I like to remind myself of people who were well into their 40's or even 60's before they found success, like Samuel Jackson, Julia Child, and Alan Rickman. 
The Struggle
So what was my journey? What do I mean by reclaiming? To try and keep it short and to the point, I was a musical theatre girl on the path to Broadway. I studied and performed voice, dance, and acting intensively from a young age and continued in college, receiving my BFA in musical theatre. 
Here's a video of baby Erinn from my college days playing my favorite role ever, Maggie in A Chorus Line. I later played her professionally many times.

 
After college, I performed at Equity regional theatres, did a couple national tours, and had lead roles in Summer stock shows. I was technically doing exactly what I had always envisioned, but I had a secret. I was battling an eating disorder, and I was miserable. I didn't like myself, and my self esteem was non existent, except when I was cast in a show- I made my worth entirely dependent upon whether or not casting directors liked me. The musical theatre and dance world was harsh, and while I was considered "normal" by most standards, I was never as thin as anyone wanted me to be- I was told daily that if I wanted to be cast, I needed to lose weight. The death of my mom when I was in college also wrecked me... I had lost my anchor, and without it, I was floating around, trying to be who these casting directors wanted me to be, because I felt like performing was all I had left. After years of eating iceburg lettuce with mustard and tunafish (the meal I concocted to trick my stomach into feeling full and get a little protein in but the least amount of carbs), and running on the treadmill for hours on end, on top of training and performing, my body started to fall apart. And my mental and emotional state was already in shambles. Simply put, I was an absolute disaster. 
 
Coming Back Home
So I quit it all. I left the only dreams I had known behind and decided I would do something else with my life, and get myself help. It took me many years of exploration, grieving the death of my mom, therapy (highly recommend it!!), spiritual growth, etc, to heal myself and discover this new path of writing and singing my own songs. A discovery that I am incredibly grateful for today. Along the way, I learned that I wasn't any happier without music, but I was definitely happier without the pressure of trying to be something I wasn't. I now have the freedom to be exactly who I am, express myself through my songs, share my heart and soul, and connect to my listeners in a way that wasn't possible with musical theatre. I hope my music moves people, helps them put words to feelings, gets them through a breakup or hard time, inspires and motivates them, and just simply makes them smile or feel less alone. 
The beautiful thing is that before I found musical theatre, I was a 7 year old with a microphone, a Yamaha keyboard, and journals of lyrics, inspired by my idol Debbie Gibson (go ahead and laugh but she was awesome) :) So, my journey brought me back home. It just took a few decades lol. But this time, I am holding onto it and running with it. 
Speaking of "Home," this is a clip of the 2nd, just released single off of the EP. Enjoy this cheesy video I made :)

Where I am Now
I've been working hard to establish myself in the music world: Out of all the songs I've written, I've chosen the ones that will make up the EP, and I've already recorded 3 of them with my amazingly talented producer, Max Allyn. The first single, "Just Another," was released last summer, and has over 13,000 listens on Spotify and has been played on three online radio stations.

 
My band formed and we've played at many venues in LA, I've been hired to sing the National Anthem for festivals, as well as performing sets at lots of restaurants, wineries, and parties. I've been a finalist in The American Songwriting competition, and have had songs placed in independent films. I even got a song in the hands of Katy Perry's team, and though she didn't end up recording it, the feedback was that they loved it! My main goals with this EP are to have professional recordings of my songs to share with my fans (and gain traction as an indie artist), and to get my songs licensed for TV, film, and commercials. There isn't a lot I can do without having broadcast quality songs. 
Why I'm asking for your help!
It's hard to express how much your contribution would mean to me. 
Forging this new path takes a lot of courage, and I can't do it alone. Claiming this career at this point in my life is vulnerable, my music is vulnerable, being on stage and having people listen to the words I write from my heart is vulnerable, and asking for your support is vulnerable! But I'm doing it because it is also the most fulfilling thing I have ever done. Over the last year, I've had the support of my incredible band, my professional music friends, and my close friends, which has made all the difference to me. Now I'm taking the next step with recording this EP and promoting it. But making an EP isn't cheap! It’s quite expensive to record, produce, mix, and master songs. Not to mention the promotions, music video, pitching, photos, and PR needed after release to get my songs heard and in the hands of people who love my music and people who do music sync. I'm reaching out to you for help because the process is going sooooo slooooowly due to financials, and since I've already told you how long it took me to get here, I don't want to waste another second :)
You and I will be a team in creating my EP, and ultimately my music career. I'll be keeping you posted every step of the way. 
 
What We Need & What You Get

-$1500 to finish paying for a very low budget (but very legit) music video to promote and draw in listeners. I've already filmed (it's looking amazing!!!) and spent over $2000, but I still need to finish it and promote it.
-$1000 for photos, distribution costs, guest musician pay, and other promotional materials.
These are very conservative estimates, so I'm hoping we will even surpass our goal!
If I don't reach my goal, all of your contributions will still count and will go towards as many songs as I am able to finish, so it will still be very effective. 
Now what you get!!
First, you get to support a fellow human on her journey to living her dream. I will be so incredibly grateful for any amount of support you give me. Second, there are many very cool perks I am offering! A free download of my already finished songs Just Another and Home (every backer, no matter how much they donate, gets this), a download of the rest of  the songs before they are officially released, a completed copy of the EP (in your preferred form of listening), playing music for your party, event, etc, custom written songs for you, requested covers, and more. If you have an idea of a perk you'd like, but I don't have listed, please feel free to ask me about it!
Know that with your support, you will be contributing not only to my growth, but also to creating a beautiful collection of songs that I hope will touch the listener and make him/her feel connected. As Billy Joel once said, "I think music in itself is healing. It's an explosive expression of humanity. It's something we are all touched by. No matter what culture we're from, everyone loves music."

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help.
You can post on social media to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Or perhaps you know someone who would appreciate helping out a musician and you can share this with them.

story:
Here's the Nitty-Gritty

After years of writing music on the side I've decided, with support from so many of you, that I will be doing a studio album to release some of these tracks. Here's what's exciting and why you might want to get involved:

  • After being on stage and in studio for 15 years I have not put out any of my own music in a professional capacity. This will be the first professionally recorded and released music written primarily by me.
  • I will be collaborating with many of my musician friends that I have NOT been able to work with in the past. At current count I have 6 collaborators outside the core group I originally planned to be involved. I'll be releasing videos with them as we're able to work on the album.
  • When recording an album, typically a band will pool resources and funding to get that album paid for. As this is going to be my project, and I don't make a ton of money in my day job, your contributions will increase the number of songs I can record for this project.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown on what I plan to do with the money:

  • I'll be recording with Russell Hollar (of In Search Of Sight || Russell Hollar Music / Nomad Recording Studio) to record these tracks. The per song rate is $350, including recording, mixing, and mastering. 
  • I have hired Gershom Wetzel (author/illustrator of 'Teres') for the album art. He has agreed to a deferred payment contract once the album is complete.
  • Contributors will receive a CD in sleeve with original artwork, signed by yours truly. If the excess funds allow I will also order some stickers to be given first to you for your donations.
  • For every $350 we will have a song completely paid for. Additional funds beyond that will give us a chance to buy CDs, stickers, T-Shirts, and posters for your donations. Any excess money will be donated to a local music project like this. I will hold a private poll for you, the contributors, and the highest votes will determine what project we are funding.

The Impact

I have been a musician for most of my life. It has been a blessing to do what I love and share the music in my heart with people all of these years. I have never had the opportunity to be the primary writing force in a band that released music professionally and publicly. This has been something I've wanted to do for the last few years, but I haven't been able to secure the funding due to the cost of living. There's always been something more important to invest money into. Not only will this be an incredible opportunity for me to grow as a musician, but also an opportunity for y'all to hear what's been rattling around in my head.

I want to state with no reservations that I absolutely love and adore Further North, and the music that we make. While we don't have specific genre restrictions, I do have another side of my writing style that doesn't get to see much of the light of day. This is our chance to get that put on the record (pun intended) and released for all of you to enjoy.

 

Risks & Challenges

You know, when evaluating risks I don't see many, if any. While this won't be something I can do overnight, this will eventually be made. With or without the funding I will make this record happen. Your contributions only speed up the timeframe to get started, and help to increase the number of songs we can include on the album. 

Challenges we will face are not even very difficult. We do have some collaborators from out of the area, and across Texas, but they have access to proper studios and will be sending their tracks in to Russell to mix. 

Other Ways You Can Help

This is not a cry for money. This is not a pity party. This is an opportunity for us to share in the excitement of new music, and a bigger project. You do not have to send a dollar to be involved. Anything you can donate is greatly appreciated, but you can also help by sharing the campaign with family and friends, people that support local music, and might want to financially support the project. 

 

 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this, and thank you for supporting me and my dreams. I am beyond excited to be able to do this for y'all. It has been a dream of mine, and it's finally here. I love you all.

story:
Six years ago Stark Folk evolved from a two-man recording project to Stark Folk Band, a live four-piece unit & this set of recordings represents the full fruits of this half-decade collaboration. 

Our vision for this album was a home-recorded rock opera of sorts, a "garage opera" if you will, and we strove to get the biggest sound possible with a modest set of gear. 

THE LOWDOWN

• 300 vinyl records

• Total cost: about $2200.  Includes the cost of mastering (professional preparation of the songs), manufacturing, and color printing. 

• The album has been recorded, mastered, and will be sent to a pressing plant this month.  It's a busy time of year for record plants and a 3-4 month turn-around is expected.

• We are financing this ourselves, so contributions made now, in the form of pre-orders, will wonderfully assist us by providing upfront cash to put towards down-payments , etc.  This is our second round of pre-orders, the first one raised about $400.

• Completion date: Summer 2019

 

THE PERKS

• ALL contributors will get thanked in the album liner notes.

• ALL contributors will immediately receive a link to digital versions of our previous two albums.  Stark Folk-Self-titled(2008) & Stark Folk Band-Well Oiled(2010).  A digital version (streaming+download) of the new album will also be provided with all orders.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

* Don't do vinyl?  Just want to make a donation to the cause? Click the pink 'BACK IT' button near the top of the page & enter any donation amount.  You will be loved!

** Please share this campaign online or by good old fashion word-of-mouth!

*** THANK YOU!!!

------------------------------------------------

Additional info about Stark Folk Band & our previous albums:

RECORD REVIEWS
Self-titled LP (2008) - http://agitreader.com/perfect/stark_folk.html
Well Oiled LP (2010) - http://agitreader.com/primitivefutures/stark_fo...

story:
About the Band

Magic happens when kindred spirits come together in a cross pollination of music styles. There is the familiar theme of the common and then the edge of difference that draws it all together to create what can only be known as Edge of Destiny.

The hard driving drums of Stan Petraitis, coupled with the percussive bass stylings of Astrum Lux Lucis lay the perfect foundation for this bridge between Modern, Active, Alternative, Hard and Progressive Rock. The progressive rhythms and layerings of guitarists Gustavo Arcq and Andrew Bulock shape and color the sound for singer Kraevin Caedo’s powerful vocal stylings to shine through on hook-laden melodies.

Although Edge of Destiny is in its infancy as a band, Kraevin, Gustavo, Andrew, Astrum, and Stan are long standing veterans in the music industry with a cumulative history of over 35 years combined. Edge of Destiny stands to be joining the ranks of some of today’s top national acts in no time at all.

We Need Your Help

Our 1st single, a fierce and ferocious cover of Pat Benantar’s “Invincible” dropped April 26th.  After successful release of our single, you (our fans) have been asking for more. We are ready to get back in to the studio  and will be recording a couple singles to use to get us to the next level.  We can't get there alone. Producing and recording an album is a time-intensive and expensive process. 

Risks and challenges

We want to continue to bring you new music, but without funds, it will take much longer to record and release new music for you. Anything helps, even just $1. All contributors will be invited to join our private Facebook group, "The Destined" where you will get to see photos and videos of us on tour and in the studio, chat with the band, and be a part of the journey with us.
