story:
www.nomadsroots.com

 

HUUN HUUR TU

Kaigal-ool Khovalyg / Sayan Bapa / Radik Tyulush / Alexei Saryglar

HUUN-HUUR-TU is the premier Tuvan musical group and the world’s top throat-singing ensemble.

Since its formation over two decades ago, the band has worked with many legendary musicians – including Frank Zappa and Ry Cooder. In its own right, the group continues to tour the world to great success.

Huun-Huur-Tu has been described as the most natural sound of the soul. Hailing from the high pastures of the Altai Mountains in south central Siberia, the musicians have spent decades honing overtone singing and unique instrumental performances nestled within vibrant songs of their homelands. These descendants of isolated Siberian herdsmen make serious, yet strangely universal music out of some of the planets quirkiest acoustics.

 

ANEWAL

Alhousseini Anivolla / Smail Khabou  / Jean Gnonlonfoun

ANEWAL is the new trio of Alhousseini Anivolla – frontman of the famous desert blues band, Etran Finatawa. ANEWAL has got everything that fans of this style have been devouring ever since desert blues went global: hypnotic two-chord jams; trance-inducing beats; biting blues-infused guitar; and Anivolla’s warm and laid-back vocals sung in his local vernacular. Anivolla is an incisive and remarkably subtle guitarist who continuously varies his attack on the strings, adding minute levels of natural distortion along the way. His incisive, blues-infused phrases ring out over long, swaying vamps and are as memorable as they are remarkable.

 

NOMADS’ ROOTS PROJECT

NO BORDERS, NO BOXES, FREE MOVEMENT!

Though thousands of kilometres lie between the livestock of Huun Huur Tu and those of Anewal, in the small country of Lithuania, these world-class musicians came together with a common bond and produced Nomads’ Roots: a musical call for the preservation and importance of nomadic life in modern society. A brand new view into “movement” as a universal and natural process, is born...

 

LET THE MUSIC GO!

The musicians met and recorded; the website is set; and the Facebook page is full of interesting stuff, but we ran out of money. So now we invite you to contribute and be part of an historical project. Left to do: mix and master the songs, design a CD Cover (“Digipak”), pay the hard work of a video producer and print the CD’s… Once we are done, we let the music out to the world.

 

DONATE AND GET VERY SPECIAL PERKS

Besides digital and physical albums, we offer small-sized, handmade instruments with quality T-shirts, plus a special present from Tuva: tree resin chewing gum!

Donate ANY amount and you will receive a download of an exclusive Nomads’ Roots song, not on the album.

 

THE IMPACT OF NOMADS' ROOTS

Nomads’ Roots aims to draw attention to all the world’s nomads and mark the importance of preserving nomadic lifestyle. 

Nowadays, many of the nomads of the world face a variety of problems – including political, economic, cultural and environmental issues. The progressing and consuming modern states leave little room for nomadic lifestyles and nomads around the world are in crisis. 

The modern world has little chance of stopping its acceleration right now, but we need to find a sustainable way to coexist with one another and with nature. There is a lot we can learn from the nomads. They can teach us how to protect the Earth; how to be flexible with others; how to care about our environment; and help us to remember, that the material goods are heavy and costly in more ways than one, whilst the spiritual ones are light and invaluable. Only spirit-oriented values in this fast changing and globalised world can lead us to harmonious coexistence. We can start with respect for all others. We must respect the nomads right to live free with no borders and their right to continue their ancient lifestyles.

Freedom is for everyone, so give your mind some space and let it out of the box!

 

NOMADS’ ROOTS IS GOOD FOR YOU

It reproduces the natural rhythm of nomads: repetitive and harmonious. Camel's slow wandering in the desert; horses galloping with rhythms of the heart close to man; they help us calm down and feel in harmony, giving us a break and waking us up with more energy and creative power, giving us a quick connection with nature and our ancestors. Many of us long for the smell of the soil after rain, a tasty fire-cooked dinner, and to witness the stars in the wildly, dark night. Nomads‘ Roots places us there; makes us feel at home. It makes you travel!  Especially for those who loves long rides in the most beautiful places and deep dive into cultures.

 

ONE ROOT MUSIC

We are One Root Music, a small, independent record label with a twist. We believe that music is a way of showing that different cultures with no a common language, can come together and have a conversation.

Our previous musical projects include: MaLituanie (Mali-Lithuania), Solo & Indrė (Senegal - Lithuania) Griot Blues (Mali - USA). (For more details go to: www.onerootmusic.com)

In the future we would love to continue with projects dedicated to nomadism and music, where commercial success is not necessarily a must-have factor. We believe that hard and passionate work yields fruits anyway and what doesn't kill us makes us stronger! So there is no need to believe that if we don't reach our funding goal we will not release the CD, as we will do, anyway! But without your precious support, it will be much more difficult to achieve.

story:
• world-class talent
  • intimate venue
  • pay-what-you-can price
  • mid-week dance party
  • undeniable vibe 
  • supporting local charities (incl. OceanWise, Callanish Society, BCCancer) 
  • bringing the community together
  • social isolation vaccination
     

When is the last time you went dancing on a Monday night, inches away from world-class talent, paying an affordable price, in a venue with undeniable vibe?  

With a deep reverence for music, community and vibe, Propeller is an electric night in an intimate venue that hosts some of the most exciting musicians in North America, including those here at home in Vancouver. 

It is an intimate space where the ephemeral nature of a night of live music is experienced in community; the kind of night that is enshrined through the stories of those that were there.

My parents have always talked about The Cave, the long-demolished supper club once here in Vancouver as being that spot. Remembering the power of Tina Turner doing leg kicks two inches above their heads, and being close enough to hear every nuance of raunch and soul in Ray Charles' delivery.  A space remembered for its variety of world-class acts that passed through its doors, its support of local musicians, and a scene that was bubbling so hot it was pushing our city into a cultural hub.

Propeller is taking up that mantle and pushing the conversation forward. With my band, David Ward + Golden Future as the house band for the night, Propeller is hosting the best of the best in soul music, those you know and love and those for who you will say “I saw them here first.” 

Propeller is shining a light on the mighty talent here in Vancouver and extending the embrace to our international soul community, all in a space a sixth the size of The Cave!

Propeller offers this at a pay-what-you-can ticket price, so that anyone, regardless of economic background can experience a night like this. We also give partial proceeds from each night to a local charity. 

Where else can you stand inches away from the sweat-drenched funk of the mighty Daru Jones, drummer for everyone from Jack White to the artistic who's who of rap, or lose yourself next to 120 people in the revery of moonchild soulstress Patrice Quinn, singer for jazz pioneer Kamasi Washington and the West Coast Get Down. 

David Ward + Golden Future with special guest JC Maillard, MD and guitarist for Lisa Fischer. 

Propeller’s central tenets are community, collaboration and dance floor fever. We want to change the perception of our city from inside and out, helping the movement to highlight this city as the cultural hub it is. 

From my more than 10 years of experience in music I have learned that my greatest joys and strengths come from community - the fostering of it, the learning from it, and the support of it. We want to extend our community through Propeller and we offer this invitation to anyone who wants to join us and come down in the name of great music, good vibes and soul.  

What We Need 

We need $6,000 to cover the costs associated with running season 2 of Propeller, including fees, travel and accommodation for guests artists, marketing, and photography, 

What we are asking for is a temporary band-aid while we search for long-term solutions to support a series that takes place in an intimate venue while still providing a pay-what-you-can price.     

We're passionate about making this series not only happen, but grow. We have already successfully completed our first season, with significant personal investment. This is an idea we are deeply committed to. The wheels are in motion and the acts are booked for season 2 and 3. If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still produce the series, albeit with a shortfall.

The Impact

Your support will bring together new communities and create a place where people can go, regardless of economic background, to experience high vibes and the best of the best in soul music. While these funds will be specifically directed to the fall season, they will demonstrate your support and commitment for the overall initiative. You are our audience and if you dig the series, we are well on our way to future seasons of Propeller. 

Experience

The series is produced by Golden Future Recordings, owned and operated by Jeanette Wilkinson and myself and we are familiar with managing projects such as this.

Several years ago I produced and managed local music series, Wachu. We featured more than 20 local acts over 2 years and together with Jeanette Wilkinson, we produced a video series profiling the challenges and excitement in the local scene. The series grew into a documentary in search of how to survive and navigate the challenges of the ever-shifting landscape of the independent music scene (The answer? Well, there isn't just one, but a series like this plays a significant role).

I have also supported many charitable community projects over the years including environmental engagement projects, and community initiatives with Callanish Society, St. Paul's hospital, and many others.

 Together with Jeanette, I produced my last album entirely in Vancouver, featuring 2 studios, 3 producers, 27 musicians and a supporting full-length dance video. We love creative challenges, no matter the size, and always see them through.

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge for Propeller is building an economically sustainable series. 

With our first season we started to build a small loyal following but we need to reach more people...lots more! 

We don't have a big marketing budget. This is a guerilla-style operation -- social media advertising, postering, pitches at local events, word-of-mouth, and hand billing the crap out of the city. If you are still reading, YOU are our audience. So whether or not you fund our campaign, you can help build this night through one of the many ways suggested below.

We would like to keep the night at Guilt & Co and so the best way to increase our capacity while maintaining the PWYC price is to get more bodies on the dance floor. To do this, we need the place lined up before every show, enabling us to remove some tables and chairs, increase our capacity and break even on a consistent basis.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to fund, but there are other ways to support Propeller:

Come to a show! Tell people about it! Tell everyone you know about it! Write about it in your blog, talk about it on your podcast, whisper it in the ear of your lover, sing it to your grandma over hot chocolate and solitaire.

story:
Overview:

My name is Adam Moezinia and I'm a Jazz guitarist/composer/educator/bandleader here in New York City. I'm originally from Los Angeles, where I studied at the Los Angeles County High School for the Arts (LACHSA) under the mentorship of Jason Goldman, Walter Smith III, and Kenny Dennis. About 9 years ago, in 2010, I  moved to New York City to study at The Juilliard School and since then, I've worked with many greats such as Freddy Cole, Mike LeDonne, Cecile Mclorin Salvant, George Coleman and Kenny Washington at venues like Jazz at Lincoln Center, The Blue Note, Birdland, Smoke, Scullers and Bird’s Basement. 

In the 14 years or so that I've been studying/playing jazz I've been mainly focused on just that; learning the history of the genre and how to play it in an integral way. But during this journey, I realized that I had somewhat neglected my deep love and appreciation for other styles of music.. Other styles that got made me so passionate about music in the first place. I've always had a deep love for rock, blues, and folk singer/songwriters like Bob Dylan and Joni Mitchell, and I realized that it was kind of silly to not incorporate those sounds into my own music.

A few years ago, I got deeper into composition and I realized that my compositional style just naturally had that influence in it. As I started digging deeper into other styles of music, I realized that what drew me to any piece of music was it's connection to folk music; a "folk element" if you will. That's how I got the name for the band. Everything that we play has a connection to some sort of folk music from somewhere around the world. On the album will be 2 songs from a suite that I wrote called the "Ivory Suite", inspired by the folk music of West Africa. There will also be 3 songs from some of Americas most influential folk artists; Bob Dylan, Robert Johnson and Duke Ellington as well as 2 more originals of mine that have a strong folk influence, and Welsh folk song.

After I started developing my own repertoire I started forming the band and playing shows around New York City. After workshopping the music with a handful of different musicians, I finally found the perfect band. This band features Charles Goold on drums and Dan Chmielinski on bass. With this configuration, we've been playing together for about year and a half now and have developed a deep chemistry that I think comes out in the music. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

The goal of this campaign is to raise $8,000 

We have a wide range of perks for you that are listed to the right!

Here's the breakdown of the costs.

  • studio time
  • paying the musicians
  • engineering
  • mixing/mastering
  • album artwork 
  • CD printing 
  • copyright fees
  • publicity 

The Impact

  • Having an album as a leader and being able to document the music that I've worked on will be invaluable to me. It's a very special feeling to hear your own music come to life, and to be able to have a high quality recording of it will be incredible. It's also a necessary step as a professional musician.. something that you can show to venues and other people in the industry that will give them a sample of your music and what you're  all about. For better or for worse, the music industry has changed so much in the last few decades with the rise of streaming services and other technology. The role that record labels play in the industry is so much smaller than it was before. Nowadays, there's much more responsibility on the artist to do all of that work on their own. So i'm trying to make it happen, but I can't do it without your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that donating might not be an option for some of you, and if that's the case you can still help. Please share this video on social media, or tell someone whom you think might be interested!

So i'm trying to make it happen, but I can't do it without your help!

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone!

My name is Briana Greer, and I am a songwriter, vocalist, musical worship leader, youth nonprofit director, wife, and mother based in Azusa, CA (LA area). 

I started writing "The End" one evening in the summer of 2019 when I was feeling utterly lost, broken, and hopeless. As I sat on my couch and cried, God gave me the words to express what was going on in my heart: "I'm at the end of myself." As the words flew out of me, so did my prayer to God: "Will you meet me in my brokenness? Are you enough to save me from the deepest pain I've known?" I wrote most of the song that day, but there was something missing. A week or so later, I went a mom's group at my church, where one woman shared about the deep struggles she and her family had been facing with cancer. She, too, was at her end. As I drove home, God told me that the song was for her, and gave me the rest of the words to the song, as if I was writing the prayer that she needed for where she was at. 

This project comes in response to the many emails, calls, texts, and in-person conversations of people requesting the song after also being touched by hearing it.  It's been made clear to me that people need a way to express the deep suffering they encounter in various walks of their journey of life, and that God wants to use "The End" as a tool to meet people in that suffering and draw them close to him.

My goal of $2600 will cover the cost of the highly professional recording and production needed to distribute "The End" to not only those who have already heard it, but to the many who haven't who God wants to touch through this song. It will also cover fees and the 5% reserve that Indiegogo applies to every fundraising campaign.

I invite you to join me in investing in the Kingdom and helping break down the barriers between God and people that are put up during times of suffering through contributing to my campaign and sharing it on social media, email, and in person. Thank you in advance for the impact that you are helping to create, and for blessing me in this process. 

Be blessed. 

Bri

My name is Briana Greer, and I am a songwriter, vocalist, musical worship leader, youth nonprofit director, wife, and mother based in Azusa, CA (LA area). 
I started writing "The End" one evening in the summer of 2019 when I was feeling utterly lost, broken, and hopeless. As I sat on my couch and cried, God gave me the words to express what was going on in my heart: "I'm at the end of myself." As the words flew out of me, so did my prayer to God: "Will you meet me in my brokenness? Are you enough to save me from the deepest pain I've known?" I wrote most of the song that day, but there was something missing. A week or so later, I went a mom's group at my church, where one woman shared about the deep struggles she and her family had been facing with cancer. She, too, was at her end. As I drove home, God told me that the song was for her, and gave me the rest of the words to the song, as if I was writing the prayer that she needed for where she was at. 
This project comes in response to the many emails, calls, texts, and in-person conversations of people requesting the song after also being touched by hearing it.  It's been made clear to me that people need a way to express the deep suffering they encounter in various walks of their journey of life, and that God wants to use "The End" as a tool to meet people in that suffering and draw them close to him.
My goal of $2600 will cover the cost of the highly professional recording and production needed to distribute "The End" to not only those who have already heard it, but to the many who haven't who God wants to touch through this song. It will also cover fees and the 5% reserve that Indiegogo applies to every fundraising campaign.
I invite you to join me in investing in the Kingdom and helping break down the barriers between God and people that are put up during times of suffering through contributing to my campaign and sharing it on social media, email, and in person. Thank you in advance for the impact that you are helping to create, and for blessing me in this process. 
Be blessed. 
Bri

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Amy Rasmussen, and I love teaching kids of all ages at Oh Suzannah Music Studio. I've been teaching music for almost 20 years, and I've seen my students gain confidence, discipline, focus, the ability to self-calm, and best of all, the heart & skills to worship God at home & in public. My students have played in at least a dozen churches and multiple nursing homes. This is my intention as a teacher, to share the gift of music in a way that points my students and others to God's love! What else but Love could give us such a gift as music? 
  • I will never get over how amazing it is that Rachel thought of our studio- as she was preparing to enter hospice. Rachel had wanted to open a studio similar to Oh Suzannah if she was able to get better. Yes, Rachel was an accomplished musician, yet an even more amazing person! She had a grace, a joy, and a peace surrounding her that would have set an environment of healing & flourishing growth in her studio. I want to honor this beautiful intent of Rachel's heart by establishing a summer sponsorship program for kids who would significantly benefit from the opportunity.
  • If you contribute to this campaign, you will be providing for lessons, possibly ukuleles, time spent with caring mentors, and basic life-skills training for kids who need and want this opportunity. I have access to our county's foster kids as well as to many kids whose parents are or have been in jail, or are currently struggling with some life issue. Your contribution could literally change the course of a child's life. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • For every $200 we can add one student per semester. 
  • If we raise $3,000 we could sponsor a class of 4 students, all summer, for 5 years! This goal is the equivalent of one or two one-week mission trips, but with much more relationship investment & life-changing skill transference.
  • If we raise $4,000, we could purchase ukuleles for each student each summer so they have an instrument they can practice on & keep if they meet their practice goals. (..achievable goals we will help them to meet :)
  • My dream is to offer a whole afternoon of teaching, reading, & playing (screen-free!) to my sponsored kids two or three times a week in the summer. If you are interested in supporting a more immersive experience, please let me know!
  • I would be love to update you with the progress of the class each summer and the students' stories whose lives you have touched with this gift. 
  • If we don't reach the whole goal, any money raised will be used to sponsor students in need. 

The Impact

  • Most of the time, the children who need the opportunity to learn a musical instrument the most are the very ones who have no access to that opportunity. Children who have experienced trauma are the ones most in need of the incredible benefits music has to offer. Childhood trauma can put into motion regressive impairment in young, malleable brains, with negative consequences extending into their future and to the people around them. "In recent years, increasing studies have focused on the long-term consequences of childhood trauma and a growing body of evidence suggests a link between childhood trauma and higher risk for cognitive impairments, especially executive dysfunction, in later life.," [Read: Neural Correlates of Childhood Trauma with Executive Function] The great news is that time spent learning how to play a musical instrument greatly increases executive function in addition to many other benefits! [Ted-ed video: "How Music Affects Your Brain"] 
  • I have successfully held one sponsorship class for an entire semester including transportation provision. I have also had individual students sponsored over the years. These lessons had a great impact on the students and established a strong relationship with a caring adult in their lives. [article: One Caring Adult]
  • I deeply care about kids- giving love, tools to cope, confidence to succeed, and protection against the oppressors of substance abuse, generational dysfunction, predatory relationships, or the simple lack of resources.

Risks & Challenges

  • Sponsoring the kids who need it most comes with challenges, but I have been working for families in my community for years now, and I'm passionate and determined to do whatever I can to be a friend and support for the long haul. 
  • I am prepared to offer transportation so the kids can come to the studio and to offer space to practice as needed.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't give, please help get the word out and make some noise about this! 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you for checking this campaign out! I hope Rachel can see this happening and how deeply her thoughtfulness and belief in what my music studio stands for has touched my heart. Pray for beautiful things please!

Love,

Amy

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jen Myzel.  I am a songwriter, ritualist, elementary school music teacher, and activist in Oakland, CA. I have been cultivating my songwriting skills over the past 11 years, with two studio albums, Family Tree and Silence Speak, as well as my most recent children’s sing-a-long book, Yellow Lotus Flower.  

I am now recording my third studio album, Birds of the Night! Of the ten songs on the album, half of the songs are ritualistic songs that are already being sung at prayer ceremonies, direct actions, and end-of-life ceremonies.  The other half are lyrical soul-pop songs that weave stories on critical topics including race, climate, hope, hopelessness, and belonging.  

The music ranges from hip-hop beats to folk rhythms to vocal looping and spoken word poetry.  As I grow as a person and in my career as a music teacher, my music is growing in its depth and skill, and I cannot wait to share this next album you. 

 

We’re birds of the night

We’re taking flight

And we’ll fly through the dawn

‘Cause we’re moving on

Yeah we’re moving on

 

We’ve got the wind at our back

This is a sacred act

And we’ll fly through the dawn

‘Cause we’re moving on

Yeah we’re moving on

 

Speaking of the Birds of the Night, did I mention the music video? Five incredible activist-artist-healers have come together to sing and dance our prayers. All of us descend from different cultural lineages of this Earth. We are embodying bird goddesses, united around the fire, our wings open wide, ready to fly through the storm.  Our dance around the fire is interspersed with direct actions for the Amazon, and a powerful spoken word piece in Spanish by Maria Xiomara Dorsey.  Your pre-sales will help us complete and release this POWERFUL prayer of a music video!!!

Shout out to all of the incredible humans who are a part of this album:

  • Dyna Eria (vocals + bird goddess)
  • Masumi Hayashi-Smith (bird goddess)
  • Shakthi Ganeshan (bird goddess)
  • Maria Xiomara Dorsey (spoken word poetry)
  • Chad Wilkins (Vocals)
  • Lauren Brown (Vocals)
  • Clauco Belize (Photography)
  • Sarika Dagar (Film-maker + Director)
  • JonJon Alevazakis (Music  Production)
  • Eric Oberthaler (Music Production)
  • Maya Abramson (Violin)
  • David Lipps (Drums)
  • Simcha Schwartz (Idea-Bouncer, Head cheerleader + my fiance ;)

What We Need & What You Get

To be honest, I’m not trying to raise the full cost of producing this album.  This album will cost $9,000 and I am aiming to fundraise $6,000 through this Crowdfunding campagin.  That said, if you are excited about this and can give extra, please do! It will pay forward in the hearts and minds this music will touch.

 

Here is my budget outline for this album:

  • $2,000 = Recording
  • $2,500 = Production, Mixing
  • $750 = Studio Musicians (drums, violin, backup vocals)
  • $1,000 = Mastering
  • $1,250 = Music Video 
  • $750 = Album, Poetry Pamphlet Printing, Shipping
  • $500 = Graphic Design
  • $250 = Album Release Concert
  • = $9,000

 

This campaign is an album pre-sale, with some extra goodies as well.  Birds of the Night will be available in digital or physical form.  Alongside it will be a beautiful poetry pamphlet, with all of the song lyrics and images from the Birds of the Night. I’ve also got inspirational postcards, personalized songs, my whole collection of music, and a house concert or Work that Reconnects Workshop.

 

Here’s a sneak peak of the perks:

  • Birds of the Night Album (Digital) + Poetry Pamphlet: $20
  • Birds of the Night Album (Physical) + Poetry Pamphlet: $25
  • Birds of the Night Album + Poetry Pamphlet + 5 BIRDS OF THE NIGHT POSTCARDS: $50
  • All of the above + Yellow Lotus Flower Children's Book : $100
  • My Full Music + Book Catalog: Birds of the Night, Silence Speak, Family Tree and Yellow Lotus Flower children’s sing-a-long book: $150
  • A personalized song written for you or your community, on a topic of your choice : $300
  • A 3-Hour House Concert or Work that Reconnects Workshop: $800

 

The Impact

This album will be musical medicine, and I believe our world needs more honest, deep, and inspiring messages.  I am pouring my heart and soul into this album, just like my previous works- Yellow Lotus Flower, Silence Speak, and Family Tree, and I trust these songs will find their way to the people who need to hear them, at the times when they are needed.  Songs from my previous works are being sung at weddings, funerals, gatherings, street protest, classrooms, and more.

Risks & Challenges

There is always the chance that I will not raise the necessary funds needed to complete the album and music video in the timeline I had hoped for.  

That said, I am a determined woman, and this album WILL be complete someway and somehow. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Post this campaign on your social media page! Or even better, tell someone IN PERSON about my music and books, and encourage them to pre-order this album.

 

Thank you so much and I look forward to sharing this music with you this winter <3

story:
Help us make the first (and greatest) TINY BIT OF GIANT'S BLOOD full-length album!

Hello, friends.

John Scholvin, Jackie Schimmel, Larry Beers,* and I have begun work on the FIRST EVER full-length album by TINY BIT OF GIANT’S BLOOD. We’re recording with Bryan Clavey at Crystall Recorders in Lombard (if you can find this hidden treasure, you get a cookie), the same place we made our five-song debut EP (“Dram A”) last year. 

We’re creating 15 recordings of all-new material, and working hard to build what we hope will be a modern masterpiece of glam punk heavy rock in the spirit of Queen, David Bowie, Iggy Pop, Van Halen, Led Zeppelin, and other influences that have, at some point, impressed us with their implementation of gorgeous creative excess. It’s going to be pretty different from anything by our other bands (The Good, Sunshine Boys, Mucca Pazza, etc.) and we think you’re going to love it. 

The album is dedicated to this premise:

Sometimes you need to make yourself a little bigger.

And in fact, we need to make our pile of dollars bigger to get through the process of finishing this release. By contributing to our campaign, you’ll help us cover

  • studio costs
  • manufacturing expenses
  • paying artists
  • engineers
  • producers
  • mastering plants
  • publicity expenses
  • and more

In return, you’ll get unique and limited items, like:

  • special vials of giant’s blood
  • demos
  • limited edition t-shirts
  • handwritten lyrics

And also once-in-a-lifetime experiences such as:

  • custom songs
  • house concerts
  • your name in the liner notes

You’ll even be the first to receive THE FINISHED PRODUCT, in digital, vinyl, or CD (or all three!) formats. If all goes well and we get enough smackeroos, we hope to be able to unleash this sexy mastodon into the world in February 2020.

Why are we asking for your help?

Onstage we are giant, but in daily life we are puny humans doing everything ourselves. No record label, no promoter, no booking agent, just a few lifelong, notoriously unpaid musicians with spouses and kids and dogs, doing our best to make great stuff then hustling to the post office to deliver it to your gorgeous ears. We do a lot just by sheer hard work (lights, shoes, etc.), but the economies of releasing an actual full-length product go beyond our abilities to MacGyver them.  

Peruse our sweet offerings and get them while they last. 

Take a look at all the ways you can help fund this project, at many levels. By contributing, you won't just get something unique / early / cool, you’ll get sneak peeks at the recording in process, and you’ll be the first to hear stuff as it’s made!

If you have questions about the campaign, or the band, or you’d just like to debate whether or not the black side of Queen II is the greatest 20 minutes of music ever recorded, please email us at TinyBitOfGiantsBlood@gmail.com.

And of course, whether you can donate or not, you can help us a ton by just sharing this campaign with your friends. 

Extra special thanks to Lincoln Rogers for filming the crowdfunding video, and, as ever, THANK YOU for supporting original music. 

Tony / John / Jackie / Larry

Tiny Bit of Giant's Blood

 

*  Who the hell is Larry Beers?? He’s our new drummer, but he’s not really new…  he has now played more TBGB shows than any other drummer! Larry is a titan in the Chicago rock scene; he’s performed and recorded with the Charming Beggars, Mucca Pazza, Crash Test Dummies, Ezra Furman, Michael McDermott, Nicholas Tremulis, and so many others.

story:
The JEWCASTAR Story

From 1999-2004 I toured Internationally performing Jewish music.  During that time, I had the vision to one day create a guitar that was shaped like a Star of David and had Jewish symbolism and spiritual intent.  It wasn't until 2019 that I met guitar maker Alexander Halverson and together this dream has become the Limited Edition Jewcastar Guitar.   

The most important thing to me and Alex was that the Jewcastar guitar would be a very high quality professional instrument first and a creative design second.  We've sourced the best quality materials in order to bring this versatile guitar to life and spent months perfecting the deign.  By contributing to our campaign you can help us to not only build more Jewcastars but to develop our guitar brand and create more professional quality guitars with new creative symbolic designs. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping that you love the Limited Edition Jewcastar so much that you want to be one of the chosen ones that will rock the Jewcastar, but we recognize that not everyone is in a position to own this high-end, hand made, museum quality instrument.  For those that can purchase the guitar, you will get one or more semi-customized to your specs at a significantly discounted price and be one of up to 100 people in the world to own this design.  There is also an opportunity for a guitar shop to create their own one of a kind custom color to sell to their clients and to market their support of the Jewcastar brand.

For everyone else, you will be able to showcase your love for our campaign by proudly wearing shirts, hats, stickers, keychains, or gifting Jewcastar pics to your guitar loving friends and family!  For those that have a greater appreciation of hand made items and are able to help with a larger contribution you will get a hand made miniature of the Jewcastar Guitar built in Spain by  and/or our hand made Jewcastar Pic Box made by guitar maker Alexander Halverson.  About half of the money that we bring in will go to the high quality parts and materials.  The other half will help us to invest in a robotic wood carving machine in order for us to make instruments more quickly and with a more consistant look. We will also use some of the funding to upgrade our maker space which will enable us to make more guitars in a larger space.

The Impact

Alex and I have a passion for building guitars!  We truly hope that the Jewcastar will help us to develop a community of people that can get behind our designs and support our dreams of creating guitars with intention.  We have more designs that we would love to create and share with the world!  Your support of our campaign will help us to develop more Jewcastars and other models which will help us to bring more instruments to market and fulfill our dream of building high-quality, beautiful, hand-made, professional instruments.  

Risks & Challenges

At the moment we recognize that there are many professional guitar companies in the market and that most guitars that are sold are in the education/low end market.  That said, we believe that by creating a direct to buy approach and building unique, professional quality, semi-customized guitars that are inspired we can succeed in building guitars that give people the opportunity to be part of an inspired brand while playing an instrument that was made specifically for them!  You can choose your color, bridge style, 6 string or 7 string and select a 22 or 24 fret.  

Other Ways You Can Help

The Limited Edition Jewcastar Guitar is being developed in order to build a community of backers and supporters that can help us to create more beautiful, high-end, hand crafted instruments.  There are many ways that people can help even if they can't directly contribute!  Please share share share our campaign...it will make your friends smile!  Tweet about us!! Share our campaign with media outlets, and use the Indiegogo share tools to easily let the world know that you believe in what we are doing.
story_txt:
The JEWCASTAR Story
From 1999-2004 I toured Internationally performing Jewish music.  During that time, I had the vision to one day create a guitar that was shaped like a Star of David and had Jewish symbolism and spiritual intent.  It wasn't until 2019 that I met guitar maker Alexander Halverson and together this dream has become the Limited Edition Jewcastar Guitar.   
The most important thing to me and Alex was that the Jewcastar guitar would be a very high quality professional instrument first and a creative design second.  We've sourced the best quality materials in order to bring this versatile guitar to life and spent months perfecting the deign.  By contributing to our campaign you can help us to not only build more Jewcastars but to develop our guitar brand and create more professional quality guitars with new creative symbolic designs. 

What We Need & What You Get
We are hoping that you love the Limited Edition Jewcastar so much that you want to be one of the chosen ones that will rock the Jewcastar, but we recognize that not everyone is in a position to own this high-end, hand made, museum quality instrument.  For those that can purchase the guitar, you will get one or more semi-customized to your specs at a significantly discounted price and be one of up to 100 people in the world to own this design.  There is also an opportunity for a guitar shop to create their own one of a kind custom color to sell to their clients and to market their support of the Jewcastar brand.
For everyone else, you will be able to showcase your love for our campaign by proudly wearing shirts, hats, stickers, keychains, or gifting Jewcastar pics to your guitar loving friends and family!  For those that have a greater appreciation of hand made items and are able to help with a larger contribution you will get a hand made miniature of the Jewcastar Guitar built in Spain by  and/or our hand made Jewcastar Pic Box made by guitar maker Alexander Halverson.  About half of the money that we bring in will go to the high quality parts and materials.  The other half will help us to invest in a robotic wood carving machine in order for us to make instruments more quickly and with a more consistant look. We will also use some of the funding to upgrade our maker space which will enable us to make more guitars in a larger space.

The Impact
Alex and I have a passion for building guitars!  We truly hope that the Jewcastar will help us to develop a community of people that can get behind our designs and support our dreams of creating guitars with intention.  We have more designs that we would love to create and share with the world!  Your support of our campaign will help us to develop more Jewcastars and other models which will help us to bring more instruments to market and fulfill our dream of building high-quality, beautiful, hand-made, professional instruments.  

Risks & Challenges
At the moment we recognize that there are many professional guitar companies in the market and that most guitars that are sold are in the education/low end market.  That said, we believe that by creating a direct to buy approach and building unique, professional quality, semi-customized guitars that are inspired we can succeed in building guitars that give people the opportunity to be part of an inspired brand while playing an instrument that was made specifically for them!  You can choose your color, bridge style, 6 string or 7 string and select a 22 or 24 fret.  

Other Ways You Can Help
The Limited Edition Jewcastar Guitar is being developed in order to build a community of backers and supporters that can help us to create more beautiful, high-end, hand crafted instruments.  There are many ways that people can help even if they can't directly contribute!  Please share share share our campaign...it will make your friends smile!  Tweet about us!! Share our campaign with media outlets, and use the Indiegogo share tools to easily let the world know that you believe in what we are doing.

story:
Overview

The Dennis Kwok Jazz Orchestra needs your help in finishing our debut full-length album! The album consists of the "Windward Bound" suite, an original work for 19-piece jazz orchestra and multiple woodwind soloist. 

Summary

My name is Dennis Kwok, I am a saxophonist, composer and arranger based in Toronto. The Dennis Kwok Jazz Orchestra began as a passion project in 2017 as a way to give my music a voice and collaborate with many fine colleagues in the Greater Toronto Area. Over the last 3 years, we have performed in venues across Toronto, collaborated with some of Canada's finest, and now we're about ready to release the results of our hard work since our beginnings. 

The "Windward Bound" Suite has been an idea festering in my head since the band started. I knew I wanted to find a way to combine my teenage memories of sailing, the folklore of life on the seas, my personal musical inspiration of large ensembles in all genres, and my assets as a woodwind performer. The result is 40 minutes of music that blends contemporary big band, wind ensemble, choral music, aleatoric discomfort, storytelling, and lots of woodwinds.

I'm very lucky to be working with these fine folk who also appear on the recording:

Reeds: Naomi McCarroll-Butler, Sophia Smith, Brenden Varty, Kyle Tarder-Stoll, Jonathan Lau

Trumpets: Megan Jutting, Matt Smith, Paul Callander, Marie Goudy

Trombones: Nick Marshall, Andrew Gormley, Charlotte Mcafee-Brunner, Inayat Kassam

Rhythm: Augustine Yates (piano), Aidan Funston (guitar), Jonathan Wielebnowski (bass), Jacob Wutzke (drums)

Vocals: Caity Gyorgy 

And also this amazing production team that has been essential to the project.

Conductor: Mason Victoria

Producers: Jillana Nickel, Chris Wiens (assistant producer)

Adviser: Mike Ardagh

Recording/Mixing: Brandon Wells (tracks 1-6)

Mixing: Andrew Chung (track 6)

Mastering: Reuben Ghose

Artwork and Layout: Mingjia Chen

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what has already happened:

  • Recording at Humber Studios
  • Editing of the whole album
  • Mixing of tracks 1,2,6
  • Mastering of tracks 1,2,6
  • Graphic design and album layout by Mingjia Chen

​What's left to do!

  • Hire Brandon Wells as the mix engineer for tracks 3,4,5. (He did the prior tracks and they sound awesome!) $500
  • Mastering at Mojito Mastering (Reuben did our last 3 tracks and they also sound amazing) $500
  • Get physical CD's made (believe it or not, CD's are still relevant...) $1000
  • Put it online so you can listen to it wherever you listen to music. $50
  • Marketing and publicity campaign that will put this recording in front of eyes and ears around the world! $500
  • The CD release on March 13, and the CD release concert March 29, at 918 Bathurst! 

We're so close to finishing this record and the final costs total up to $2550. If you can contribute even a little bit, that goes a long way to making sure we can get this done and out to the world! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to this campaign, that's okay! You can also help out by:

  • Sharing this campaign on social media and/or with anyone you think would be interested.
  • Keep in touch with social media to see what's happening on Facebook, and Instagram.
  • Come to our CD Release concert!

Keep in touch with social media to see what's happening on Facebook, and Instagram.
Come to our CD Release concert!

story:
Hello!

Thanks for visiting my campaign page. I have been working on a new EP featuring 5 brand new songs that I cannot wait to share with you!

The album was recorded in the fall of 2020 out in Fairview, TN. Now we are working on the finishing touches; photo shoots, music videos, and get the album ready for distribution. There is still a lot to be done but I am hoping to get this out into the world by Spring 2021. 

Where the funds go:

Since the recording has already happened, I need your help to get the music into your hands! By contributing to my campaign, you will be helping with the above mentioned "finishing touches" to release this EP.

  • Mastering the EP
  • Photo shoot for the album
  • Music video shoots
  • Distribution
  • Promotion

What you get:

If you contribute to my campaign it would me the world to me. It shows me that you not only support me, but my music as well. For anyone who contributes, I have created some awesome perks that you will receive in return!

Other Ways You Can Help:

Some people just can't contribute and thats okay! But that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Follow me on social media for all news and updates
  • Share my campaign with all of your family and friends

story:
What Is This For?

I have been singing and writing for almost 15 years. I always tell people my music sounds like if Taylor Swift and Jewel had a music baby. Which makes sense, since they are my two biggest musical inspirations. In all this time, I have never professionally recorded any of my music, and I have decided it is finally time to put it out into the world. With your contribution to this campaign, I will be able to fully realize my vision with this album, and share it with anyone who has an interest in listening. 

I have wanted to record my music for some time now, but have never felt as determined and passionate as I am about this project. If all goes as planned, I will have a physical copy available for purchase, as well as have it available for streaming on sites we all know and love. Any and all contributions help make this dream a reality, and I am incredibly excited for it to come to life.

How Much Is Needed, and Where Is It Going?

In order to reach my goals, and release on the timeline I have created for myself, I will need somewhere in the range of $5,000. This will go towards recording, printing, and promoting my album, as well as helping to create merchandise that I can use as marketing material, as well as funding for whatever project I decide to work on next!

I have some fun things planned for those who contribute as well! Depending on how much you donate, I will be giving you something in return as a thank you for helping make my dream come true.

  • for every $10 donation, I will curate a music playlist just for you
  • for every $20 donation, you will receive exclusive access to the Small Town Tragedy EP, featuring some old favorites. 
  • for every $50 donation, I will send out a personal thank you, as well as give you exclsive access to the Small Town Tragedy EP
  • for every $100 donation, you will receive exclusive access to the Small Town Tragedy EP, a handwritten thank you note, and a limited edition Small Town Tragedy can koozie

If I am not able to reach my goal of $5,000, any money collected will still go towards the making of my album. The project just may take a while longer to complete.

What Could Go Wrong?

This won't come without challenges, of course. Since I am new to the recording process, I have yet to learn what can (and probably will) go wrong along the way. It may take longer than expected, it may take a few tries, but I am determined to release music for all of us to enjoy.

How Else Can I Help?

As I previously said, any and all contributions help. And if you can't donate money, that's okay! Sharing the campaign and helping get the word out about this project will help tremendously as well. Indiegogo has a lot of great tools to help make sharing easy.

If you read this far, thank you. And if you are able to help in any way, THANK YOU. I am very excited for what the future holds for myself and my music. I'm thrilled that it is finally all happening, after All This Time.

story:
I am a folksinger and musical/labor historian, of sorts, based in Ithaca, NY, and this new album is being released in October. I've toured Australia, both coasts of the US, and up and down the east coast for years, and when not touring, I juggled more than 50 nursing and veterans homes, typically 8-10 gigs or more per week, in upstate New York. My work with seniors and veterans has inspired me and contributed to my creative efforts over the years, and the influences are certainly visible on this new album, with eight new songs and covers of four of my favorite songs by other writers.  

I started working on this album, seriously, in early March, and we had seven songs for the album, and were moving through the recording process, when the studio had to shut down because of the virus and efforts to contain it in New York. When we finally resumed work four months later, in July, I had lost more than 75% of my income, surviving now on several online music gigs/visits a week at nursing homes that can do online visits. I have completed this album with the little savings I had available, and the unemployment benefits that were available through the Pandemic Unemployment Assistance (federal) program that ended in July. The album has several songs that are very timely, given the upcoming US elections, but it is also a storybook of sorts, portraits of people and places in time from my travels.

 

Now I need to produce the CD, mail it out to more than 200 DJs and other media contacts, and promote the songs, especially those that are relevant to the coming election. Your assistance will help cover the final costs of producing the CDs and mailing them out.  There are several levels and premiums attached, in effect, you can just "pre-order" the CD here or by contributing additional funds, you can assist with the production of the CD and get more in return.  Please note that there are additional mailing charges for INTERNATIONAL donors, since mailing costs will be much greater. But US orders/perks DO NOT need to pay additional for shipping. All CDs will be signed if requested. If you choose a "perk" with options to choose some of my older CDs, I'll be in touch (as I will with all donors) to figure out which CDs you want.

 

Many of my friends and fans/followers know I give a lot to others in my work. I sing for dementia and Alzheimers' wards, in psych wards at veterans' homes, on many a deathbed and with many people facing the end of their lives. I drive a van with 230,000 miles on it and have always paid for my work and fortunately, never worried about where the next meal was coming from, partly because I worked in the "real world" for a long time before making the move to full-time musician 11 years ago, and partly because I don't care for or need much to live in this world... Now that the coronavirus has put off any live music/touring for the next year, I feel I can use this time to really get this new music out to the world. Your help will be greatly appreciated and will help inspire people through this next difficult period in our nation's, and the world's, history. Please email me at george@georgemann.org or message me with any questions. Thanks for your support!

 

-George Mann (9/20/20)

story:
We all know that life can be challenging. 

Mine has not been easy to say the least. I’m telling you this with an open heart. 

I have had a lot of horrible experiences in my life. I am a complex trauma survivor and my journey towards healing has not been straightforward. In fact, it’s been quite tough. Coming to terms with my past has often kept me awake at night.

I’ve failed many times. Been hopeless. Felt lost. And in need of much grace and mercy. But I’ve also fought to get to where I am today. I've not only fought for myself, but for my family. The once weak, insecure, hidden little girl inside of me has turned into a passionate, brave and strong woman.

And yet… here I am, in need of help.

Because I’ve been a survivor, asking for help has never been part of my equation.

For one thing, I thought it would make me lose my integrity and turn me into a beggar. I’ve been so afraid of that but I’ve come to realise through counselling that asking for help takes a ton of courage. It’s actually a strength. It's brave. 

What has given me the courage to ask for help is knowing that as a child of God, it's what we do, we help each other. There is nothing to be ashamed of by putting your heart out there and asking people to support you.

To date, I’ve funded this entire music career on my own. I’ve made a lot of sacrifices and I’ve probably spent around £40k+ to get to this stage, an Investment that I'm proud of. 

I cannot begin to tell you the countless messages I’ve received from people about how my music has changed their life. It's delivered many from fear, comforted grieving women who lost their babies and even loved ones. It’s given comfort to many who have struggled with their mental health. It’s been a huge source of peace and strength in dark times. You cannot put a price tag on that.

A friend once told me that my music is speaking to people’s hearts because of my own terrible experiences and how I’ve used them positively. I've been determined to use my bad experiences for good. That's why I chose a path of light years ago, even though I knew that walking out of the darkness would not be an easy process. 

It's been an amazing journey so far, but to be honest, I now find myself quite stuck.

I actually can’t go any further… not without your help. 

If I was signed to a record label, they would probably invest thousands to promote my music. And while a label can be a way to keep recording and promoting, I know I have some amazingly talented friends who love me, and can help me with marketing and communication as an independent artist. But to do so, I still need a budget to make it happen. 

That’s why I’m raising £20k. I want to give more people a chance to hear what I have to share. I want to help broken and traumatised souls find peace. With this money, I'll be able to reach more people and keep building an amazing community.

My music is my ministry, but without you, my voice and message won't be heard by those who need it.

BUT... with you, and because of you...

my message of hope will reach many more people.

So here I stand… feeling vulnerable, asking for you to jump on board so that together, we can do great things and change lives forever. It’s because of you, my fans, supporters and friends, that independent artists can remain authentic and spread their message to the rest of the world.

The money I'm raising will essentially go into: 

Producing new music so I can keep inspiring people

Marketing & communication to reach many more people.

Merchandising such as hoodies, mugs, and other goodies I can offer you. 

If you have any question or want to join the family you can ask me directly here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/loulitagillandfriends

I've been determined to use my bad experiences for good. And while a label can be a way to keep recording and promoting, I know I have some amazingly talented friends who love me, and can help me with marketing and communication as an independent artist. But to do so, I still need a budget to make it happen. That’s why I’m raising £20k. I want to give more people a chance to hear what I have to share. I want to help broken and traumatised souls find peace. With this money, I'll be able to reach more people and keep building an amazing community.My music is my ministry, but without you, my voice and message won't be heard by those who need it.BUT... with you, and because of you...my message of hope will reach many more people.So here I stand… feeling vulnerable, asking for you to jump on board so that together, we can do great things and change lives forever. It’s because of you, my fans, supporters and friends, that independent artists can remain authentic and spread their message to the rest of the world.The money I'm raising will essentially go into: Producing new music so I can keep inspiring peopleMarketing & communication to reach many more people.Merchandising such as hoodies, mugs, and other goodies I can offer you. If you have any question or want to join the family you can ask me directly here: https://www.facebook.com/groups/loulitagillandfriends

story:
Born and raised in Flint, Michigan, Caleb Robinson is a multi-talented drummer who has been playing and learning the craft since the young age of three. He was inspired by watching his father play the drums at his grandparent’s church, and soon received his first pair of drumsticks to play at church, too. Along with drums, Caleb also plays bass and produces music. He describes his musical style as aggressive yet dynamic which can be compared to some of his musical influences like Tony Williams, Isaiah Rashad, Elvin Jones, Omar Hakim, and Thomas Pridgen. Like them, Caleb plays by the beat of his own drum, choosing to create and work with music that’s more embedded in jazz fusion and Hip-Hop; two genres that bring out the best in him. 

I have built this campaign to raise money for my first album. The reason I am creating this album and building this campaign is, This music is a reflection of my life the last 2 years. The triumph of my life I think can touch many people in a deep and spiritual way. Some of my album has been funded out of my pocket. But to  continue to make a good product for you all, I'm asking for your help! The budget will be used to support Gordon  Van Gent for my mixing and mastering, art work and press.

Creating an album as an artist is very time consuming and expensive.  Right now there is a deadly virus going on that has put me and a lot of other full time musicians, artist and creators out of work. Yet and still I believe this is the perfect time to give the world this music. 

I want to be a bridge for other musicians to get their music and skills heard and developed through whatever influence I gain from this. Also, I want to start a spark in someone's life, even if it's just one. A spark for healing.

 

Please share this campaign with all of your friends and family. If you cannot contribute you are still greatly valued and might be able to help find someone that can. Sharing, Likes, Comments, and views are all a great help also on any of my social media platforms. Thank you, looking forward to seeing you!

story:
Hello! I’m Noan and I’m a solo musician who just released his first EP! I’ve been making music since I was 6 years old, and started producing when I was 14.  At 16, I started working on Waves, my first song, which I released a year ago! I continued working on my music and managed to produce a whole EP on my own!! I am currently studying music production, and I am hoping to make a living out of my art eventually :)

I really love this project and I opened this Campaign so I can go ahead with it :)) This includes covering for every cost (Music-making, online marketing, photoshoot, vinyls printing),and if you like what I do and would like to see more, please feel free to help me! You can even get a very cool vinyl with artwork made by my best friend (Amazing artist!!).

Please don’t hesitate to check out my social media!

Website | Spotify | Instagram

And please check out my best friend’s art!

Instagram: @illuminoa7u7

story:
15 years in the making...

Well. Kind of. Our last album was all the way back in 2005. Since then the band have been semi active always playing a few times a year. Always having fun.

Throughout this time Si has never stopped writing. It's what he does. There have been dozens of behind the scenes demos yet for one reason or another real life has got in the way of us booking studio time and putting all the ideas into action.

The emergence of local to the band producer Paul West @ paulwestproduction.com ; has given us the freedom to record at our convenience while we juggle busy family lives.

It's given us a new lease of life having a world class producer on our door step.

We saved for 18 months out of our own pockets to record this album and that bought us half the record. The other half is borrowed.

It's money well spent.

This is by far and away the best we've sounded on tape (yeah OK it's not tape pedant fans) and is also the best collection of songs Si has written (imo).

So - I hear you ask - if you have already paid for the recording then why the crowd funder? Simple. We want to crack on recording the next batch of songs but need to ensure this one is bought and paid for before we do.

This is where you come in...

3dBs Down need YOU

We could slap the album on streaming platform straight away but the truth is *whispers* artists make next to feck all off streaming platforms *whispers*

So we decided to put together these CD + merch packages. When target is met we can use the money raised to get everything manufactured.

Anything over and above goes into paying off borrowed recording costs.

Anything over and above that goes into the kitty for the next release.

Here's the thing though. The album is finished and you will be able to download your copy straight away when you buy any of the Perks (allowing us 24-48 hours to email the download code to you)

Back of the net.

Full disclosure: We will be putting the record on streaming platforms in the future but not this side of Christmas.

The future

Have a look and listen of the preview video the incredibly talented Jim Wheeler has put together. It's at the top of this page. See what you think.

If you like what you hear; help us make more music by purchasing a perk package if you can or maybe tell a friend if you can't (preferably by using the Indiegogo share tools).

If you do both. Well. Cripes. That's a magnificent effort.

Although to be honest - if you've managed to make it this far down the page then that is an equally impressive effort.

Holy crap has it really been 15 years?!

Big love + thanks

3dBs Down

story:
Herzlich willkommen - Welcome - benvenuto -Shalom

I AM INVITING YOU TO PRE-ORDER MY NEW ALBUM

I am very proud to have been invited to sing in Australia, Germany, Austria and Israel this year. Unfortunately, many of my concerts have been cancelled or rescheduled to 2021 due to the global pandemic.

As an independent artist, the current global crisis has hit me hard like many others. Despite the current obstacles, I wish to complete my new album during June 2020. If I receive enough pre-orders in 40 days, I will be able to proceed with my final recordings and complete this album of beautiful songs from Opera, Musicals, Films, Pop and Jazz. I hope that my new album will bring you  joy, hope and good energy during this very challenging time. With your support I can  complete my album and have it sent out to you by July 2020. This will guarantee a physical CD signed with a personal dedication.

 

My new album will feature songs from opera, musicals, film, pop songs and jazz. All songs are very emotional and in different languages  (German, Italian, Spanish, English and Hebrew). This album touches on our current times. I truly hope that through my music people will feel a sense of hope and unity.

Please help me share this pre-order crowdfunding page worldwide! We have 30 days to reach our target. Thank you so much for taking the time and for your kind support throughout my campaign!!!

Pre-Order for yourself, for a friend, for a family member or for someone you think would love to hear my music; I can send a digital download or CD with a personal message from you to anyone anywhere in the World ♫♫♫♫

 

Deutsch 

 Hallo meine Lieben, wir leben gerade in schwierigen Zeiten. Das Corona Virus bringt das Leben von uns allen durcheinander. So auch meins: Leider mussten all meine geplanten Konzerte und Projekte abgesagt werden und damit fehlt mir das Geld, um die Produktion meines neuen Albums voranzutreiben. Dieses Album wird eine wundervolle Mischung aus Arien, Pop-, Jazz- und Musical- Liedern sein.
Um dieses Album für Euch fertigzustellen zu können, habe ich beschlossen, ein Crowdfunding-Kampagne für mein neues Album zu starten. Es müssen innerhalb von 30 Tagen genug CDs vorbestellt werden, damit ich mein neues Album bis Juni fertigstellen, drucken und pressen kann. Ihr würdet mir unglaublich helfen, wenn Ihr mein neues Album schon jetzt auf Indiegogo vorbestellt, und ihr würdet gleich nach Fertigstellung, das neue Album zugeschickt bekommen.  
Mit euer Hilfe bin ich sicher, dass ich dieses Ziel erreichen werde und ich mein neues Album bis Juli 2020 fertigstellen kann.
Liebe Grüße und bleibt gesund,  Euer Assaf

My new album will feature songs from Opera & Musicals , Films ,Pop songs and Jazz evergreens , all song are very emotional  and in different languages  ( German, Italian , Spanish , English and Hebrew ) This Album matches to the times we live in and I hope that people will hear my music and feel a sense of hope and unity with their family  ,Friends and their loved ones.

Please help me share this Pre-Order crowdfunding page worldwide! We have 30 days to reach our target!! Thank you so much for taking the time and  for your kind support through out my campaign!!!

Pre-Order for yourself, for a friend, for a family member or for someone you think would love to hear my music; I can send a digital download or CD with a personal message from you to anyone anywhere in the World ♫♫♫♫

★PHOTOGRAPHS BY Gilad Shabani ★

story:
Overview

This will be the debut big band album by the 'Minnie Big Band', led by Melbourne based arranger and composer Minnie Hill. This album will feature the music of Dave Brubeck and will celebrate what would have been his 100th birthday. The album will include an all-star lineup of many of Melbourne's top jazz musicians and emerging students. It is hoped that  this crowdfunding campaign will raise $3000 to go towards expenses such as musician and studio fees. This platform will mainly be used for reordering of the album or for general donations. Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my crowdfunding and music! I absolutely cannot wait for the recording in December and to share this album with you.

The big band will also be joined by Jack Earle on piano and Carlo Barbaro on alto saxophone in a feature role as a tribute to both Dave Brubeck and Paul Desmond. The album will consist mostly of Dave Brubeck's compositions that have been arranged for full big band.

 

The Band

WOW! This band is amazing, really, they are. I'm so thrilled to have a band of this quality playing my music. Check out the lineup below.

Saxophones: Carlo Barbaro, Tim Wilson, Flora Carbo, Sam Ondaatje, Cheryl Clarke, Mia Barham

Trumpets: Mick Fraser, Alex Howroyd, Gianni Marinucci, Thien Pham

Trombones: Nick Mulder, Jordan Murray, Dave Palmer, Joe O'Callaghan

Piano: Jack Earle

Bass: Blakely McLean Davies

Drums: Oliver Shute

 

Minnie Hill

Minnie Hill is a Melbourne based composer, arranger and saxophonist who primarily composes and arranges works for big band and smaller jazz settings. While Minnie arranges for her own projects and bands, she has also composed and arranged music for the Daryl McKenzie Jazz Orchestra, Paris Cat Big Band and both Jazz Melbourne Studio Youth Big Bands.

In 2020, Minnie's arrangement of 'Play Crazy For Me' won 1st place in the inaugural Musicians Arranging Guild of Australia Youth Arranging Competition. The competition was open to arrangers Australia wide that were under 30 years of age, while Minnie is younger than her other writing peers, she sees this as the start of a long and established career within the Melbourne music community. This arrangement can be found at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=35-5YbY6F0E&amp...

In 2019, Minnie's big band composition 'Silver's Swing' was selected for the VCAA 'Top Sounds' concert, recorded at the Iwaki Auditorium in Melbourne and highlighted the best student compositions across Victoria. As a performer, Minnie was lead alto in the invitation only Jazz Melbourne Studio Youth Big Band 1 (2019).

 

For more information about Minnie please visit https://www.minniehillmusic.com/

story:
Short Summary

For over a decade I have been wanting to record a full length Christmas album with my band The Calabash Club including all the bells, whistles, pedal steel, glockenspiel and horns and elves... well you get it. This dream has finally come to fruition and has far exceeded my expectations. On a cold winter night a few days before Christmas in 2019 the sessions for "Christmasland Jubilee" began at The Noise Floor Recording Studio in Dover, NH. I filled the studio with Christmas decorations galore and I felt completely lifted by the whole experience. For every studio session after that I would decorate, make cookies and hot cocoa for my musical friends playing on this album... and dress up like Santa Claus to greet them. I am completely enamored by these fine musicians who brought so much holiday magic to this album! And as for the (((vibe))) I was looking to capture on this album they all nailed it! I had tears of joy rolling down my cheeks so many times... a completely enchanted experience. This album contains seven original Christmas songs by yours truly... Dan Blakeslee.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I need your support to bring this album to the surface. I began recording this album in December of 2019 and continued to record it through January, February... and upon the last weeks of wrapping up the recording in March the pandemic came in postponing it's completion for many months. I have been working tirelessly to finish it.

Those of you who back this record will receive the digital download of the album before anyone else is able to hear it. The slated release is mid November the date to be determined. 

I am getting VINYL made for this one as this album was MADE for vinyl! This is a huge financial undertaking and I urge you to hop in this one quick if you want this option. Vinyl is never cheap to make but ALWAYS worth it! I am doing deluxe album packaging for this record with a silkscreened album cover and extensive liner notes. Vinyl usually takes months to get made... I am working with the kind folks at Burlington Record Plant to try to get this in your stockings by the end of December... it might be in January though... I will keep you in the loop. They are total pros and they put in extra effort to make sure that album sounds great and looks great which means it takes extra time.

Along with making vinyl, CD's, tshirts and hand silkscreened felt stockings to hang above your mantle I am also making three home made "Christmas Story" esque "leg lamps". These are going to be expensive to ship and very "fragile" so I am not sure if I will be putting them in this fundraiser but they will be available at some point before Christmas. It also takes me about a week to make each one so I will work my elf hands as diligently as possible!

The Impact

All that you contribute will help me finish paying to get the album completed, musicians paid, physical albums made plus an album promotion campaign. I am one person behind the helm doing everything so your financial help is more crucial than ever before. I have no label support and doing this out of pocket (though not one cent has been wasted) as it has fulfilled this long time dream of mine to record a Christmas album like this one you are about to hear.

Even if you don't have the funds to support this record please do share about this fundraiser on social media... I am one person trying to do everything I can to get this album as wide spread as possible and I need all the elves I can get to help bring this album to all those folks in need of some audible holiday cheer.

I can't thank all of you enough for reading this and being part of a grassroots effort to bring a new Christmas album into the world. You are all snow angels!

By the way not one ounce of irony was recorded in this album, it is a sincere, heartfelt, rollicking holiday listening experience... I hope you are ready!

Please be safe and healthy!

 

Sincerely,

Dan Blakeslee

musician . artist . elf
