I am one person trying to do everything I can to get this album as wide spread as possible and I need all the elves I can get to help bring this album to all those folks in need of some audible holiday cheer.
I can't thank all of you enough for reading this and being part of a grassroots effort to bring a new Christmas album into the world. You are all snow angels!
By the way not one ounce of irony was recorded in this album, it is a sincere, heartfelt, rollicking holiday listening experience... I hope you are ready!
Please be safe and healthy!
 
Sincerely,
Dan Blakeslee
musician . artist . elf

story:
Philly Godmother: the music of Trudy Pitts

  Hey there! My name is Jarad Astin, I am a jazz musician and producer, and am enlisting fellow lovers of jazz organ to jump on board with an amazing and unique project - an album dedicated to the music of the late Trudy Pitts. I had the luxury of studying organ with Trudy in the late 90’s while living in Philadelphia, and man is her tunes are smokin’! So who am I? I’m a trained pro - and I’ve owned and operated CueBro Productions since 2001, having since produced over 20 records in a wide swath of styles. Let’s read on...and if you saw the video, you heard some of the tracks in the underscore.....
  In her illustrious career, Trudy collaborated with some of the heaviest hitters of jazz including John Coltrane, Pat Martino and many others, and is considered one of the tastemakers of the Hammond organ in the genre. Being a true Philly native, and keeping her career close to home so-to-speak, her music is rarely explored by the scene, but now you have a chance to be a part of something wonderful - the opportunity to see her music arranged in a contemporary recording and presented to the world at large outside of the original pressings.
   Jazz is one of America’s greatest artistic achievements, and seeing that our bed of talented composers and musicians are continuously etched into the annals of history preserves not only their music in particular, but our culture and heritage as a whole. I’ve received the blessing of Trudy’s family in this venture, won’t you join me on this journey?

The Lowdown

    Rather than sit back and let Covid slow my creativity at a standstill, I opted to use the time to get back into the studio to finish some projects that have been looming, ones that a busy performance schedule made difficult to achieve. Over the summer I managed to pull off a session with a couple of players I’ve known for years out of NYC, drummer Brian Floody and the great guitarist Ed Cherry, both of whom have incredible resumes including work with Dizzy Gillespie, Fathead Newman, John Patton, and so many more. Now I am asking you to help me get the project out in the open! 
    One thing we are seeing right now is an absolute flood of new music coming from all angles and genres, as artists are not able to perform many are doing the same as I have - which makes releasing a bit more difficult to get above the “noise.” I am raising $11,500 to make this project happen in a manner fitting to someone of Trudy’s stature - the funds will cover artwork, PR by Lisa Reedy (a highly regarded jazz-centric publicist out of NYC), distribution to over 150 retro-minded international record outlets, release on all the major (and minor) digital platforms, a limited-edition pressing on Vinyl and CD, donations to the National Pancreatic Cancer Association and American Lupus Foundation in lieu of licensing fees (as per Trudy’s estate) and session costs - and by supporting this project you not only are lifting up the work of this amazing artist but supporting relevant medical research and the cats on the record, who are in and of themselves pillars in the foundation of the current flow of jazz!

 I’m offering some great perks to you for supporting this project, check this out: 

  •       $50 gets you a copy of the record on enhanced CD as well as a full-resolution download to dig while you jog around the block or walk the dog...and the chance to privately stream the record RIGHT AWAY to check out what you’re putting your hard-earned dollars towards! That means YOU get to hear it before ANYONE else. That’s serious...
  •       $100 gets you 2 copies, the full-res download as well as a “Who’s Hip” listing in the liner notes of a limited-edition CD and access to some killing session video
  •      $200 is gonna land you a copy of the vinyl pressing, 2 CD’s with a “Who’s Hip’ listing in the liner and access to the video footage...oh yeah, and don’t forget that pre-release access that NOBODY ELSE IS GETTIN’!
  •      $500 is big, baby - in addition to all the above you’ll receive a copy of my latest organ pressing on Vinyl, “Carpe Diem,” with the Boogaloo Communicators, the best record I’ve ever had the joy of getting to wax...and get hip to this, you’ll be named in the “Producer’s Circle” on the fist limited-edition run of the vinyl pressing! That’ll be one to impress even the stodgiest niece or nephew!
  •     $2,000 will get you to the moon - everything in the above package as well as a PRIVATE concert with the trio; given current Covid restrictions this’ll be challenging, but we can hook you up with a pro-level, multi-cam livestream and beam it anywhere you are in the world...and hook you up with a vid to remember the whole shebang. If you happen to be within a couple hours of NYC and wanna wait for things to clear, guess what?! We’ll nail it right in your living room! (will require some scheduling of course, but we’d rather play to a live audience!!) 

  So what happens if we don’t quite make the mark? Ya had to ask....

       I’ve been at this recording thing a long time - the best part is we’ve ALREADY RECORDED AND MASTERED THE SESSION! At least that takes some of the edge off...At the minimum, we’re going for the limited run of vinyl and basic international distribution to some of the HIPPEST record shops on the planet. Trudy’s music speaks it’s own volumes, and in the right hands the project could very well take on it’s own life through some copious self-promotion in the regular guerrilla channels (Social Media, hounding phone calls...you know the deal). 
        Back us up, and we could very well be looking at a Grammy nomination. That’ll put you at the forefront of one of 2021’s happeninest digs. You’ll be a part of spreading the love that was, and IS, Trudy Pitts, sending a message to the world that YOUR culture is not only meaningful but full of some deep-soul...and groovy as the day is long. We invented groovin’ high, so let’s embrace it and tell ‘me all! Drop a dime, share the news, and help this album cut through all the noise. 

  So what are you waiting for? If you’re still with me, you’re a down individual. Let’s get it together! Can’t swing a contribution at the moment? No problemo! How bout this...share, share, share!! Help us get the word out and nail this sucker to the floor. I know we got some social-media superstars out there who can really help us put this thing on the map, and we can make it worth the effort by offering you access to the private stream for your first 100 confirmed shares to your network...That’s called “sweat equity.”

  Thanks for hanging with me, thanks for giving this a shot in your busy schedule. Music is light, and light is love!

  As Trudy always said, Bright Moments!

      Your man, 

      Captain Jarad “Daddy Snuggs” Astin

story:
Story

Hey and welcome to the crowdfunding campaign of "The Dark Canyon". I am Keven Eknes, a Norwegian guitar player based in Los Angeles.

2020/21 have been an insanely hard year for everyone, especially music industry professionals. Personally, I went from having a fully booked year of shows and tours throughout 2020 to literally nothing. As a gig-worker, any work not executed ends up with virtually zero compensation. I had to change my entire working career from having my salary based upon live shows and touring, to videography based content creation. It has been a hard journey, but a good story was gained from it. This is my story through the music. With the change of career I ended up writing a lot of songs for gear demos, and "The Dark Canyon" will include extensions from the inspirations found in music during the pandemic. I hope this music can inspire you.

Funding an original music release as an independent musician is extremely costly, but the crowdfunding can be an amazing way for you to help the creation of this album.

The Costs

A release have many parties involved, including:

  • Musician Labor
  • Sound/Mix Engineer Labor
  • Mastering Engineer Labor
  • Graphic Design Costs
  • Physical Print
  • Distribution
  • Marketing
  • Studio Rental Costs
  • Potential Videographer Labor

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this link to your beloved friends and family!

 

See you soon!

story:
Music has always been a companion to me. It has helped me express myself in a way I could never describe with words.

I have spent the last 2 years of my life visiting the avenues of my soul with a pen, paper, and guitar; turning their contents into notes, chords, lyrics, and finally songs. I am now ready to record my first album.

Brand new Full-Length album with original songs

Thank you for stopping by and reading about my campaign. You have probably heard one of my songs, seen one of my videos, or engaged with my social media. If so, you already know how much music means for me, and today I am thanking you all for being here along the way.

My name is Richie Gomez and I am a singer-songwriter and performer. I was born in Peru and moved to Virginia, United States in 2014. I was profoundly shaped by the music diversity in my upbringing. At home, I got used to seeing vinyl records of amazing bands like Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin, and Carlos Santana that my father owned.  This, along with the music in the environment resulted in a fascinating mix of cultures.

All my experiences have left their mark on me; having many places to call home taught me how music was a universal way to express who I was.  

 

Being a Do-It-Yourself artist is both challenging yet immensely rewarding. Not only do I have the freedom to record the way I want, nowadays many music lovers want to bypass labels and big corporations to support the artist directly.

However, without the backing of a record label, making this manifest is not an easy mission, nor is it cheap. This introduction will also break down the budget and explain the exact uses of revenue raised. The amount generated will cover the cost of:

  • Recording, arranging, mixing, mastering, artwork, manufacturing and distributing the project (the album + singles). 
  • Professional video clip plus other visual material. 
  • Basic PR & marketing.
  • Indiegogo's fees, as well as creating merch and others.

Now I am inviting you to share this campaign with your friends (via FB, email or the old school 'word of mouth!') Without your support, this project will remain a dream, and every share or other act of support breathes life into the music which I have focussed on for the past years. Your contribution will not only help the whole recording team; it will also make you an essential part of our project. In a way, my community is my record label, and every one of you can have a share in turning this dream into reality simply by pre-ordering this album.

The technical info can be found below, and if you wish to pre-order the album then check on the right side for the amount you wish to choose and the corresponding list of perks.

Thanks a lot!

Richie 

No great project can be done without a team, and I am so fortunate to be working alongside these amazing people who are implementing their talents and their unique backgrounds into this album. 

Engineer – Joshua Rouge

Mix and Master – Matt Dougherty (Megadeth, Disturbed, Staind, Sevendust) and Jared Kvitka (Joe Bonamassa, Iron Maiden, Dream Theatre)

Drums - Chris Brush

All songs will be recorded at Mixit Studios in VA. With such a skilled community around me, I feel more inspired than ever, and continue to challenge myself and push the boundaries of my music.

After the album is complete, it still needs to be released, distributed, and promoted heavily! All of these steps are taken into account to succeed, but the truth is that none of them can happen without first having your support to create this album!

Here is a breakdown of how our budget will be spent on each one of these stages:

We will add new and exciting perks if we surpass the goal of this campaign. I feel more inspired than ever to write better songs, always pushing and challenging myself.

This is only possible if you are a part of it

  • Contributors of this pre-sales campaign get early Access to everything, this includes all the singles and the full record. Get it before anyone else :)
  • Regular updates and 2-way interaction. 
  • Exclusive merchandise designs, not available to anyone else.

Participating is very easy! Buying any of our wonderful perks immediately makes you a backer of this album. And, even if you are unable to donate, you can still help by sharing this campaign with all of your friends and family, or by giving us a shout out in social media!

Let’s talk Perks

There are many options to contribute. If you do not see a perk that you would be interested in, please let me know!. Below are a few of the available perks you can choose:

Personalized cover song recording - I’d be thrilled to record a video cover of your favorite song! Just let us know what you want and we will make sure to give it our own personal twist.

Merch - Specifically designed for this campaign

Downloads - All of my music will be available to you 

Thank you for reading this far! Now that you know all the details about our plans, I would like to officially invite you to join us. I am very proud of everything we have accomplished to get here, and I am so excited for what’s to come!

story:
Malaga is the Samoan word for "journey."

Co-created by Igelese Ete and Jakki Leota-Mua. Malaga is an oceanic multi-movement, choreographed choral celebration, composed by world renowned composer/conductor and musical director Igelese Ete with guests works by other invited pacific composers.

Malaga is a deeply-moving spiritual journey depicting the movement of a people from Hawai’iki to new homelands. For the first time ever, Malaga will be showcased in Los Angeles on Saturday, June 29th, 2019 at El Rey Theatre.

Remaining true to the source – our Atua/God – as well as to the sea, we are inspired by the ancient navigational history of Oceanic peoples.

We then compare these to the stories, emotions and experiences of more recent voyagers taken by our grandparents and parents.

Malaga is hope, in the ever moving present.

Malaga is symbol for our status as ‘visitors.’ For our ‘state’ of in-betweenness. In the ‘Va’/Space. That place connecting this homeland and the last, between this Island and the next.

Some have said it is in our ‘blood to be mobile’. Forever exploring, forever enlarging; our minds, our hearts and our learning into new horizons. Inscribing within us still, the values, ethics, languages and heritage/s to which we will always belong.

Malaga is a metaphor. As individuals from a variety of Pasifika backgrounds, we unite. We know that together as a family/aiga/ohana we will overcome and conquer all challenges in life.

Executive produced by Stratas Media Group (founded by Romeo Spino) and the Ermantourage (founded by Erman Baradi).

 

From the Pacific Musical/Choreographed Choral Celebration "Malaga -The Journey" in 2009, a combined efforts of Aotea College, Viard College & Porirua College from Porirua, Wellington New Zealand.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

-Your support will help with travel and hotel costs for our cast & crew from Fiji! 

-Booking rehearsal time at the venue for our cast and crew to practice prior to the production.

-Promotional campaigns such as publicity, marketing materials, and overall outreach through media.

-Your contributions will not go unnoticed. We will thank all supporters of our the show with producer credits in our programs. Please check out the Perks section for additional information.

The Impact

-We dedicate our performances to climate refugees, who move to new homelands because of climate change causing rising sea levels in the contemporary world. To the people of this land – se’i tulou, tulou, tulou lava! For sanctuary, we thank you.

The show represents the arts and culture of the past and present people of the Pacific Islands.

 

Risks & Challenges

Bringing a culturally relevant show from overseas to America is a challenge in itself. While not everyone in the States will find the culture of the Islands appealing, our goal is to shed light on the heritage of our people.

However, Malaga has found much success in the Pacific since 2009. We understand the value and impact the story and music have on those willing to lend an ear! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Make some noise about the show! This is the first of its kind in Los Angeles!
  • Share the Indiegogo campaign with your friends!

 

 

MEET THE TEAM

IGELESE ETE

Igelese Ete is the Head of Performing Arts at the Oceania Centre for Arts Culture and

Pacific Studies at the University of Pacific, Suva FIJI and was awarded the prestigious

Creative New Zealand Senior Pacific Artist Award for his contribution to the

promotion and performance of Pacific music in New Zealand and the Pacific in 2009.

With extensive conducting, composition, and teaching experience. Ete was the New

Zealand Choirmaster for Peter Jackson’s acclaimed film The Lord of the Rings: The

Fellowship of the Ring, working with the Oscar award-winning composer Howard

Shore and director Sir Peter Jackson.

 

The first ‘Creative Fellow of Pacific Music’ at the SCAPA (School of Creative and

Performing Arts), and was also the coordinator of the Bachelor of Pacific Performing

Arts Degree at the University of Auckland from 2001 to 2004. In 2005 he was

appointed Performance Director of Music at Vision College Christian School of Music

in Hamilton New Zealand and in from 2006-2008 was the Senior Lecturer at USP. Prior

to his position at USP he was the Lecturer & Convener of Pacific Music & Dance at the

University of Auckland, New Zealand.

 

Ete is in demand as a choral clinician, composer and conductor throughout the world

and was invited to present a paper on Pacific Choral Music at World Choral

Symposiums in China, Japan and in South Korea. In 2010 he was contracted to be the

Pacific Entertainment Manager at the World Expo in Shanghai, China at the Pacific

Pavilion.

 

In Fiji he established the ‘Mana Choral Festival 2007 which unites secondary schools

from specific regions, through choral songs/production with the vision to unite

empower and inspire the youth. This has spread out to Samoa, Solomon Islands, and

now looking at Niue and Australia.

 

In 2016 he was contracted as ‘choirmaster’ & music/choral consultant for the latest

Disney animation Moana featuring the talented Pasifika Voices from the Oceania

Centre For Arts Culture and Pacific Studies at the University of the South Pacific.

Ete is currently working on his PhD titled ‘A creative exploration of traditional and

contemporary Samoan musical structures, instrumentation and performance,

expressing genealogy through the realms of self-identity’ which will include a

presentation of his original compositions in a ‘production’.

 

He is very passionate about the Pacific creative and performing arts and its ability to

inspire, empower, educate, and uplift the world.

 

 

PETER ROCKFORD ESPIRITU

 

Peter Rockford Espirirtu is the Founder & Artistic Director of Tau Dance Theater (TDT),

Hawaii’s critically acclaimed professional modern dance company. It is a non-profit

501(c)3 charitable arts organization that reflects the multi-culturalism of Hawai‘i and

Oceania. Established in 1996 TDT continues to respectfully honor the traditional art

forms and ideals of the diverse cultures of the Pacific while setting new standards for a

modern Oceania. Mr. Espiritu has the distinguished privilege of being the only

professional western form dance company based in Honolulu that is directed by an

indigenous Pacific Islander. The topics and ideas that Mr. Espiritu has chosen to be the

impetus of his many works include: cultural awakening through the arts, native identity

and spirituality, responsible fusion and movement vocabulary evolution, ceremony to

stage, and global village awareness in urbanization. Traditional elements as a base help

anchor work to keep cultural connected to our indigenous identity in the face of

increasing western urbanization. The work functions as an artistic mirror that reflects the

impact of what Hawai‘i was, has become, and where it is headed, how it interacts with

other cultures and how that interaction influences movement.

 

This movement-based viewpoint produces specific artistic images that are unique to

Hawaii’s geographical location, Pacific Island culture, and native pluralism. This unique

viewpoint has inspired Mr. Espiritu to create such memorable epic productions such as

2003 - HANAU KA MOKU: An Island is Born dedicated to the new forming island Lo’ihi

which will break water some 25,000 years from now with a monumental collaboration

with traditional hula practitioners Halau O Kekuhi. 2006 NAUPAKA: A Hawaiian Opera, a

full evening length original operetta conceived written and choreographed by Mr.

Espiritu sung entirely in ‘olelo Hawai’i, (Hawaiian language) complete with supertitles.

POLI’AHU: Goddess of Maunakea 2010, dedicated to the goddess Poli’ahu and her

sisters Lilinoe, Waiau and Kalauakolea.

 

In 2011, Mr. Espiritu was appointed as the Artistic Director at the Oceania Centre for

Arts Culture and Pacific Studies at the University of the South Pacific (USP) Laucala

Campus, Suva, Fiji. Mr. Espiritu focused on using his many years as a dancer,

choreographer, and Arts Administrator to benefit USP and the nation of Fiji and its 12

member countries throughout the region. In one year, Mr. Espiritu implemented dance

technique and applied dance curriculum, teaching classes in classical Ballet,

Modern/Contemporary, and Hula. This focus on technique, dance vocabulary, time

management and discipline has raised the level of dance competency, allowing for

growth towards global viability.

 

The focus on regional multi-culturalism and indigenous traditions give the company a

solid foundation to build upon allowing for a new artistic infrastructure to support

cultural fusion, which is what the company has always excelled. Alignment with the

USP strategic plan in direction, focus and vision is key to the success of the programme

and solid leadership as Artistic Director is the balance. Other responsibilities as a

member of the Staff and team of OCACPS and FALE include, serving as Acting Director

of OCACPS, Director of numerous productions, lyricist, grant writer, production

budgets, final reports, and administrative facilitator.

 

Mr. Espiritu returns to Hawaii after the expiration of his contract with USP in 2017 to

resume his inspired journey with fresh eyes of Oceania and south pacific influences.

The Resurrection Gala in 2018 heralded his triumphant return home and HO’INA “To

Return” in March 2019 will be the first Hawai’i production in seven years.

 

JERRY TENGEMOANA

Jerry is a business development specialist with extensive knowledge and experiences in the South Pacific business environment. Jerry has performed in key strategic and advisory roles in different corporate organizations, which he produced innovative and practical solutions and achieve transparent and effective results in cross-cultural teams. With his broad academic and industry background in business administration, economics, executive management, information systems and governance, Jerry is recognized for his business sense and ability to foster networks.

 

ERMAN BARADI

Erman Baradi is a Hollywood event producer deemed a "top networker in Hollywood" in The Huffington Post in 2016, producing events in Los Angeles, Los Angeles, London, Toronto, Chicago, Miami, and Virginia, with over 300 guest speakers in film, television, and music. With his sights set on writing and producing for film and television, Erman began coordinating events as a means to connecting himself to industry names while helping others get connected. In 2018, Erman launched his personal brand Ermantourage to "bridge the creative and conscious," spotlighting special causes such as suicide prevention at his Hollywood panel and mixer events. Erman also co-founded The Film Empire for film and screenplay mentorship contests in which grand prize winners acquire meetings with illustrious lineups. 

Erman was previously featured in The International Business Times, Business Insider, The Virginian Pilot, Voyage LA, Occhi Magazine, Unclear Magazine, ALIST Magazine, among others. He was also on the cover of Voice Magazine in 2019.

As a screenwriter, Erman is managed by Emagine Content and is dedicating 2019 to developing and creating original content.
story_txt:
Malaga is the Samoan word for "journey."
Co-created by Igelese Ete and Jakki Leota-Mua. Malaga is an oceanic multi-movement, choreographed choral celebration, composed by world renowned composer/conductor and musical director Igelese Ete with guests works by other invited pacific composers.
Malaga is a deeply-moving spiritual journey depicting the movement of a people from Hawai’iki to new homelands. For the first time ever, Malaga will be showcased in Los Angeles on Saturday, June 29th, 2019 at El Rey Theatre.
Remaining true to the source – our Atua/God – as well as to the sea, we are inspired by the ancient navigational history of Oceanic peoples.
We then compare these to the stories, emotions and experiences of more recent voyagers taken by our grandparents and parents.
Malaga is hope, in the ever moving present.
Malaga is symbol for our status as ‘visitors.’ For our ‘state’ of in-betweenness. In the ‘Va’/Space. That place connecting this homeland and the last, between this Island and the next.
Some have said it is in our ‘blood to be mobile’. Forever exploring, forever enlarging; our minds, our hearts and our learning into new horizons. Inscribing within us still, the values, ethics, languages and heritage/s to which we will always belong.
Malaga is a metaphor. As individuals from a variety of Pasifika backgrounds, we unite. We know that together as a family/aiga/ohana we will overcome and conquer all challenges in life.
Executive produced by Stratas Media Group (founded by Romeo Spino) and the Ermantourage (founded by Erman Baradi).
 

From the Pacific Musical/Choreographed Choral Celebration "Malaga -The Journey" in 2009, a combined efforts of Aotea College, Viard College & Porirua College from Porirua, Wellington New Zealand.  

What We Need & What You Get
-Your support will help with travel and hotel costs for our cast & crew from Fiji! 
-Booking rehearsal time at the venue for our cast and crew to practice prior to the production.
-Promotional campaigns such as publicity, marketing materials, and overall outreach through media.
-Your contributions will not go unnoticed. We will thank all supporters of our the show with producer credits in our programs. Please check out the Perks section for additional information.

The Impact
-We dedicate our performances to climate refugees, who move to new homelands because of climate change causing rising sea levels in the contemporary world. To the people of this land – se’i tulou, tulou, tulou lava! For sanctuary, we thank you.
The show represents the arts and culture of the past and present people of the Pacific Islands.
 

Risks & Challenges
Bringing a culturally relevant show from overseas to America is a challenge in itself. While not everyone in the States will find the culture of the Islands appealing, our goal is to shed light on the heritage of our people.
However, Malaga has found much success in the Pacific since 2009. We understand the value and impact the story and music have on those willing to lend an ear! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Make some noise about the show! This is the first of its kind in Los Angeles!
Share the Indiegogo campaign with your friends!

  MEET THE TEAMIGELESE ETEIgelese Ete is the Head of Performing Arts at the Oceania Centre for Arts Culture andPacific Studies at the University of Pacific, Suva FIJI and was awarded the prestigiousCreative New Zealand Senior Pacific Artist Award for his contribution to thepromotion and performance of Pacific music in New Zealand and the Pacific in 2009.With extensive conducting, composition, and teaching experience. Ete was the NewZealand Choirmaster for Peter Jackson’s acclaimed film The Lord of the Rings: TheFellowship of the Ring, working with the Oscar award-winning composer HowardShore and director Sir Peter Jackson. The first ‘Creative Fellow of Pacific Music’ at the SCAPA (School of Creative andPerforming Arts), and was also the coordinator of the Bachelor of Pacific PerformingArts Degree at the University of Auckland from 2001 to 2004. In 2005 he wasappointed Performance Director of Music at Vision College Christian School of Musicin Hamilton New Zealand and in from 2006-2008 was the Senior Lecturer at USP. Priorto his position at USP he was the Lecturer & Convener of Pacific Music & Dance at theUniversity of Auckland, New Zealand. Ete is in demand as a choral clinician, composer and conductor throughout the worldand was invited to present a paper on Pacific Choral Music at World ChoralSymposiums in China, Japan and in South Korea. In 2010 he was contracted to be thePacific Entertainment Manager at the World Expo in Shanghai, China at the PacificPavilion. In Fiji he established the ‘Mana Choral Festival 2007 which unites secondary schoolsfrom specific regions, through choral songs/production with the vision to uniteempower and inspire the youth. story:
Hi! We're Mulu Lizi!

We're an alternative rock band from Rochester, NY and we're ready to record our first full length album!

In April, we released our second EP "Men of Fire" on iTunes, Spotify, Amazon MP3, Pandora, and many other sites (you can listen to the "Men of Fire" EP for free HERE). We've also just started working with a licensing company to get our music into TV, movies, and video games. "Men of Fire" has garnered a ton of attention and we've been able to book some amazing shows and festivals because of it.

Over the last couple years, we've talked to thousands of people and realized that you want us to record a full length album as much as we do!

Our EP "Men of Fire" was recorded at Redbooth Studios (Daughtry, Joywave) with sound engineer Brian Moore in Rochester, NY. We love the quality and production that Brian offers and we'll be returning to Redbooth Studios for this album as well.

So we're reaching out to EVERYONE!

Our family, friends, and supporters from all over the world. We'd love for you all to be part of this adventure!

Costs for recording, production, and mixing will run about $1000 per song. And that's not including publishing, distribution, marketing, merchandise, and physical album production costs.

All said and done, this album will probably cost around $10000. That said, we want EVERYONE to hear our new music and you can pre-order your copy now!

Also, if we get more than our goal, we'll be able to add bonus tracks and other extras like music videos and additional merch!

If we don't reach our goal, we will release another EP based on what we can afford to record. We would love to get a full length album released, but another EP would at least get some of our new tunes out to you all.


THE PERKS!!

We've created some solid perks for this campaign. Here are some of the highlights!

  • Steve's Epiphone Les Paul custom and case!  SOLD OUT!
  • Private album release party in Rochester, NY!
  • Name a song off the new album!
  • Private hangout with Mulu Lizi!
  • Signed CD's and memorabilia!
  • Contributor credits on the CD sleeve!
  • Shout outs on social media!


Post production plans:

Once the album is completed, we will publish, promote, and license the works. We've developed connections within the industry that will help us accomplish this.

We'll also create merch based on the new tracks/imagery and if we have enough funds, we'll create new music videos!

All of this will cost a ton and require a lot of effort on our part. We'll be writing, recording, working with the sound engineer to mix/edit/produce. And we'll still be playing gigs as well!


Risks & Challenges:

We are constantly faced with challenges, but we always work through them and grow as a group. If we run into any obstacles, we will find a solution and work our way through them.

Other ways YOU can help:

We understand if you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't be a part of this project!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!
  • Talk to us and make suggestions. We'd love to hear your thoughts!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to promote through social media!

Lastly, we'd like to say thank you to everyone involved in everything we do. This is a dream for us, and you are all making it come true!

story:
My name is Andrew Standley, and my guitar is Alli. We make up the acoustic duo known as Alli and I. Everyone tells their story differently; we tell ours from six strings and a microphone. 

Your contribution goes to:

Mixing and Mastering the album.
Pressing CDs.
Printing T-shirts. (Design under the 'Gallery' Tab)
Printing Posters.
Making Bracelets
Anything else that goes on the merch table.

If we reach our goal, the funds will cover the costs for me to go on tour after the record is out! Please donate; I can't do this without you! 

ALSO: Anyone who donates $50+ is going to get a Hand Pressed (by yours truly, and my mother) Copy of the Album, and  a Hand Written Thank-You Note.

story:
Short Summary

Greetings,
     I'm Ali Bishop. I'm a musician from New York City and I'm putting together a song for the summer for everyone to enjoy. I have my own band and have played across many venues in New York such as: SOB's, The Bitter End, and Santos Party House. I have a desire to make a song and video that everyone can enjoy during the most enjoyable time of the year, THE SUMMER! Who doesn't like to spend time with family and friends when the sun is out and the weather is great? I've decided to use the Funk (yes, it's actually a noun baby!) of the early 80's as the means to express this sentiment, in addition to some other choice ingredients. That's the seed of this song and musical project. Now, one man does not a successful project make! (Dig the Yodanese)
     There are other spectacular people working with me on this project. From Taylor Ryan, producer/engineer extraordinaire, the powerful vocals of Ronnie Walker, the graphic skills of Michael Hanna, and the technical video expertise of Boards Brothers, we have come together to create a quality musical project that anyone can vibe with and support. We have a song that we feel is quality, and we are looking to promote it in an equal fashion. There will be some challenges to making this project a success. Almost all deal with money, or having the right amount of it. We have industry connections that can assist us in marketing and promotion, unfortunately those services require substantial payment in order to utilize them. In order to do so we need funds, funds we do not have. We have the blood sweat and tears. We can cover the rest. We are looking to you to help with the remaining obstacles by contributing to our economic goal so we can give this song the proper support and push it requires and deserves.

Here's a quick breakdown:
-Song Mastering/Finalizing ($500)
-Indoor Video Location ($1,000-1,500)
-Video Casting-25-40 people ($1,000)
-Post Production ($1500)
-Press Promotion Materials/Merchandise ($1,000)
-PR [Press Release, Video & Radio Placement, Press coverage,etc.] ($5000)
We will provide project contributors with progress reports, and videos, as we move forward. You will be able to see where your money is going, and what is happening to it.

Do you like good music?
Do you like live music (actual instruments)?
Will you help us?
Will you tell a friend (use the Indiegogo share tools)?

We hope so. Better music makes for a better place for all of us. Helping us says you agree.
With respect and humility,
Ali Bishop

story:
Singer/DIY musician/traveling gypsy working hard to write, record, release, promote & book myself for 5 years now. As some of you may know, I just self distributed & released my full length debut album "Shake the Dust" on iTunes.  

It's been a whirlwind but I'm so thankful for all your kind words & support.  I'm even more excited to announce the "Shake the Dust" tour! I will be kicking it off in LA Feb 11th & heading to Austin, Houston, Dallas, Phoenix, & over to the East Coast for some dates as well. It is truly an amazing opportunity for me to put my music out there & be seen and heard by a variety of different audiences in places I've never been. I'm looking forward to serenading every single city I can get to & I believe this is where I should be and what I should be doing. 

Touring is hands down one of my favorite experiences, but it also can be tough. Especially when the travel expenses, living accommodations, gas, food, etc are all self funded. So I'm asking for your help. Please don't feel obligated, I appreciate any & all support - a little bit goes a very long way. For those of you who can't I totally understand, trust me.  For those of you who can, your support honestly means the world and I couldn't be more grateful that you believe in me. Thank you.

Stay gold. Xo.

Megan B

story:
Summary

Urbanite Collective is a graphic design firm that provides an outlet for urban artists to express themselves, their artwork, and their ideas. Not only do we design graphics and publications, we coordinate local events to help foster the art communities in the Tampa Bay area.

Our campaign is to raising money for our event, Defected Abstract. It is an event where the local music, art, and fashion scenes in Tampa can conjugate in a centralize place. This campaign is important because it will showcase local artists’ and designers’ work in the area, it will unite smaller art communities into a cultural movement, and it will build community support for the arts and increase tourism.

By contributing to the campaign, you’ll actively help local artists expose their work to larger audience, provide funding for local community events, and provide tourism attraction to the Tampa Bay area.

What We Need + What You Get

Currently, we are raising $2000 for the event. The money we raise will go to equipment for musical performance, advertising for the event, local artist’s merchandise, and to the people who helped volunteer for the event.

When you contribute to the campaign, you’ll receive this Event T-shirt. As you contribute more,  or if you pledge the maximum, you will receive a swag bag from the event plus your name in the program and announcement.

If we do not reach our goals, the money that is donated will still go towards the event and we will match the remainder. 


Impact

This campaign is important and valuable because it promotes local artists and designers in the Tampa Bay area. It will inspire and encourage fresh, new artists to showcase their artwork. It will motivate the art communities in Tampa to come together and support one another.

Previous small, art events created a small buzz and piqued small, but significant interested. With this campaign, our aim is to reach a bigger audience.

Ways You Can Help

There are ways you can help our campaign. You can share our link with friends and family. Like our Facebook page, and follow us on twitter and Instagram. If you are in the Tampa Bay area, come see the event at Green Iguana Ybor City, 1708 East 7th Ave., Tampa, FL 33605.
story_txt:

provides an outlet for urban artists to express themselves, their artwork, and
their ideas. Not only do we design graphics and publications, we coordinate
local events to help foster the art communities in the Tampa Bay area.
Our
campaign is to raising money for our event, Defected Abstract. It is an event
where the local music, art, and fashion scenes in Tampa can conjugate in a
centralize place. This campaign is important because it will showcase local
artists’ and designers’ work in the area, it will unite smaller art communities
into a cultural movement, and it will build community support for the arts and
increase tourism.

story:
My album will not be just for the Foreigners.. :)

Michaela Rexová started music when she was a young girl. After conservatory she started write her own songs. She recorded a song about White skirt with red points in a home-studio. Story about the skirt is little ironical. The main idea is how people are depended on material things. And when something happend to them (skirt got small after washing) they got very upset. The song White skirt can be much more better if Michaela have a possibility to record it in a profesional studio. You can watch the music video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sg9ZD2CGRXo


After this song Michaela decided to record her first music album. Album‘s name will be Foreign. Becouse she is living in a foreign country.


About my album

On the album, there will be 6 to 10 songs. They all will be connected with foreign theme. Michaela first wants to record the song with the name Autumn Song. Sure it must be about love. Autumn is used just like metaphors for the period of love when people feel, that their love is reaching to end. Lets see how this story will finish when the song will be ready.

One of the next songs will be Small Sad Star. It´s o dynamical song about a friendship and loneliness. Everybody feel lonely sometimes even they have many people around. This song will be about the deep feelings of the singer. Refren of this song will make everybody love it!

One of the songs will have the name Foreigner as the album name. This song will be based on a dance music. Song will tell, the distance to stars is less then the distance between people that they don't understand each other. It can happen also to you, if you are foreign.

Me

Michaela Rexová is a young woman from Slovakia. She studied in Bratislava in conservatory. Later she finished Musicology and in now she is preparing to study History of Art in Ankara, Turkey.

Michaela have lot of dreams. And slowly they are becoming true. Last year she played in a horror movie called Reminiscence. This movie got an award in a Italian film festival. Because of her big potensial, fantasy and talent, Michaela is the right girl for the music sector. Only if you support her and give her a chance!


Links

Facebook: Facebook page

Songs: My songs on youtube 


Risks & Challenges

Dont worry, there will be no real risk involved in this project.:) . I'll do my best with your support and then I will also support the people that needs help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can share my social media links.
  • Tell about my campaign.

story:
Short Summary

Cocktail Time, a universal concept to unwind after work now has its own anthem!
Written in the style of the Great American Songbook with sly humor and a swing beat, Marcus Dagan's composition "Cocktail Time"  will be filmed as a music video at the famous Da Mimmo Italian Restaurant on High Street in Baltimore's Little Italy. Our most generous supporters will have the chance to savor the dishes of "Maryland's Best Chef" and be a part of the Happy Crowd at the bar. It will be filmed by Duane Edward Sanchez who is garnering a great reputation for his music video and theater work in Baltimore, Denver and New York.

What We Need & What You Get

Our budget breaks down as follows

Filming Costs including: Direction/equipment/audio/

data storage/titles/color correction/formatting/logging/editing/ 

post  production work                                                             $1800.00

Recording Studio Time                                                            $  300.00

Music licensing Fee                                                                   $  300.00

Musician Appearance Fee                                                       $  400.00

Writer Fee                                                                                    $  400.00

Director/Producer Fee                                                             $  300.00

                                                                                   Total           $3500.00


The Impact

We aim to create a fun visual experience with an international flavor
of a universal theme: Unwinding after work.

Risks & Challenges.

We honestly see no risks in creating this, the song is written, the musicians are rehearsed, the venue is perfect and the world is waiting!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi. My name is Ava and I am 10-years-old. I was inspired to write this song after a trip to Kenya that I took in 2013 with my mom and dad. We went with the amazing charity Free The Children as part of their Me to We program, and learned all about the Maasai people and how the charity's Adopt a Village program is helping them. 

The children there are so excited to go to school - and I want to help more of them get to go, especially the girls who often have to skip school to work and help their families. My dream is to raise enough money to build a school, and that's why I'm sharing my song with you. I hope you like it! 

Here are a few facts that might interest - and surprise - you:

  • More than 120 million children around the world are denied the basic right to an education.
  • Education ensures that children learn valuable skills that help them grow, protect themselves from disease, earn a better living and understand their rights to ensure they’re never exploited.
  • In many places around the world, schools simply don’t exist or are in no condition for teaching and learning.
  • About 58 million primary school-aged children are not in school, and 31 million of them are girls. Without an education, these children, their families, and their communities cannot break the cycle of poverty.
A huge thank you to everyone who donates! Brick by brick, we can build a school! Check out the gallery tab for photos from my trip and other great stuff.

#avasingsforafrica

story:
Short Summary

One A-Chord is a band of working musician's who have full support from our families and are looking for your support to pursue our passion for creating/playing music to provide positive influence to this world. We have been given an opportunity to go on a 2 week tour this Spring and understand that it takes more than just playing music on stage. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for your support to reach a goal of $3000.00. These funds will help us pay: 

  • Transportation (15 passenger van) with trailer.
  • Fuel to cover 3,000 mi. (with these ridiculous fuel prices...)
  • Lodging every night of the tour. (Total of 10 nights and 11 days)
  • Food with a per diem of $10 a meal for 6 band members.
  • Miscellaneous cost (i.e. Mechanical costs, Insurance, Equipment repair)

The Impact

Like most working musician's, we all have jobs. But, the biggest impact is with our wives and children at home. Your support would help take the financial burden away from our family and the time we need to take away from our jobs.

On another note, your support will help build a bigger fan base. Your support will help us take our music outside of our hometown and share the music across the nation. 

Risks & Challenges

You can say that we are going into this challenge blindfolded, because we don't know the full benefit of going on tour. But, with your support we will at least be confident that our finances will be taken care of as we pursue a greater success in our music career. 

This campaign is a risk for us because we have never made ourselves this vulnerable, but the risk is well worth the reward. The learning experience we will achieve by doing this campaign will be far greater than not knowing the outcome of the risk we take. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can support us financially. So, if that is you, would you please help us by sharing this campaign with all the "Sharing Tools" Indiegogo.com has available. 

Another way we can use your help is also by word of mouth. Sometimes we forget the simple things in life. But, wherever you go, whoever you see, please let them know that One A-Chord is looking for their support here at www.indiegogo.com. 

All information for our tour can also be found at www.facebook.com/oneachord831

story:
Scenic Rhythms is a DIY Cassette/Cd label based out of Chicago, IL. We specialize in limited edition runs of physical merchandise. Each tape/cd is crafted to the artists needs and liking. We have been in the game since May 2013 and we’re still pushing.

We are trying to raise money to secure our venue space during SXSW. We launched our cassette tape fundraiser a week ago and now we need a little extra push to get us to our target goal. This fundraiser is important because it will open a lot of doors for not only the artists, but for Scenic Rhythms as well. It will also help Scenic Rhythms be able to give back financially to the artists who are performing that night. We’re all about giving back and remembering that we all are artists ourselves and to be able to get something back during SXSW would be amazing.

Donating to our campaign will help with so much. It will secure our space, allow us to pay the artists for their time as well as have some more perks at the show. Every dollar goes a long way and will help us out tremendously.


Our over all goal is $1700. $1200 is to secure our space and the other $500 is the damages fee for the venue. When we’ve hit our target goal the rest of the funds will be used to getting the t-shirts and a few more batches of tapes.

We’ve got a special T-shirt that was designed for Scenic Rhythms by our founder iNDiG0HiGH. They’re created from Print All Over Me and are good quality shirts. We have a cassette tape that has our lineup’s music on it, tracks in total. You can either get the tape by itself, the shirt by itself, or you can get both in a package.

If we don’t reach our goal, then the funds will go towards pressing the tapes and shirts.


The value in being able to perform during SXSW is so big. It’s a huge networking opportunity and can open a lot of doors for multiple things to happen. All Scenic Rhythms wants to do is maximize the opportunity and make sure the artists get paid from it. From the research that has been obtained, not a lot of artists get a paid show during SXSW and paying to play is wack. We’re setting up a platform for artists to make money and do what they love. Hopefully people will grasp that we aren’t like the rest and strive to be better and different in every way possible.

This is our first time hosting an event like this, and hopefully it won’t be the last.

We’re passionate about the artists that are on this bill and really want to make this event happen. For some this will probably be the only performance they have and we want to make it count in a huge way. So please help us, help them.


We’ve put a lot of time and energy into making sure that we have a secure place to play and a good quality product that sets us apart from everyone else. Cassette tapes are definitely on a slow comeback track, but over all it’s a form of art. Selling cassettes are a little difficult, but I can guarantee that the product is good. We just need that extra cushion to make this a reality for everyone involved.

All we can do is push ourselves to the max with this one. We’ve put our hearts and souls into the music and products that you see, so hopefully you’ll see that and would love to help. We really appreciate everything.


Our bandcamp page is also set up with the cassette tapes and t-shirts so if you want you can send people here: https://scenicrhythms.bandcamp.com/album/sxsw-2015-compilation

Please make sure you share our indiegogo page. Every share counts as something, even if you can’t donate.


Artists who are performing:

Uncle EL

Irregular Expression

soundcloud.com/irrex


Jade Ivy
soundcloud.com/jade-ivy

Real Cosby

soundcloud.com/real-cosby

LEWK

soundcloud.com/iamlewk


Flamingosis

https://soundcloud.com/flamingosis

story:
My new album is in the works! 

Greetings friends!

This album is a vision into my inner world where melody reigns supreme, vocals soar over lush horn and string arrangements. A piano melts us, as classical guitar rises up our spine and a choir shakes the rest of our bones. 
My vocally-driven music has elements of folk, funk, blues and jazz but also contains something new, undefined and I hope you find the result very moving.


The Album Recording Process

I am utilizing my skills as producer and mixing engineer, working with an assistant engineer and co-producer for the studio sessions. I have the opportunity to work with a very talented vocal coach,  Raz Kennedy (vocalist for Bobby Mcferrin, Al Jarreau, Carlos Santana, etc.) and I'm planning to feature the great hammond B3 player, Melvin Seals (Jerry Garcia Band, JGB) as well as many other incredibly talented musicians on the album!

I hope you are as excited as I am for that moment when the mastered version is done and it hits our ears, but I can't get their without your help!

 -Nigel Ravenwind


What is the inspiration for this new music?

Many of us have felt disenchanted by the culture we grew up in. The overload of sense gratification and consumerism gone rampant takes a toll on our well being. 

Yet, it is impossible to be separate from the Earth when everything around us, originates first from her!

Mother nature not only sustains, but she also destroys and gives birth anew. We have to let things die and re-birth in order to create balance in our works, not just sustain them. The primary disease in this era of "Too Big to Fail" is not making that connection to the cycles and presence of the earth around us. That's why I call this album "The Great Re-Enchantment." I feel its most important to be re-enchanted by her endless offerings of well-being and balance. When we are in tune with the cycles of nature, its easier to feel connected to our passion and the heart of our being. 

My music is a prayer, vocalizing and wishing that anyone who hears this music, is aided in their return to right relationship with the earth.

Music helps us fortify our inherent medicine and carry it into our lives and onwards into the lives of our relatives, loved ones, and greater community.

By supporting this album, you are also supporting a team of independent musicians and production team as well as the further flowering of similar musical works to come! 



Where will my contribution go?


I'm contributing a lot of my personal funds to make sure the album is finished, whether or not I make the full goal of this campaign. All of the pre-production (studio demo recordings and charts) is now complete, but I need your help to make this album!

Here, I will break down the expenses for you...

Production Expenses:

  • $6000 Musician session rates (5 musicians paid $100/song plus addt. expenses including rehearsals)
  • $4200 Studio Rental - 9 days at $450/day plus assistant (Prairie Sun and Laughing Tiger Studios)
  • $1200 Pressing and Printing 1,000 hard copies of CD's
  • $900 Recycled paper sleeves
  • $1000 Mastering Engineer (w/ Paul Mahern - mastering engineer for John Mellencamp, Willie Nelson, Neil Young etc...)
  • $500 Co-producer sessions (5+ sessions)
  • $400 Vocal coaching (8 sessions)
  • $350 Album graphics and design

Promotional Expenses:
  • $1000 Spectacular new artist promotional website
  • $200 Professional photography shoot for promotions
  • $200 Online Album promotion design (graphics for web promotion)
  • $500 For initial album release marketing expenses, advertisements
  • $500 Fulfilling cost of Perks


The Impact of the Album

This project is a contribution to the legacy and ongoing story of songwriters who took courage to bring their own voice forward, against the status quo, the noise and predictable produced music that has flooded the airwaves. I pray that my lyrics and melodies make someone's day better. These lyrics are from the core...following my journey through the last 5 years of my life...love lost, painful failures and joyful successes, remembering such a deep love for Mother Earth, all her medicines and finding a sacred place here. I want this music-as-medicine to go out to the world now! With the proper support, I can make a really powerful impact on both the young and the old. I'm also continuing to propel my career forward as a songwriter, performer, and recording engineer in one swoop... So thanks for supporting that!



Biography

Nigel Wolovick is a songwriter, multi-instrumentalist, and a recording engineer with an intention to bring the most soul-soothing, heart-warming music to this earth. He started with extensive training in jazz and opera vocals when he was in high school...and first got hired for performances when he was 13, sitting in with Jazz Vocalist, Krisanthi Pappas. Nigel was a finalist in the Essentially Ellington festival (Lincoln Center, NYC) for 3 consecutive years, playing tenor saxophone and clarinet, and he notably contributed to his band earning  Best Sax Section honor awards.
He wrote his first arrangement for full concert band when he was 16 and received the Louis Armstrong award for his excellence in Jazz studies (an award usually given to only one student per year.) He went on to attend the University of Connecticut Opera program, as well as additional training in Jazz Studies at the New England Conservatory. 

 

Nigel leads a parallel life as a recording  engineer and live sound engineer, starting with several internships at Peter Kontrimas (PBS), Saucer Sound, Jah Levi (Theocratic Records) and with mastering engineer Tim Gennert (Grateful Dead releases.)  He currently has 15 years of experience with live sound engineering and over 5 years of professional recording and mixing engineering. His list of sound clients includes:

  • The Wood Brothers
  • KRS-One
  • Katchafire
  • Charlie Musselwhite
  • Charles Neville
  • The Abyssinians 
  • T Sisters
  • Nahko and Medicine for the People
  • The Waybacks 
  • Hamsa Lila
  • Ayla Nereo
  • Tribal Seeds

After working for years in concert venues, in 2011 He decided to start and run his current music production company, Ravenwind Sound. 

As a performer, Nigel has been a member of many bands, including most notably The Uplifters, 2Adam12, The Mystic Jammers, Zo Tobi Band and Web of One. He also founded Jazz Mosaic, a jazz ensemble that played throughout New England in the early 2000s.

( sample album art image )

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this page with everyone you think appreciates original music, patrons of the arts, and those with talents they can contribute to this campaign! Help get the word out there. Stay posted for my upcoming CD release events in Marin/East Bay and Sebastopol, CA.
story_txt:
My new album is in the works! 





Greetings friends!
This album is a vision into my inner world where melody reigns supreme, vocals soar over lush horn and string arrangements. A piano melts us, as classical guitar rises up our spine and a choir shakes the rest of our bones. 


My vocally-driven music has elements of folk, funk, blues and jazz but also contains something new, undefined and I hope you find the result very moving.




The Album Recording ProcessI am utilizing my skills as producer and mixing engineer, working with an assistant engineer and co-producer for the studio sessions. I have the opportunity to work with a very talented vocal coach,  Raz Kennedy (vocalist for Bobby Mcferrin, Al Jarreau, Carlos Santana, etc.) and I'm planning to feature the great hammond B3 player, Melvin Seals (Jerry Garcia Band, JGB) as well as many other incredibly talented musicians on the album!
I hope you are as excited as I am for that moment when the mastered version is done and it hits our ears, but I can't get their without your help!
 -Nigel Ravenwind




What is the inspiration for this new music?
Many of us have felt disenchanted by the culture we grew up in. The overload of sense gratification and consumerism gone rampant takes a toll on our well being. 
Yet, it is impossible to be separate from the Earth when everything around us, originates first from her!
Mother nature not only sustains, but she also destroys and gives birth anew. We have to let things die and re-birth in order to create balance in our works, not just sustain them. The primary disease in this era of "Too Big to Fail" is not making that connection to the cycles and presence of the earth around us. That's why I call this album "The Great Re-Enchantment." I feel its most important to be re-enchanted by her endless offerings of well-being and balance. When we are in tune with the cycles of nature, its easier to feel connected to our passion and the heart of our being. My music is a prayer, vocalizing and wishing that anyone who hears this music, is aided in their return to right relationship with the earth.

Music helps us fortify our inherent medicine and carry it into our lives and onwards into the lives of our relatives, loved ones, and greater community.By supporting this album, you are also supporting a team of independent musicians and production team as well as the further flowering of similar musical works to come! 





Where will my contribution go?


 I'm contributing a lot of my personal funds to make sure the album is finished, whether or not I make the full goal of this campaign. All of the pre-production (studio demo recordings and charts) is now complete, but I need your help to make this album!

$500 Co-producer sessions (5+ sessions)
$400 Vocal coaching (8 sessions)
$350 Album graphics and design


Promotional Expenses:


$1000 Spectacular new artist promotional website

$200 Professional photography shoot for promotions
$200 Online Album promotion design (graphics for web promotion)
$500 For initial album release marketing expenses, advertisements
$500 Fulfilling cost of Perks


   


The Impact of the Album This project is a contribution to the legacy and ongoing story of songwriters who took courage to bring their own voice forward, against the status quo, the noise and predictable produced music that has flooded the airwaves. I pray that my lyrics and melodies make someone's day better. These lyrics are from the core...following my journey through the last 5 years of my life...love lost, painful failures and joyful successes, remembering such a deep love for Mother Earth, all her medicines and finding a sacred place here. I want this music-as-medicine to go out to the world now! With the proper support, I can make a really powerful impact on both the young and the old. I'm also continuing to propel my career forward as a songwriter, performer, and recording engineer in one swoop... So thanks for supporting that!

His list of sound clients includes:


The Wood Brothers
KRS-One
Katchafire
Charlie Musselwhite
Charles Neville
The Abyssinians 
T Sisters
Nahko and Medicine for the People
The Waybacks 
Hamsa Lila
Ayla Nereo

Tribal Seeds


After working for years in concert venues, in 2011 He decided to start and run his current music production company, Ravenwind Sound. As a performer, Nigel has been a member of many bands, including most notably The Uplifters, 2Adam12, The Mystic Jammers, Zo Tobi Band and Web of One. He also founded Jazz Mosaic, a jazz ensemble that played throughout New England in the early 2000s.

story:
About The Jons:

We would like to first off thank you all for taking the time to check this out!  As a band from a small border town in Arizona, embarking on completing our 4th studio album, we are excited for what's to come in our next musical endeavor, and we hope you'll enjoy the ride with us.

We are a band of childhood friends that formed strong bonds over musical influences of the early and mid 90's era, both american and latin based.  As we continued on our musical path, a few different bands formed one foundation in 2000 as The Jons.

We completed our debut album, Wine at the Hilltop, in the fall of 2002 and kept busy playing at many of the popular bars and venues around Tucson, Arizona.  After a successful West Coast tour, with our blazing horn section and ability to rock in both English and Spanish at any given moment, we began to attract bigger venues and audiences.  

Along the way in the last 15 years, we have had the greatest pleasure of playing shows with the likes of The English Beat, The Dismemberment Plan, The Gin Blossoms, Seether, Roger Clyne and The Peacemakers, Oh My God; as well as international acts such as El TRI, Alex Lora, FOBiA, Alejandro Marcovich of Caifanes, Cafe Tacuba, KINKY, Los Amigos Invicibles, Babasonicos, Nortec Collective, Resorte, Molotov, Julieta Venegas, Jarabe de Palo, Aleks Syntek, Alejandra Guzman, and Enanitos Verdes. 

With a current line-up of 7 members, we have  an arsenal of original music that we are looking to get completed to share with the world.  We can't wait to continue our journey, and we hope you'll help us along the way!


The Details:

For our 4th studio album, we are looking to finish the overall production.  The funding we raise will be used to complete the album recording, mixing, as well as mastering.  From there, we will be able to create artwork to order a special mix of CD's, Vinyl Records, and digital music to share with the world.  We are really excited about the options IndieGoGo presents musicians for giving back to our supporters.  Please check out the perks provided!


The Impact

The impact you'll be able to have is immeasurable.  We play music out of sheer love and passion for the art, and we would like to continue to share it with the world.  This will be our most complete and intricate album to date, mixing a range of genres and and sounds that are unique to our interpretation of our musical influence.  Your help, will allow us to complete that dream!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help.  If a contribution is just plain out of reach for you, please spread the word to your friends and family who love music!  IndieGoGo has some very simple sharing tools that you can use to spread the word.

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you for all your consideration and help, and we can't wait for you to hear the fruits of our labor!!

- The Jons

story:
THE DECISION OF THE MADE IN FRANCE

NICOLE JOËL is a recent brand of luxurious leather goods that has taken the decision of the « Made in France ».

Only first-choice leathers from the best french tanneries are selected.

Our bags fabricant is a young leather worker (an art craftsman) who worked for renowned brands like Jean-Paul Gaultier or Nina Ricci, as well as young creators.


A TIMELESS COLLECTION

A first timeless and stylish collection is proposed.

The leather choice is one of its main originalities.

Two-tone soft full grain calf leather treated on both sides, with a black outside and a contrasted color like red, green or blue inside. This choice avoids an inner lining and makes the bag lighter.

DESIGNS

Photograph emphasizes the marking. It can be removed on demand. 

We will contact you about the color at the end of the production.

Beatrice's bag big size
It suits to trips in town as well as job meetings.
It allows to bring everyday life stuffs, like a computer or files.

Size : 35 cm of width, 26 cm height and 15 cm of depth
Hand-carried bag or shoulder bag
Small handbag with an Excella zipper, 20 cm long and  17 cm from top.


Mini Soraya's bag
A « mini » version of Soraya’s bag that suits to trips in town or parties.

Size : 25 cm of width, 15 cm height and 9 cm of depth
Hand-carried bag or shoulder bag or cross over with a golden chain supplied with the bag
Small handbag with an Excella zipper, 11 cm long and 9 cm from top.



Layla's handbag
Thanks to its chain it can be turned into a bag

Size : 17 cm of width, 20 cm height and 1 cm of depth
Hand-carried bag or shoulder bag or cross over with a golden chain supplied with the bag
Excella’s zipper locking.



Fund raising's objective and how you can help us

15,000 Euros
Development  of new designs :  4,000 Euros
Exhibitions :  6,000 Euros
Web site : 5,000 Euros



LE CHOIX DU MADE IN FRANCE


NICOLE JOËL est une jeune marque de maroquinerie de luxe, qui a fait le pari du Made in France.

Nous utilisons exclusivement des cuirs de premier choix en provenance des meilleures tanneries françaises.   Notre façonnier est un jeune maître maroquinier artisan d’art, qui travaille aussi bien pour des marques de renom comme Jean Paul Gaultier ou Nina Ricci, que pour des jeunes créateurs.

UNE COLLECTION INTEMPORELLE


Nous proposons une première collection intemporelle et élégante.   L’une de ses principales originalités est le choix du cuir.
Veau pleine fleur aspect bicolore, traité sur les deux faces, extérieur noir, intérieur d’une couleur contrastée, rouge, vert, bleu…Ce qui évite la doublure et rend le sac plus léger. 


LES MODÈLES


La taille du marquage est accentuée sur la photo.  Lors de la production finale, il est possible de supprimer le marquage. 

Nous vous contacterons à la fin de la campagne pour le choix de la couleur.




Sac Béatrice grande taille
Il s’adaptera aussi bien à vos sorties en ville, qu’à vos rendez-vous de travail.
Il permettra de contenir différents objets du quotidien, ordinateur, fichier…

Dimensions 35 cm de large, 26 cm de haut, 15 cm de profondeur,
porté main ou épaule,
pochette de séparation avec zip Excella, longueur 20 cm, hauteur 17 cm.




Sac Soraya petite taille
Version «mini » du modèle Soraya, pour vos sorties en villes et vos soirées. 

dimensions 20 cm de large, 15 cm de haut, 9 cm de profondeur,
porté main, épaule, ou croisé, bandoulière en chaîne dorée fournie,
pochette de séparation avec zip Excella, longueur 11 cm, hauteur 9 cm.






Pochette Layla
Grâce à sa chaîne, elle pourra se transformer en sac.

dimensions 17 cm de large, 20 cm de haut, 1 cm de profondeur,
porté main, épaule, ou croisé, bandoulière en chaine dorée,
fermeture par zip Excella





Le but de la collecte et comment nous aider

15,000 Euros
Développement de nouveaux modèles :  4,000 Euros
Salons : 6,000 Euros
Site internet :  5,000 Euros

story:
I grew up in Droxford a small rural village in Hampshire with only 700 souls. 

I am a self-taught guitarist and pianist who has pushed myself to learn the rudiments and theory of music as well as to perform. Certain life events have formed me and inspired me to write music and lyrics and makes me even more grateful to be in the position I am in.

This campaign is the start of my new sound and direction and I need to raise £1650 to make my record, to get it manufactured, released and distributed. 

The money raised will also help cover the cost of musicians, rehearsal room hire, studio time and production staff. Any funds raised above target will go towards my world premiere performance and EP launch gig at The Droxford Village Hall. A place close to my heart and my fan base.

I will not be able to do this without your help. £5 or £10 would be amazing but even  £1 would help make a difference. 

I have all kinds of unique and amazing perks to offer in return for your contributions ranging from:

*Downloads

*USB flash drives

*Handwritten lyrics

*Bespoke songs written to order

*House Concerts

*The chance to sit in on the final mix at the studio

*And VIP tickets to the World Premiere launch gig.

If for any reason I do not manage to reach my target I will endeavour to make the best record I can with the funds raised.

This is your chance to get involved and make a real and tangible difference.

This will not be easy I know, I will face many obstacles along the way but with the support of the team at Fan Funded and the crew at Wallops Wood Studios I now really have the confidence that I can pull this off. 

I am so excited about the new direction my music is heading in and I cannot wait to get it out there.

If you can't contribute financially that doesn't mean you can't help. 

Please spread the word using Indiegogo's share tools, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Tumblr. Help me drive awareness to this campaign which only has a month to run.

Thank you for taking the time to watch and read. I hope to see you at Droxford Village Hall in May.

Lots of love, Sasha X
