story:
Hello everyone! I am a seventeen year old girl with a dream and YOU can make it come true. 

My name is Christina Lee and I am currently in Year 11, attending Cairns State High School. I am very passionate about human rights and bettering the lives of people around me, one day I dream of working as an international human rights lawyer.

If someone asked, why do you want to devote your entire life for that? I always answer with, "There is some girl or boy around the globe, perhaps the same age as me, and they have a dream, just like I do. But their dreams only remain a dream unless somebody around the world walks in to their life. And that's why, I, too want to be that somebody." 


I believe there is nothing more precious than receiving opportunities, and this year, I have received the opportunity to finally put my hopes and dreams into action.
I have been selected as one of the 16 senior students across Australia to attend the United Nation's Youth Aotearoa Leadership tour.
I have been involved in United Nations Youth conferences for the past two years, acquiring knowledge of how to raise awareness of the issues that are often silenced. I write articles in my local newspaper, participate in competitive debating and public speaking competitions with topics that specifically allow the audience to be informed of people who are less privileged than us. I aspire to reach more and more students like myself and give them the courage and inspiration to become the 'voice' for people with dreams who we can work for and make them come true. 

What is the ALT? 

ALT is one of UN Youth’s flagship programs and consists of 16 outstanding senior high school students from across the nation who have made it through a tough interview and selection process to earn their place on the Tour. ALT has two principal aims: to build awareness and understanding of the issues Indigenous peoples face at home and abroad; and to inspire young leaders and help them develop the necessary skills to take action on these issues in their communities. This is especially relevant due to the expected referendum on the recognition of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders in the Australian Constitution.  
I will be travelling across Melbourne and New Zealand along with 15 other like-minded students from Australia! 

What I Need & What You Get

Any assistance you may give will be incredibly helpful in helping me finance this incredible educational experience. The price for attendance on the Tour is $2300. In addition, each participant is expected to have a laptop for research and drafting resolutions, as well as appropriate clothes for winter in New Zealand and business attire for NZ MUN. As such, your sponsorship can help me get the most out of ALT.


From your help, I will be able to receive - 

The opportunity to meet with high-ranking Australian and New Zealand representatives and gain insight into how both Australia and New Zealand have developed political institutions to help find solutions to Indigenous issues.

The opportunity to critically engage with the complexities of Indigenous issues at home and abroad while simultaneously cultivate writing and research skills.

The chance to discuss issues of international concern on a global stage, and engage with some of the region's brightest young minds, from a myriad of different cultures.

An international forum in which to cultivate and develop public speaking and diplomatic skills, by working together with delegates representing vastly different views to achieve a common solution.

The ability to bring back the experience they have gained, and use it to take a larger role in the community.  Previous members of UN Youth have gone on to play key roles in community groups and youth organisations, and many describe ALT as one of the most influential experiences of their lives.

And make my dream come true of attending the tour. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you could please share this page with your friends, parents, teachers or anyone who can, and please know it would mean the world to me. 

Any amount of sponsorship will greatly assist me to participate in this life-changing experience.
story_txt:
Hello everyone! I am a seventeen year old girl with a dream and YOU can make it come true. 
My name is Christina Lee and I am currently in Year 11, attending Cairns State High School. I am very passionate about human rights and bettering the lives of people around me, one day I dream of working as an international human rights lawyer.
If someone asked, why do you want to devote your entire life for that? I always answer with, "There is some girl or boy around the globe, perhaps the same age as me, and they have a dream, just like I do. But their dreams only remain a dream unless somebody around the world walks in to their life. And that's why, I, too want to be that somebody." 

I believe there is nothing more precious than receiving opportunities, and this year, I have received the opportunity to finally put my hopes and dreams into action.

I have been selected as one of the 16 senior students across Australia to attend the United Nation's Youth Aotearoa Leadership tour.
I have been involved in United Nations Youth conferences for the past two years, acquiring knowledge of how to raise awareness of the issues that are often silenced. I write articles in my local newspaper, participate in competitive debating and public speaking competitions with topics that specifically allow the audience to be informed of people who are less privileged than us. I aspire to reach more and more students like myself and give them the courage and inspiration to become the 'voice' for people with dreams who we can work for and make them come true. 

What is the ALT? 

ALT
is one of UN Youth’s flagship programs and consists of 16 outstanding senior
high school students from across the nation who have made it through a tough
interview and selection process to earn their place on the Tour. ALT has two
principal aims: to build awareness and understanding of the issues Indigenous
peoples face at home and abroad; and to inspire young leaders and help them
develop the necessary skills to take action on these issues in their
communities. This is especially relevant
due to the expected referendum on the recognition of Aboriginal and Torres
Strait Islanders in the Australian Constitution.  

I will be travelling across Melbourne and New Zealand along with 15 other like-minded students from Australia! 

What I Need & What You Get

Any
assistance you may give will be incredibly helpful in helping me finance this
incredible educational experience. The price for attendance on the Tour is $2300. In addition, each participant is expected to have a laptop for
research and drafting resolutions, as well as appropriate clothes for winter in
New Zealand and business attire for NZ MUN. As such, your sponsorship can help
me get the most out of ALT.
   From your help, I will be able to receive -  
The opportunity to
meet with high-ranking Australian and New Zealand representatives and gain insight into how
both Australia and New Zealand have developed political institutions to help
find solutions to Indigenous issues.
The opportunity to
critically engage with the complexities of Indigenous issues at home and abroad
while
simultaneously cultivate writing and research skills.
The chance to discuss
issues of international concern on a global stage, and engage with some of the
region's brightest young minds, from a myriad of different cultures.
An international forum
in which to cultivate and develop public speaking and diplomatic skills, by working together
with delegates representing vastly different views to achieve a common
solution.


The ability to bring
back the experience they have gained, and use it to take a larger role in the
community.  Previous members of UN Youth have
gone on to play key roles in community groups and youth organisations, and many
describe ALT as one of the most influential experiences of their lives.
And make my dream come true of attending the tour. 


    Other Ways You Can Help 
If you could please share this page with your friends, parents, teachers or anyone who can, and please know it would mean the world to me. Any amount of sponsorship will greatly assist me to participate in this life-changing experience.

story:
***STARTING NOW, EVERYONE WHO CONTRIBUTES WILL RECIEVE AN MP3 OF MY NEW SINGLE "TAKING YOU OUT"!!!***


WHO I AM:

I am a SingerSongwriter/Producer/Arranger and Visual Artist originally from the beautiful east coast province of Nova Scotia, Canada, I have toured internationally, written and licensed music to films, television shows, radio and TV commercials and theatrical performances, and have released four records to date. Three and a half years ago, I moved to Innsbruck, Austria to spend time exploring Europe, to challenge myself artistically and personally, and to satisfy my urge for change. And as often is the case with such big moves, love was also a catalyst.

During this time, I have experienced some of my highest highs and lowest lows, most of which I have captured in my songwriting. I HAVE FELT LIKE A SAILOR, NAVIGATING MY SHIP THROUGH BOTH TURBULENT AND CALM WATERS; RIDING THE WAVES OF NEW BEGINNINGS AND ENDS. 

And now I would like to share these feelings and experiences with you in the form of a new full-length album.


THE NEW ALBUM:

As mentioned in the video above, mountains, water, travel, love, loss and light all play a part in the new songs. They range from tearjerkers to footstompers, and are more emotionally charged than any of my previous work. Generally, the record will also be more upbeat than my last efforts, and will lean towards a pop-rock direction.

I will produce the songs with the help of my incredible band of handsome Austrians. They are highly respected and sought-after professionals who I am thrilled to have been working with for over two years now. They bring a new energy to my music, and it will be such a treat to finally capture our live band sound on the album.

THE BAND:

(from left to right)

Andreas Wallner - electric guitar, acoustic guitar

Chris Vano - piano, keys, synthesizers

Me - acoustic guitar, vocals

Andi Senn - drums, percussion

Wolfgang Henn - electric bass, double bass


We will make the record in October at Inntime Studio in Mils, Austria with the help of sound engineer extraordinaire, Stefan Wolf. Stefan is passionate about capturing the songs and providing the utmost quality in the album's overall tone.

And I am pleased to announce that the album will be released in Europe on LEASH THE DOGS RECORDS,  a boutique label recently formed by the team at Inntime Studio. Combined, they have decades of experience working on major label and independent musical projects, including their own formidable touring and recording careers. My consultant and co-manager, the brilliant Sebastian Obermeir, will also be on-board during this process. I am extremely grateful to all for their support. The album will also be released in Canada, and worldwide via online platforms.


WHO YOU ARE AND WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS MEAN:

You are friends and family and fans, both familiar and new, and I adore you. Your contributions will pay for the studio time, the engineer, the musicians, and the mixing and mastering of my new record. All of these things cost considerable amounts of money and time. When the funding goal of $7000 is reached, I will be able to see the recording to completion, and realize a dream of mine to make this new album here in Austria with my amazing band. Should your contributions go above and beyond the goal, they will be applied to the costs of manufacturing physical copies, and to marketing and promotion.

I am offering PERKS/INCENTIVES in return for your funding! Please find them listed on the right portion of this page.

An alternative way to see my campaign succeed is to PLEASE HELP SPREAD THE WORD. Sharing it word-of-mouth and on your Facebook and Twitter will go a long way.

THIS SHIP WILL SAIL STRAIGHT TOWARDS MAKING A NEW RECORD, THANKS TO YOU. I AM HUMBLED AND FOREVER GRATEFUL FOR YOUR SUPPORT. ALL ABOARD! LET'S SET SAIL.

Special thanks to Sebastian Obermeir, Joe Auer, Stephan Gerber, Christina Martin, Dale Murray, Erin Costelo, my band, and Leash The Dogs Records for their help with creating this campaign.

story:
Some Background

My name is Danielle March, I am yoga, meditation teacher and spiritual life coach. In short, I am passionate about inspiring people to figure out what 's important to them and designing a life of purpose, presence + abundance. For nearly a decade, I've been introducing my private clients and students to the superpowers of meditation and now I am ready to spread these teachings virtually, beyond borders.

Simply, this project is about slowing down. When we seek stillness, we find truth. My goal is to raise enough funds to record a soulful album of unique and inspired guided meditations (8 - 10 tracks), designed as a curriculum to help you develop and deepen your meditation practice. The album will be accompanied by worksheets and journal prompts to take you from practice to inquiry and finally towards clarity. 


The Ask

I am seeking $3000 CAD which will to go towards research, creative and production costs. I've put together some great perks to deliver immediate value to you as soon as you donate. A $20 donation will get you an immediate download of my newest guided meditation. It's magical, really. If you'd like to donate more, a $50 donation will secure you an advance digital versions of the album (estimated Oct 2015). I'm also excited to offer a limited number of opportunities to work with me one-on-one to design your own personalized meditation with a donation of $108!

This is a passion project and I am coming from a place of service so in the event I don't reach my goal, I am STILL DOING THIS. And, for every dollar raised in excess of my goal, I will donate a copy of my album.


    Your Impact

    This is a very special project, and I'll be delivering never released custom content so I want to be clear about a few things:

    1 - This project will change many lives.

    2 - Meditation has the unlimited potential of transforming YOUR life.


    Final Words

    It's no coincidence that you are here.  Thank you for trusting me, now it's time to lean in to the present moment.

story:
Whether you’re a music maker or a devoted listener, we all have one thing in common: that moment when music makes its forever home in your soul. We are looking for 1,000 music lovers to pay tribute to the individual who made that moment possible plus give you an opportunity to pay it forward to inspire others. Ready to start a movement without breaking the bank? You can play a vital role in our arts community, a donation of only $10 helps keep the music playing. All donors will be recognized on the back of our 2015-2016 season programs. If you wish to contribute more we would like to thank you with some great gifts of music. You can also boost the impact of your donation by sharing our campaign with other music lovers on Facebook and Twitter. We urge you to team up with ProMusica AZ so we can continue to create musical inspiration in our community.

It’s about time you thanked Mrs. Nichols your 4th grade choir teacher. Or your Mom for always playing the classics. Or The Jackson 5. Or even One Direction. Whoever it was, show your gratitude and continue to inspire others! Because, “Without music life would be a mistake.” ~composer Friedrich Nietzsche

Who are we?

ProMusica Arizona's mission is to enrich lives in the Greater Phoenix Area through innovative, joint performances of its multigenerational chorale and orchestra. Since its founding in 2003, ProMusica Arizona (PMAZ) Chorale and Orchestra has become a leader in bringing live music to audiences in the Greater Phoenix Area. Innovation and variety characterize the group which includes musical genres ranging from classical to contemporary, Broadway favorites and creative collaborations with partners such as Video Games Live™. In 2015 and beyond, PMAZ will continue to provide a performance home for local talent and bring live music at affordable ticket prices to audiences of all ages.

ProMusica Arizona Chorale & Orchestra is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization

story:
Founded in the summer of 1997, New York-based industrial music label ANNIHILVS POWER ELECTRONIX has been organising live events in NYC since 1998. In June 2005, the label curated the very first APEX FEST in Brooklyn. Since then, APEX FEST has returned to NYC every two years, to bring to the stage an exciting cross section of artists from around the world. In 2013, we took the fest on the road, doing shows in Massachusetts and Rhode Island before the two-day main event in NYC. This time, we've expanded to more cities and more days in New York, making this our biggest event yet.

"The lineup for APEX FEST VI — the sixth biennial installation of the apocalyptic music event — has been finalized, the festival to bring three full days of audio tumult to NYC and now, far beyond, as tours surrounding the festival are actively being confirmed throughout the Northeastern US. Additionally, fest preorder bundles have been released, which include limited edition shirts for GNAW THEIR TONGUES and THE BODY, as well as a compilation CD featuring tracks (many of them exclusive) from the majority of the fest lineup. These sales go directly toward funding the event, meaning attendees are active participants in the production of the festival."

(via EARSPLIT PR)


BUT — there are still more expenses than what these presales will cover, and we could use some help along the road.
We'll be renting a van from May 27 to June 13, and traveling all around the east coast, from New York to Pawtucket, Rhode Island, down to Philadelphia and Baltimore, then back to New York for the three-day main event. After the fest in New York, we head to Philadelphia, then up to Providence and up to Montreal before this whole thing is over. Two tours and one three-day festival, spread over two weeks, will require a lot of gas, tolls, lodging and food expenses. While we're confident we'll make some cash along the way, many of these expenses will be up front, before a single show even takes place. Not to mention, we're flying a whole bunch of Europeans over here to play the US for the first time ever.

What we're looking for here is help from people who don't plan on attending — whether it's because you're not able to get the time off, because you're too far away, or simply too busy to make it to NYC or any of the other east coast destinations we'll be hitting along the way. If you're an advocate, ally, or devotee of obscure music, and you're willing to throw some cash our way, in return, we'll send you some stuff that you wouldn't otherwise have an opportunity to grab.

By the way, if you DO want to attend the festival, by all means head over to APEX ARMOURIES to purchase advance tickets.

We don't have corporate backers or an endless revenue stream. We do what we do out of a pure passion for this music, and at great personal expense. Most important are the friendships we make along the way; the longstanding, enduring relationships forged out of a common enthusiasm and fanaticism for sound. At times it can be a tremendous struggle, and we've been hesitant to use crowdfunding platforms out of a desire to remain independent, but this is by far our most ambitious undertaking in the label's long history of presenting live events, and we could definitely use some extra help.

We are looking to get software for recording and new VST and VSTi's.

After our computer was destroyed and the software we were using was out of date. We decided we need to get a few upgrades, if we are able to get more money we will be looking in a electric drum kit as well, and will be getting into doing shows again.


Past albums!

https://citizen16theband.bandcamp.com/album/construct

https://citizen16theband.bandcamp.com/album/temptation

Thank you all!

story:
Hi there! So, my name is CODI KAYE, I'm a singer/songwriter/guitarist (kind of) who could really use your help in releasing my debut album into the world! 

Since I was a little kiddy I have been creating poems and stories about all kinds of things! But when I was about 13, I wrote a song... a song that actually meant something. (WOW!) It was called 'Going Too Fast' and it was about a girl who didn't want to be pressured into anything sexual too early in her life, as she had a lot of seeing and experiencing to do before she wanted to delve into that world.

This song was the start for me, and I then continued to write songs about all kinds of things that were going on not only in my life but the people I saw, the people I knew and the things that were going on in the world that I had an opinion about.

Starstruck is a Hunter Schools Performing Arts Show. My song 'Show Your Love', that I originally auditioned for a solo with at Starstruck, was then chosen to be a featured song at Starstruck and was performed proudly by me at every show. That was a huge moment for me! It was the first time more than just my family were going to see my work and hear my voice! Up to 5,000 people a show, with 4 shows, it was an amazing experience and I'll never forget it! What came from this was a contact with someone who recorded a very generalised version of my song 'Going Too Fast'. After that I decided that my songwriting was something that I really wanted to keep impressing people with.


So I kept writing songs, talking to my family about the day I would supposedly become a big professional and be able to change the world. How young and naive I was - or so I thought. It wasn't until a couple of years ago in April, that I recorded a song I'd recently written about bullying called 'You're Not Innocent' and uploaded it to Facebook as a tester to see whether I should put my stuff on YouTube or not. The song's meaning is to make people aware of what they're saying or doing to others before it gets to a point where an apology can't fix anything. Funnily enough, this song went viral  and after putting it on YouTube and watching it over the past two years, it now has over 650,000 views and has been recorded in a studio and is up on iTunes! It's a massive achievement for me and I'm very proud of myself.
If you'd like to buy the song or hear the recorded version visit this link (or type Codi Kaye You're Not Innocent into your iTunes Store! 

https://itunes.apple.com/au/album/youre-not-innocent-single/id904040112


But here is a summary of what people have been saying. There have been numerous comments, all wonderful, and a lot of them explaining their own experiences with bullying but what really amazed me was the amount of comments that had stated this song, MY SONG, had stopped them from both self harming and bullying and had even encouraged some to speak up about themselves or others being bullied. A few comments taken from youtube:

"This song saved my life tonight…….”

"this song has saved my life”

"U really changed my life thank you “

“This song made me stop self harming it just proves that I’m not alone and there are other people in my shoes too, and it also tell me to ignore the bullies cuz they will end up feeling guilty”

“You thought (taught) me how to stand up for other people”

The outcome was more than I ever could have imagined and that is why I am here today asking for your generosity!

'You're Not Innocent' was the first of many songs I have written and uploaded to YouTube. Most of my songs explore social issues such as domestic violence, sexual harassment/rape, mental health issues especially surrounding that of low self esteem and I even delve into the good old heartbreak. I've got a load of songs not yet uploaded to YouTube that I will definitely be making a goal within the next few months. These songs explore growing up, the horrible toll of a terminal illness such as cancer, and discovering who I am. 
This is one of my most recent originals, about how a lot of women and men are sexually abused - and that it's not a matter of how you dress or present yourself, it can happen to even the most conservative of people.



My music is super indie folk/soul/acoustic-like (or that's how I'm hoping it will be) and my motives are to help people all around the world relate to music and for my songs to speak out about the things that they may be too scared to say for themselves! 
One of my proudest moments so far, was a girl who has a special connection to my song 'You're Not Innocent' actually got the name of the song and my name tattooed on her back. (It wasn't me, I promise)



These songs are my entire world and they mean so much to me, and as I've witnessed, they now mean so much to the people who have listened, and can relate to them.

My goal, and my potential career, that I would more than anything love to achieve is to be touring around the world in a big tour bus singing the songs I've put priceless effort into and hopefully changing people's lives for the better, as well as producing good music.

Obviously you guys aren't able to get me the whole way, but if you have read this far then I hope it's because you are interested in what I would like to do in my life. What you can help me with, is donating as much as you feel necessary or I deserve for my cause, so that I can record and distribute my songs and get them out and into the world! This would help me so much because as I mentioned before, I'm only 18! I don't have 20k stashed away in my bank! I am trying to save money of my own for this, as performing/busking is currently my job, but if you guys could help with the rest I would appreciate it more than you could imagine!

This money would go towards studio time to record my debut album, distributing the album onto CDs and releasing it in as many places as possible. It would also go towards getting them onto places like iTunes and Amazon, and to promoting both my YouTube and my Facebook pages where I do my best to help people personally as well as with my music. Leftover money will go towards funding shows, merchandise or equipment to better my professionalism in this industry.

There aren't many artists out there these days with so much meaning to their music, it's quickly becoming an industry consumed by making money. (This is ironic as I am asking you for money.) But as much as starting out costs a lot my goal isn't to be rich, my goal is to help people all around the world, with something all humans have in common, a love for music!

Please allow me this chance! :)

You can visit my youtube/facebook/ instagram and twitter accounts by clicking on these links, if you'd like to delve a bit more into what I do!
YOUTUBE: https://www.youtube.com/user/missblueeyes131

FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/MyCodiKaye

INSTAGRAM: https://instagram.com/codikaye_official/

TWITTER: https://www.twitter.com/mycodikaye
 

SOUNDCLOUD: http://www.soundcloud.com/codikaye


Thank you for your time! 

Codi Kaye xxx






All perks are at the discretion of Codi Kaye and her management team.
story_txt:
Hi there! So, my name is CODI KAYE, I'm a singer/songwriter/guitarist (kind of) who could really use your help in releasing my debut album into the world! Since I was a little kiddy I have been creating poems and stories about all kinds of things! But when I was about 13, I wrote a song... a song that actually meant something. (WOW!) It was called 'Going Too Fast' and it was about a girl who didn't want to be pressured into anything sexual too early in her life, as she had a lot of seeing and experiencing to do before she wanted to delve into that world.
This song was the start for me, and I then continued to write songs about all kinds of things that were going on not only in my life but the people I saw, the people I knew and the things that were going on in the world that I had an opinion about.Starstruck is a Hunter Schools Performing Arts Show. My song 'Show Your Love', that I originally auditioned for a solo with at Starstruck, was then chosen to be a featured song at Starstruck and was performed proudly by me at every show. That was a huge moment for me! It was the first time more than just my family were going to see my work and hear my voice! Up to 5,000 people a show, with 4 shows, it was an amazing experience and I'll never forget it! What came from this was a contact with someone who recorded a very generalised version of my song 'Going Too Fast'. After that I decided that my songwriting was something that I really wanted to keep impressing people with.



So I kept writing songs, talking to my family about the day I would supposedly become a big professional and be able to change the world. How young and naive I was - or so I thought. It wasn't until a couple of years ago in April, that I recorded a song I'd recently written about bullying called 'You're Not Innocent' and uploaded it to Facebook as a tester to see whether I should put my stuff on YouTube or not. The song's meaning is to make people aware of what they're saying or doing to others before it gets to a point where an apology can't fix anything. Funnily enough, this song went viral  and after putting it on YouTube and watching it over the past two years, it now has over 650,000 views and has been recorded in a studio and is up on iTunes! It's a massive achievement for me and I'm very proud of myself.
If you'd like to buy the song or hear the recorded version visit this link (or type Codi Kaye You're Not Innocent into your iTunes Store! 

https://itunes.apple.com/au/album/youre-not-innocent-single/id904040112





But here is a summary of what people have been saying. There have been numerous comments, all wonderful, and a lot of them explaining their own experiences with bullying but what really amazed me was the amount of comments that had stated this song, MY SONG, had stopped them from both self harming and bullying and had even encouraged some to speak up about themselves or others being bullied. A few comments taken from youtube:

"This song saved my life tonight…….”
"this song has saved my life”
"U really changed my life thank you “
“This song made me stop self harming it just proves that I’m not alone and there are other people in my shoes too, and it also tell me to ignore the bullies cuz they will end up feeling guilty”
“You thought (taught) me how to stand up for other people”

The outcome was more than I ever could have imagined and that is why I am here today asking for your generosity!


'You're Not Innocent' was the first of many songs I have written and uploaded to YouTube. Most of my songs explore social issues such as domestic violence, sexual harassment/rape, mental health issues especially surrounding that of low self esteem and I even delve into the good old heartbreak. I've got a load of songs not yet uploaded to YouTube that I will definitely be making a goal within the next few months. These songs explore growing up, the horrible toll of a terminal illness such as cancer, and discovering who I am. 
This is one of my most recent originals, about how a lot of women and men are sexually abused - and that it's not a matter of how you dress or present yourself, it can happen to even the most conservative of people.


My music is super indie folk/soul/acoustic-like (or that's how I'm hoping it will be) and my motives are to help people all around the world relate to music and for my songs to speak out about the things that they may be too scared to say for themselves! 

One of my proudest moments so far, was a girl who has a special connection to my song 'You're Not Innocent' actually got the name of the song and my name tattooed on her back. (It wasn't me, I promise)



These songs are my entire world and they mean so much to me, and as I've witnessed, they now mean so much to the people who have listened, and can relate to them.My goal, and my potential career, that I would more than anything love to achieve is to be touring around the world in a big tour bus singing the songs I've put priceless effort into and hopefully changing people's lives for the better, as well as producing good music.Obviously you guys aren't able to get me the whole way, but if you have read this far then I hope it's because you are interested in what I would like to do in my life. What you can help me with, is donating as much as you feel necessary or I deserve for my cause, so that I can record and distribute my songs and get them out and into the world! This would help me so much because as I mentioned before, I'm only 18! I don't have 20k stashed away in my bank! I am trying to save money of my own for this, as performing/busking is currently my job, but if you guys could help with the rest I would appreciate it more than you could imagine!

This money would go towards studio time to record my debut album, distributing the album onto CDs and releasing it in as many places as possible. It would also go towards getting them onto places like iTunes and Amazon, and to promoting both my YouTube and my Facebook pages where I do my best to help people personally as well as with my music. Leftover money will go towards funding shows, merchandise or equipment to better my professionalism in this industry.There aren't many artists out there these days with so much meaning to their music, it's quickly becoming an industry consumed by making money. (This is ironic as I am asking you for money.) But as much as starting out costs a lot my goal isn't to be rich, my goal is to help people all around the world, with something all humans have in common, a love for music!Please allow me this chance! :)You can visit my youtube/facebook/ instagram and twitter accounts by clicking on these links, if you'd like to delve a bit more into what I do!

YOUTUBE: https://www.youtube.com/user/missblueeyes131



FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/MyCodiKaye



INSTAGRAM: https://instagram.com/codikaye_official/



TWITTER: https://www.twitter.com/mycodikaye


 

SOUNDCLOUD: http://www.soundcloud.com/codikaye



Thank you for your time! 

Codi Kaye xxx
















All perks are at the discretion of Codi Kaye and her management team.

story:
Hey everyone!  We are very excited to finally release a new full length album.  Its been a long journey with lots of ups and downs and the time is upon us.  The recording, mixing, and mastering has been self funded up to this point.  We just need a little more to finish the mixing, mastering, and production of the album.  That is why we are reaching out to you.

We have put a lot of work into recording the new album and we want to put out the best quality that we can.  $1500 is the amount left that we need to be able to put out a product that meets our expectations.  We have invested in our own studio where we have done the recording.  Everything is being mixed and mastered locally to support our friends and peers.  Your contribution will ensure that the album will be released on time and at the highest quality possible.

We have released 2 EPs and 1 full length.  Next year is the 10th year the band has existed and we want to celebrate by putting out something special.  If you want to hear some of the songs that will be on the album you can go to www.shadesofsorrow.bandcamp.com.

If you are unable to contribute we hope that you can share and promote this campaign.  Any little bit helps.  Thank you so much.

story:
Radikal Nation is the brand new dance/pop/hip hop/edm album set to release this Fall! I'm so excited for you to be a huge part of it! Just a few of the song titles include:  Alive (feat. Christon Gray), Aye Dios Mio (feat. Promise, Da Truth), Alone Tonight (feat. Sevin, Bizzle), What's Good (feat. Pettidee, GRITS), and Summer Time Remix (feat. Dee-1, Kela). This record has been the biggest fight naturally and spiritually just to complete, and I can honestly say that my wife and I have completely given it our all, believed God, and exhausted every resource possible to do this on our own.  However, we realize that to finish and to do so with  EXCELLENCE we can not do this without YOUR HELP! 

Being behind the scenes in the music industry for most of my career, I have found that certain things are critical and necessary in effectively releasing an album; radio play being a big one.  But since we have exhausted all of our personal resources (over $30,000 in production, recording studio costs, music videos, photo shoots, radio promotion) we have run out of budget and we are now trusting God to bring the people alongside of us to help us with the remaining $15,000 that is needed to release this project in a way that has never been done before!

So Instead of giving up or signing with a major label, only to be controlled by what they want me to record and produce, I’m turning to YOU, my listeners, my family, my friends, and my fans!  I'm humbly asking each and every one of you to be apart of this vision and to partner with me to help push this record across the finish line with excellence!. For those of you who have run with me this far, it's my hope and my prayer that I've earned your trust, respect and your high expectations.

For all the sweat and tears in the making of this project, I have watched God show up and do what He does best; the impossible. I'm believing for an even a greater measure of breakthrough to be released through these songs to you. And I am confident now more than ever that this project is by far - a GAME CHANGING RECORD THAT WILL IMPACT SO MANY LIVES!  I want you to be right there with me shouting victory together, as we watch the IMPOSSIBLE HAPPEN!! 

Now is your chance to BE APART AND PARTNER with us by pre-ordering Radikal Nation and/or other goods offered and please please share this with your friends!

All funds raised for this project will go towards radio promotion, web advertising, photo shoots,  tour costs, music videos, CD manufacturing, PR, art design and remixing. The more you give, the more people we can reach and make history! We want so much for all of you to feel like you are a part of this project so we have also included exciting exclusive incentives. We hope they get you pumped!

This is a total God thing and this vision is bigger than I can handle I NEED YOU!!!  EVERY LITTLE BIT HELPS AND NOTHING IS TOO SMALL!!  IF EVERYONE GIVES SOMETHING THIS GOAL WILL HAPPEN!!

Awaken that Nation that lives inside of YOU!! #RadikalNation

Blessings to you,
Radikal Hughes

story:
Our Mission

Since artistic performance received constitutional protection in the New York City subway on September 10, 1985, buskers have thrilled millions of riders. It's time to recognize their gift to New York through a public festival in August, 2015.

Hosted with the support of Council Member Robert Cornegy, Jr. in Brooklyn's Herbert Von King Park, this festival will gather performers for an afternoon and evening of music and support of subway art.

What We Need; What You Get

The funding will go largely to festival expenses, like flyers, permits, most of all, pay for our performers. Still, we've budgeted for some cool rewards for our backers, including hand-printed t-shirts and CDs:


Examples of some of the rewards available.

The Impact

Your contribution connects performers with an appreciative audience -- AND it helps further raise awareness that busking has been proud and legal for 30 years.

That matters, since too many performers are still wrongfully arrested, ticketed, and ejected for legal performances.

Risks & Challenges

We are fortunate to have the work of Isadora Frost, our part-time event coordinator, in putting this festival together. We're confident that with her support, the festival will be a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are many ways help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out
  • Share our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and beyond
  • Volunteer to make the festival a reality!

Thanks again -- and see you there.

story:
ProFoundMusicGroup:4DaLove

The Background Story:

Widely considered as one of the underground's finest, Profound is finally ready to release his first full length project. Originally from Bolingbrook, Illinois (a suburb of Chicago) Profound would make the 30 mile trip to the city almost daily to perfect his craft. In the exclusive world that was Chicago underground hip-hop Profound was able to make his mark with a mix of heartfelt performances, witty freestyles and absolute deadly battle rhymes. At the time Profound had become just as recognized and demanded as his then counterparts Juice and Rhymefest. This led to a number of guest verses and 12 inch singles that began what was sure to be a promising career. In addition to his rise as an underground legend Profound entered  in and won the first MTV online Emcee contest where voters from around the world voted for and named him the winner. The prize: A single deal with Loud Records who at the time was the premier Hip-hop label with artists such Wu-Tang Clan, Mobb Deep and the Akaholiks on their roster. 

Profound flew to New York with his manager to meet with Steve Rifkin and the Loud staff who instantly recognized the talent and negotiations began to extend his deal to a full album option. This was hip-hop heaven! Then it went left almost as fast as it had happened to begin with. Loud Records parted ways with thier distribution partner (RCA) and began negotiations with Sony. At this time Steve Rifkind informed Profound he couldn't promise anything with the new deal as the particulars were still being worked out. Profound had a tough decision to make, wait it out with no guarantees or take a cash buyout of 50k with the option to revisit a record deal once the dust had settled. It goes without saying he opted for the cash. A decision he still regrets to this day, but has learned a great deal from.

The Mission:

During his ten year hiatus from the scene Profound has been raising his children and continuing to hone his skills as an Emcee and producer. He also kept a regular schedule at the studio along with producer partner and longtime engineer Geno of the Rec Center Crew. In 2014 Profound decided that he would re-dedicate himself fully to hip-hop once more. This decision was enhanced greatly when he was contacted by the Theare (pronounced like Theory) Group to participate in the Midway Documentary: A history of Chicago hip-hop. The call couldn't have come at a better time,with personal conflicts swirling and his father having just passed in August 2014 Profound was once again looking for inspiration. 

The inspiration is and always has been the music and it will continue to be.It would be so much love to hit our goal, but we have no problem grinding this thing out and building up our situation one at a time. Thanks to everybody who has supported over the years and has been an inspiration to keep this dream alive. 97.

story:
/ Release the Dreamers /

Thanks so much for checking out our page! This album has been on my heart for many years and I am so excited to be launching it as a crowd funding project. "Release the Dreamers" is a 5 song collection of original tunes written over the past few years. And what an incredible few years it has been for our family. We would love for you to consider partnering with us to see this project completed. Be a part of dreamers being released!

- Chris

story:
Short Summary

Hi my name is Kayla Jay and I'm an indie R&B/Pop musician. I'm also a singer/songwriter and producer, so overall I love everything about music! If you'd like to read my full bio, please head on over to my website.

Today i'm asking for your help in raising funds to shoot a music video for my single Place My Bets. As an indie artist, it is tough getting exposure to share your music with a wider audience. Having good, quality music videos available help generate interest in you and your music. However they do not come cheap. I was fortunate to have the right people around me to help make my last music video for practically nothing. 


If you choose to fund my campaign, the funds you help me raise will go a long way to help produce, edit, and promote this video. Increasing my exposure to the world, and also allowing me to continue to put out music you like. I understand that even asking for a dollar is not easy, but please know that I truly appreciate anything that you contribute as I know that you have many more causes that you could support. So from me to you, I offer a heartfelt thank you for even considering me.

What We Need & What You Get

    I've never created a campaign like this before, but after doing much needed research I found that I can create the video I'd like to present for about $5,000. I am looking to really improve the production quality of the video. The concept will include dancers, fast cars, and will have a strong thematic view of women. Anything accrued here will be amazingly helpful in making this video complete! If you help fund this project , you could receive the following depending on what perk you choose.

  • An mp3 copy of Place My Bets
  • Kayla Jay Stickers
  • A signed CD of my first EP "Sleeping with the Enemy"
  • A live stream performance of Place My Bets and more
  • Executive Producer credit on the music video

About $2,000 will be used to hire the videographers and production company so that the video has a great HD look and feel. We expect that hiring actors, makeup, outfit rentals, and location rentals will be another $2,000. That last $1,000 and my personal funds will be used to send the music video out for distribution to networks such as MTV, VH1, RevoltTV, and as many more as we can afford.

The Impact

This project is really important to me because I want to help people understand that you can learn to love again. Even if you feel like the last time your soul was crushed because of love, it doesn't mean that the next time love will end up being the same. It's important to be able to trust yourself and trust that there is real love out there for you.

My previous video for "I Don't Care" is seeing some small success. But the song itself has received overwhelming support and i'm grateful for that. I believe in this song and project and want to bring that message to a larger audience.

No project is without complications, but I'm confident that the crew I plan to hire is more than capable of delivering a music video that you and I will love. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've made it this far, and you want to help, I truly appreciate it! You can help me out by doing some, if not all of the following:

  • Please share my Indiegogo campaign with your friends and on all of your social media pages and tag me in your share! Twitter: @TrueKaylaJay Facebook: Kayla Jay Music
  • Please utilize the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Please watch and subscribe to my other videos on my Youtube Channel or on Vevo!
  • Please purchase my existing music from your favorite music store such as iTunes, Google Play, and Amazon Music. My music is also available to stream on places like Spotify!

I really hope that I have gained your support! Thank you so much for you time!

That last $1,000 and my personal funds will be used to send the music video out for distribution to networks such as MTV, VH1, RevoltTV, and as many more as we can afford.
    The Impact This project is really important to me because I want to help people understand that you can learn to love again. Even if you feel like the last time your soul was crushed because of love, it doesn't mean that the next time love will end up being the same. It's important to be able to trust yourself and trust that there is real love out there for you.
My previous video for "I Don't Care" is seeing some small success. But the song itself has received overwhelming support and i'm grateful for that. I believe in this song and project and want to bring that message to a larger audience.
 No project is without complications, but I'm confident that the crew I plan to hire is more than capable of delivering a music video that you and I will love. 
    Other Ways You Can Help If you've made it this far, and you want to help, I truly appreciate it! You can help me out by doing some, if not all of the following:  Please share my Indiegogo campaign with your friends and on all of your social media pages and tag me in your share! Twitter: @TrueKaylaJay Facebook: Kayla Jay Music
 Please utilize the Indiegogo share tools!
Please watch and subscribe to my other videos on my Youtube Channel or on Vevo!
Please purchase my existing music from your favorite music store such as iTunes, Google Play, and Amazon Music. My music is also available to stream on places like Spotify!   I really hope that I have gained your support! Thank you so much for you time!

story:
The "Mindful Heart" Album

My name is Andy Shaw, and I'm making a record. 

In January of 2014 I made it a mission to go into the recording studio to record a full length album of unreleased material. Some of the songs I've performed in Andy Shaw Band and Shaw Brothers, while a few of them have never been performed.  After going into the studio I quickly realized the excitement of seeing these songs come together, and couldn't wait to share what I was working on. It was also a true pleasure to work with engineer Chad Loughrige, as well as all of the musicians who performed on the album.


Now that the record is nearing it's end, I need your help releasing it! The friends, family, and supporters in my life mean everything to me, and I really look forward to sharing this with you.  I just need a little bit of support to help me get this record out.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise at least half of the money of the total cost. This will go towards paying for the following things.

  • Recording, Mixing, and Mastering costs - I really loved recording this record, and I ended up spending over a hundred hours on recording, mixing, and mastering. Needless to say, it all adds up, but the skills of the individuals I worked with made it all worthwhile. (Est cost to date: $2,500-$3,000)
  • Art Work - Album design, Poster design, and Photography (Est cost: $300)

  • Album Pressing - 500 albums (Est Cost: $1,200)

Total Cost of above: $4,000-$4,500

Contributors

I want to give a big thanks to the following people that contributed to the album:

Violin- Chris Shaw

Cello (Hold On Tight, The Way, See What This Was)- Sam Kristoff

Cello (Younger Man's Rule)- Mary Featherstone

Bass- Matt Paetsch

Additional Vocals- Christy DeVos

Piano- Christy DeVos

Additional Percussion- Chad Lougrighe

Engineered, and Mixed By- Chad Lougrighe

Mastered By- Steve Thomas

Photography By- Chris Marshall

Artwork By- Donnie Mossman

story:
The Solid Suns...

We are a funky, blues-infested rock trio from Las Vegas, Nevada. Formed in the desert heat, we've been playing music together for almost four years now. Through the kindness and generosity of our fans and supporters, we've been able to accomplish some amazing things in these past few years.

Our love for music and the support of people like you gave us the opportunity to record two full-length studio albums and play shows at amazing venues like the House of Blues and Hard Rock Cafe on the world-famous Las Vegas Strip.

After recording two albums in two years, we decided to take our time with the third. We've spent the last year and a half writing songs for what would eventually become known as Ungodly Hour. However, we can't make this album a reality without your help.

Ungodly Hour...

A nod to the creative process, Ungodly Hour is our most ambitious project yet. Besides recording costs, we'd also like to raise money to launch a new look and visual direction for the band. This includes a new logo and merchandise for our fans. Here is a breakdown of our fundraising goal:

  • $5,000 for studio recording costs
  • $650 for new merchandise and logo redesign
  • $350 for manufacturing physical copies of the album

How you can help...

Without you, this won't happen. We've done our best to set up the incentives more like a pre-order system. You can score yourself digital and physical copies of Ungodly Hour, as well as our first two studio albums. The more you contribute, the more you get and the more it helps us reach our goal. Along with music and merch, we also have some lofty incentives such as private shows and spending a day in Vegas with us. 

Even if you don't have any money to contribute, you can still help. Please consider sharing this campaign and our music with someone you know.

Thank You!

Jon, Jim, and Brian

story:
Hello friends and contributors!

We are DAYWRECKER. A metal band that is just trying to make a our dream a reality from Myrtle Beach South Carolina. We are comprised of 4 guys and a chick. With many lineup changes I think we finally found the right group.  We are all from all over the United States and influenced from everything from Zappa, Meshuggah, Tool, Slayer, Lamb of God, Candiria to Sepultura. Oh, and Huey Lewis and the News...Can't ever forget them.
We are starting this campaign in order to make this dream happen.  We did a mini tour a month ago and got the taste of what we really want. We did a few shows with Crowbar, Unearth, Black Crown Initiate and Crobot.  We have Coal Chamber, Filter, American Headcharge and Combichrist coming up April 8th in Charlotte N.C. at the Filmore.  We want to be prepared and have our cd done and merchandise.  We are already looking to hit the road in the summertime. We require a vehicle, merchandise, cds and promotions to make this happen.  We are trying to obviously work and save ourselves but the extra expenses with our regular living is slowly killing us.
We have plans to travel to New Orleans the end of March to record our full length cd and shoot a video which obviously costs a pretty penny to travel down there.  We have chosen this route because of the situation it puts it in and as well as recording with a fantastic engineer and producer that have done well known bands. After the recording we travel to Charlotte to play with Coal Chamber.  We are planning in July to tour from S.C. To N.Y. To Ohio and back down to S.C.  We are willing to keep working and touring and getting our music out there as we are all dedicated to do so.

We obviously will have perks available for people that are going to contribute.

You can check our Facebook as we post constantly as our updates seem to change for the greater good.

WWW.FACEBOOK.COM/DAYWRECKERBAND

AND REVERBATION WWW.REVERBNATION.COM/DAYWRECKER08

WHAT WE NEED:

We need funding for the Cd and video shoot and the travel to New orleans.  We need to get a van for the touring we will be doing in the summertime and the weekend warrior mini tours beforehand. We need merchandise for perks and for when we hit the road and to sell on our website. The website which is another expense..We have purchased www.Daywreckerband.com

WHY WE WANT THIS:

We are all very passionate about the music and for this to happen.
We are putting our own money and tons of time into this project and failure is not an option.
We have already recorded one song where you can download from Reverbnation. We are getting played on a bunch of radio stations across the U.S. without a full record. Imagine what we(us and you guys) can conquer after we tour and have a full cd???? WE WANT YOU TO BE A PART OF THIS! 

Other Ways You Can Help

IF you are not in the position to contribute, please share this with your friends..on forums...through word of mouth, facebook, twitter, Facebook groups and instagram.
